title: Superbement situé dans Times Square et Broadway!!!
text:
Hotel superbement situé en plein coeur de Brodway et de Times Square. L’hotel a récemment rénové la grande majorité des étages. Les chambres, bien que petites, sont très confortables. Le petit déjeuner offert gratuitement est un copieux buffet complet avec ouefs brouillés ou en omelette, yaourt, saucisses et pommes de terre, pains et crêpes et gauffre avec café, jus.

Le personnel est courtois. Seul hic durant le séjour, la chambre ne fut pas nettoyés et les lits refaits.

Mais dans l’ensemble, un hotel à revoir et à revisité!

title: Wonderful NYC Stay!
text: Truly perfect location - wonderful stay!  The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of Broadway shows, restaurants, Times Square and subway stations.  The staff was welcoming and accommodating.  The lobby is very nice and doors are locked - no entry without a hotel key, which made us feel very safe.  The rooms were clean and roomy for New York with a small refrigerator for our use.  Very nice benefit was having a hot breakfast each day from 7:00 am - 10:00 a.m.  Would definitely stay here again!

title: Theatre District Location
text:
Stayed for a weekend night. Location is immediately int he middle of Times Square, smack in the middle of Broadway theatres. Room on high floor was quiet with nice city view. Rooftop observation deck is open 8am-8pm. Admittedly you can't see lights of times square at night but the hours make it hard to catch sun coming up or visit in the evening. 

Room was small but sufficient. Good bed linens, pillows and towels. 

Cleanliness could be better. Room was a little dusty with some flecks of things floating around on the floor. 

Not sure what was going on with coffee in the lobby but it was terrible. No flavored creamers to boot. 

Property is in line with other Hamptons in general. I have no issues staying here again.

title: Amazing hotel for first-timers to NYC!
text: This hotel was everything we could have wanted for our first trip to NYC. Conveniently located to Times Square and multiple subway lines, we never had any issues getting around. It was also so convenient to walk to and from our Broadway show! The staff at the hotel was amazing: Will and Jorge at breakfast were always so cheerful.and the front desk staff was always eager to help us get extra towels, a sewing kit--whatever we needed! The rooms were clean and the bed super comfortable. Despite being so close to the action, the rooms were quiet and I appreciated that we could open the window a little for fresh air. Breakfast always had lots of great options (hot and cold), though I do recommend trying to get down there before 8AM especially during peak travel times. Another added bonus is access to the roof: in the evenings, no one was out there so I was able to enjoy the sounds of the city with a hot tea before bed. I won't hesitate to recommend this hotel to any visitors to NYC, especially first timers. I'm so grateful to all of the staff who helped make our stay so lovely and comfortable. Thank you!!

title: Amazing Hotel In The Middle Of Times Square
text: This hotel is everything the good reviews said it was. Location is amazing, as you are in the middle of Times Square, close to everything including the Subway.  I got the City View King Room, and it was awesome seeing all the tall buildings , including the Empire State. The free breakfast was great, with a good variety of food.  All the staff, I mean every staff I came into contact with, were professional, kind, helpful and welcoming. Had many great laughs with the front desk staff. Eddy even arranged great car service to JFK.  The rooms are like new, but a bit small, hey its New York. Patience is needed waiting for the elevator, as it gets busy at times.  Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel, as it was just perfect for me, and really made my first trip to New York special.  I'll be back :)

title: Nice, centrally located hotel
text:
Front desk staff was helpful and friendly. Joseph the bellman was amazing providing great recommendations, ordering show tickets, and arranging airport transportation 
This is a very busy hotel. It can be challenging to get an elevator in the morning and breakfast buffet is definitely crowded during peak times. 
Hotel is very centrally located and is across street from subway and blocks from Times Square

title: A really pleasant stay
text:
I was a bit worried after reading some reviews but I have to say, I had a great experience. The staff were friendly and professional. The rooms were clean. Yes they were on the small side, but this hotel is bang in the middle of Times Square. You can't ask for a better location if you want to be close to everything! 

The breakfast is nothing to write home about but pleasant enough. Free coffee all day, and that's a nice extra. We also got to leave our suitcases for free on the last day while we did some final sightseeing. 

Yes there is a bit of a wait for the elevators but don't forget there are nearly 40 floors. Don't let this put you off. 

My tip, don't forget to check out the rooftop bar. The views are incredible and drinks are ace.

title: Great hotel filled with amazing staff!
text: I just spent four days at this lovely hotel with my college-aged daughter for her Spring Break. The staff should be the proto-type for customer service in the hotel industry. They were friendly, kind, helpful and fun! Literally everyone we encountered from the front-desk and security to the gentlemen who help with breakfast and the manager were kind and pleasant. The location was perfect for us. You are steps to Times Square and walking distance to so many attractions. Yes, there was some noise on the outside, but we just turned up our sound machine on our phones and made it work, but other than that we have zero complaints and would stay again! Appreciated their service so much!

title: Very well located, close to everything and very comfortable.
text: If you want to be located in Time Square, this hotel is ideal, it is three blocks away. We booked a room for 4 (we were a couple with two teenagers) and we were surprised by the size (very comfortable), for how small they usually are in NY. New, comfortable bathroom and updated furniture. In the hall there is always a large table with tea, coffee and flavored water. In the room there is a coffee maker and minibar. It is close to everything, with a subway connection on the corner, many places to dine around, simple and fast and others not so much, you have a choice. In the hotel hall there are two sections with tables and chairs that come in great to buy and eat there, those nights when you arrive dead from walking all day. A couple of nights we bought pizzas next to the hotel (spectacular) and ate there. The hotel also has a coin-operated laundry that solves the issue of clothes if you stay for several days. The breakfast for what they are in NY is very correct (eggs, sausages, yogurt, fruit, toast, cold cuts, donuts, coffee, tea, juices, etc.). The hotel is really very correct and very comfortable in every way.

title: Decent hotel but no way to leave
text: Comfortable hotel with friendly staff. Every morning when all guests are trying to leave, they take one elevator offline for staff. As a result, it takes 30 minutes to get downstairs from higher levels. You have to ride the elevator up, then ride down stopping at every floor along the way even though the elevator is already full. Would never stay here again.

title: In the midst of hustle and bustle of New York
text:
In the midst of hustle and bustle of New York

We stayed for 5 nights in March. We were looking for a fairly priced hotel with breakfast and easy access to everything NY has to offer. And that is what we got!

+ location just few steps away from Times Square
+ room was spacious
+ spacious walk-in shower 
+ polite staff
 
Breakfast is ok, bread, muffins, eggs, yoghurt  cereal etc. Coffee was good and staff cleaning tables quickly. Nothing special, but a good start for a day. 

Bed was comfy, but a bit dated. Room was cleaned everyday. 
 
Ask for a room away from elevator. Our room at 28th floor had a nice view with Empire State Building

title: Employees are so nice!
text: Shanay was this first smile I saw when I was there in NYC. She gave me some ideas for new places to enjoy. She is a Native New Yorker which helped ease my worry about not knowing the city. She really cared about my experience. I’ll be back! This location was great.

title: Safe, comfortable, and reasonable
text:
Quick one-night stay for Cherry Wonderdog at the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square Central. Even though prices in NYC are through the roof, what we paid (in points) at this hotel was quite reasonable compared to everything else. 

We walked here from Penn Station and had no security concerns whatsoever. Check-in was quick if not a bit robotic. Our room on the 28th floor had a nice view and even a window that opened to the outside. (It was limited to the width of a guinea pig to prevent injury or death). Plumbing worked well, and the Hilton standard bed was comfortable. The only issue was electrical – all the outlets on one side of the bed were inoperable as were all the USB connections in the room. The hotel actually compensated us a bit for this inconvenience. 

There was a nice outdoor look-out point a few floors above us, and the lobby downstairs was comfortable for those waiting for Ubers. Breakfast was the typical humdrum Hampton processed inedible grub, but at least it was included. There were a few water stations downstairs (one with orange slices) that made for a nice touch. All in all, a very good hotel in Times Square.

title: Perfect stay in the heart of Times Square
text: Enjoyed a wonderful 2 night stay! As soon as we walked in to the large inviting lobby we were greeted warmly by staff at front desk. They assisted with storing luggage and answering questions, always friendly and helpful with all our needs!.  There is a 24 hour service bar set up with coffee, tea and lemon water right there.  The rooms are quite roomy by Manhattan standards LOL. The included breakfast has a great selection of hot and cold food and the staff in the breakfast room was constantly cleaning the area and helping guests. Overall the entire hotel was spotless which to me is the most important thing.  The location perfect! A short walk to Penn, MSG, Grand Central and in the heart of Times Square and all the restaurants, shows, stores etc.

title: Definitely the best spot in the area
text: I haf an issue with the reservation and I dealt originally with Shane. He was understanding and patient, however when I called back the rep at that time gave completely different information which was incorrect.  I then called and spoke to Quinashia,  the supervisor.  She was awesome. She is the best customer service person I have dealt with in years. Not an understatement. She listened, didn't interrupt and took full responsibility. In addition she stated she would talk and train the person would made the error. Just so amazing at her approach and resolution to everything because in these times none of these customer service reps In the industry care anymore. Breakfast was great..great food choices at NO additional charge (rare). You do get a discount on parking.  I do wish they have valet but still a discount is helpful. Just a great place to stay and feel at home. I didn't love the beds and that was my only complaint,  however I have trouble sleeping anyway but I didn't feel the beds were extremely comfortable.

title: Great Bang for the Buck
text:
Let me preface this review by stating that I don't often stay at Hampton Inn properties these days. That's why I was rather surprised to be so impressed by his particular hotel. Not only was the room larger than I anticipated, the recognition of my loyalty was amply rewarded by a nice room upgrade and a generous snack basket with a personalized note left in my room. The unencumbered view of the Manhattan skyline from my room on the 29th floor was absolutely spectacular. Too often, NYC hotel room windows look directly onto adjacent buildings. 
Both the hard and soft products here were stellar. 
My room was pristine, and the decor much nicer than Hampton Inns I recall from from the distant past. I would imagine it is the template for new build Hampton Inns. The bathroom was large enough and featured a tub/shower combo. While some prefer a shower stall, this gives guests a choice should they wish to soak in a tub after a long day of sightseeing. The room was quiet enough to provide me with a night of uninterrupted sleep. I found the bed to be quite comfortable, but I'm not a particularly fussy sleeper. 
Although I was on the 29th floor, the three elevators provided fast and efficient travel to the lobby, even during breakfast hours. I never had to wait longer than two or three minutes. Frankly, that shocked me. Many hotels that are tall with few rooms per floor have problems keeping up with crowds using the elevators simultaneously. Perhaps I was just lucky.
Breakfast was also a cut above the usual 3 star offerings I've seen in the past. Fresh potatoes instead of the more common cardboard deep fried hash browns was a welcome change. The Sysco System type omelets, bread and pastries looked to be typical, though. There was some fresh fruit, such as apples and oranges. A couple of waffle makers were quite popular with many guests. I had no problem having my choice of seating at 07:45. There were plenty of vacant seats upon my departure at 08:30. Staff were proactively helpful throughout. Given my positive experience, I would have no hesitation returning again.

title: An affordable good quality choice given the location
text:
+Excellent location for Times Square access
+Security guard in the lobby
+A complimentary choice of drinking water, coffee and tea in the lobby.
+Functional fitness center
+Classic American breakfast
+The reception offered a flat rate car transfer to the airport
+No bugs in the room, we checked!

-No fridge in double rooms.

+-Room keys stopped working during stay, but staff kindly reactivated them.

title: Fabulous location and service!
text: On top of being the BEST location for Broadway lovers, this hotel has some of the most hospitable staff I've experienced anywhere in my 67 years of travel.  Shane at the front desk and Eddie as the bellman epitomize friendly professionalism and have seen to it that our stay here is enjoyable in every way.

title: Family stay in NY
text:
This is our second stay at this hotel - first stayed here in February 2023 and we rebooked based on our last experience and the location of this hotel.
Arrived at the hotel after a 7hr flight from UK. Warmly welcomed by Shane who took a real interest in us and what our plans were during our stay and gave us an overview of all the facilities. 
We were given a room on 29th floor with a city view which was great. The room looked like it had been newly decorated and the carpet had been replaced by flooring tiles.
It was Super Bowl night when we arrived so we just headed to MacDonalds for a quick takeaway back to our room. I can also recommend Carnegies a few doors up from the hotel for a great pizza 🍕 
Due to time difference we were up early and my husband and son made use of the gym facilities - can be found floor below reception.
Also there is an observation deck on 31 st floor open 8am- 8pm.
Our room had a safe, charging points, hairdryer and iron and in the bathroom there was soap shower gel shampoo body conditioner/lotion, tissues and plenty of towels. Just ask at reception if you need any more.
Also there is a target store in the next block if u have forgotten anything or like us want juice and snacks for the room.
Great location - there is a subway station at the next block and across the road and it covers most lines. We took the subway downtown to battery park and then one night we took the Q express to get to the Barclays Center in Brooklyn for a basketball game.
At the end of our trip Joseph took care of our luggage until our transport pick up at 330pm. No charge for this - another bonus.
We had breakfast included - this is served from 6am-10am.
Choice of yoghurts, cereals, fruit juices, hot oatmeal, waffle station - the cinnamon roll waffle flavour was my favourite 
Also hot stuff alternated each day - omelette or scrambled egg, bacon or sausage, crispy cubed potatoes
Also selection of bread and bagels and muffins with jam, cream cheese, Nutella, butter, and margarine 
We didn’t really experience any long waits for lifts.
Thank you for another great stay - hope to return soon

title: Correct
text: Ménage de la chambre fait normalement 1 jour sur 2 sauf que le 3ème jours toujours pas nettoyé et plus de serviettes de bains (nous étions 4). Nous sommes allez à la réception pour demander que la chambre soit faite. Le petit dejeuner : beaucoup de monde à tout heure . Il manque de place pour s'asseoir. . Sinon personnel sympathique,  l hôtel est vraiment proche de times square et du subway.

title: Georgy. Z
text: This place was anything short of amazing. The team is amazing!! everyone is welcoming. Each team member showed great work ability and was willing to help always. One that stood out the most was the night auditor Nashan, he was amazing great attitude and personality. If ever in New York I recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Preiswertes Cityhotel in Toplage
text:
Dieses Hotel bietet eindeutig mehr, als man erwarten würde. Trotz der sensationell guten Lage ist es ruhig, tadellos sauber, verfügt über viele und schnelle Lifte. Die Zimmer sind sinnvoll und praktisch eingerichtet und recht groß. Die Qualität der Betten lässt nichts zu wünschen übrig. Auch das Frühstück konnte überzeugen - von Ader Qualität und der Auswahl  der Speisen und Getränke und auch vom Platzangebot. Man kann Vieles zu Fuß erreichen, zudem sind viele U-Bahnen ums Eck. 
Alle Angestellten waren von einer natürlichen Freundlichkeit, man fühlt sich einfach wohl hier.

title: Prodigious
text: Lloyd was absolutely amazing. Extremely friendly and kind. It is refreshing to encounter such a nice human being. The rooms were clean and smelt remarkably fresh. The view was wonderful and the location of the Hilton is near EVERYTHING.  But most of all….  The one thing that stood out amongst everything else was Lloyd!

title: Wow!
text: Lloyd and staff at the front desk made our experience exceptional !  So friendly and welcoming and helpful with suggestions !  Top notch world class hospitality!!   We arrived early , Lloyd helped us streamline our check in process and had the floral arrangement waiting that our son in law had sent for our daughter to receive !  Kudos !

title: Pleasant Comfort
text: It was one of my most pleasant hotel experiences, especially in NYC! The staff overall seemed happy to see us and serve us, as needed. There was no charge for checking luggage. I particularly appreciated the access to the elevator using my room key.

title: Great place near Times Square attractions and bus terminal!
text: We stayed here for one night this past weekend.  Our room and the breakfast room were very clean,.  There was virtually no street noise in our 6th floor room . Comfortable beds, friendly and helpful staff,, good breakfast.  I will recommend this place to family and friends.

title: PERFECT LOCATION AND PRICE
text:
My family and I stayed at this hotel to attend Madonna's concert at the MSG. The location was perfect, walking distance to the main attractions such as Times Square, Broadway theaters,  Grand Central, etc. The room was spacious and clean with a great view and well stocked with toiletries.
The staff was very friendly and professional.
The breakfast was good with great coffee and a good variety of food.
Excellent choice for the price and location.  As a reference, Lyft from Newark Airport was about $60.00, and to La Guardia $55.00. Go to the roof for a great view of the city.

title: Terrible security, if they don't want that. Anyone who enters their room does not stay in this hotel.
text:
The worst experience, we booked for 3 you see us my family the last day I bought some AirPods Max at Apple and when we returned to the room I left the new headphones sealed since we would go out to dinner with some friends.
It took us 3 hours and when I returned someone had entered the room even when I had the sign not to enter and that person stole the new sealed AirPods Max, my Nintendo switch and thank God he did not take my laptop and a new 2k gaming laptop that I had bought new from Best Buy. And as it was the last day, we couldn't call the police 

And I start to think that if someone from my family would have stayed and see that a criminal enters the room when there is the sign of not entering, it could have been worse since someone from my family could have been injured, the worst security

title: Great stay.
text:
Myself and my 2 sisters stayed at this hotel mid December and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
Room was really spacious with 2 large beds,the room was cleaned every day and we had fresh towels every day too.
Hotel staff were lovely and friendly.
Lovely clean hotel and very quiet area which was good when sleeping.
Breakfast was good which set us up for the day and a good variety.
Walking distance to Grand central Empire State Building TOTR Bryant park 
and Macey’s  such a great location.
I would highly recommend!!

title: Good hotel in a Fantastic location
text: This hotel was what we expected from a Hampton Inn - clean room, basic amenities (soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, coffee/tea), and decent breakfast (cheese omelette, sausage, potatoes, yogurt, fruit, bagels, cereals, waffles, coffee & juices). The location can’t be beat - 41st street and 7th Avenue - just a couple blocks from the heart of Times Square! We had 10 minute walks to Broadway theaters and Bryant Park, and 15 minute walks to Grand Central Station and Radio City Music Hall. We were disappointed not to have a fridge in our room - so our leftovers were bad by morning. This was the main reason not to give 5 stars. Make sure to visit the roof (R in the elevator) for a wonderful view of the city.

title: First time to New York, easy place to stay
text: Great place to stay with free breakfast included. Conveniently located- able to walk to many places from here. Staff lovely. 2 huge comfy beds with good pillows. A shallow bath and shower with great hairdryer. A little shop and coffee area in lobby for snacks. There is a lounging area in lobby and small rooftop access open until 8.30. Great value

title: Great, we ready to return, very enjoyable
text: Perfect location and so easy to get to all parts of the city and many of the main tourist attractions.  We felt safe during our visit. Checking and everyone at the desk desl were great, the breakfast far exceeded our expectation and the people helping and taking care of everyone were outstanding. Our room was a little on the small side - hello New York but was clean and we always had what we need for our stay.

title: Staff and Location Phenomenal
text:
Met with Karen and discussed Hilton Rewards options. She is wonderful and was great with our family, especially our kids! 

Lloyd was great at check in and so helpful, just friendly and welcoming! 

Hotel was great for our stay and nearby everything.

title: posizione privilegiata
text:
Hotel centralissimo che permette di visitare midtown a piedi, inoltre  a due passi da una stazione metro (42st) - camere confortevoli e adeguate nelle dimensioni - bagno sufficientemente ampio e luminoso, privo di bidet - mancano ciabatte e accappatoio - vi consiglio le camere con numerazione dispari perchè danno sul cortile interno: non avete la vista ma il sonno ne guadagna. Al contrario l'affaccio sulla "street" delle camere pari, ai piani alti, ha una discreta vista, ma i rumori sottostanti non vengono adeguatamente filtrati dalle finestre. Il personale è cortese e disponibile, la hall piccola e spesso affollata. Tempi di attesa dell'ascensore (l'hotel ha 30 piani) ragionevoli. Colazione (in rapporto al costo) da dimenticare: troppo orientata sul cliente americano. Non ci sono problemi di quantità essendo a buffet, ma, ad esempio, la scelta dei dolci è molto limitata, il latte è solo freddo (dovete scaldarvelo al micro-onde) , un solo tipo di yogurt (che non è yogurt), ecc.
In conclusione la posizione è il "plus" dell'hotel, per il resto decisamente al di sotto delle aspettative in rapporto a quanto pagato.

title: Great Hotel Steps from Times Square
text: Amazing hotel with a great price and location! Blocks away from Times Square! Staff were very friendly and accommodating. Great for families, friends or a business trip. Definitely would recommend to anyone traveling to New York City. Would stay here again!

title: Staff became our NY family!
text: This Hampton Inn is a great find! Clean, quiet, FANTASTIC roof views and wonderful location! Next door to the Nederlander theater & less than 5 minute walk to Times Square, Bryant Park & the Subway.  A continental style breakfast is included which allowed a fast start to our day. The real gem of this hotel is the staff! They became family in just a couple of days! If something isn’t to your liking, just ASK! From the smiles of the front desk staff (Kiefer, Lizbeth, Joshua, James to name a few), Stephania our floor’s housekeeper & of course, Eddie, the bellman/concierge who can get you a car service, directions on how to navigate the Subway or walk to Macy’s with equal ease, the staff  made our visit easy & memorable! We can’t wait to go back.

title: Perfetto ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
text:
Struttura perfetta , pulita con una posizione eccellente .⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Colazione :ottima 🔝
Accoglienza : eccezionale 🔝
Per qualsiasi problema potete affidarvi a loro .. conoscono bene la città ed hanno una soluzione per tutto 👌🏻
Inoltre ( cosa non da poco ) hanno un rooftop gratuito .🤩
🇺🇸🗽🗽🗽🗽

title: Exceptional
text: Thanks to Shane (and Eddie) for starting our trip off in such a helpful, fun, stress-free way! I was greeted with a smile and Shane went above and behind to ensure our requests were met to make our trip memorable! Staff was friendly, especially our breakfast attendants—felt safe, secure and looked after! Will definitely visit again—great location!

title: Went out of their way to accommodate my late booking
text: I had a problem at my house that prevented us from staying there, Booked a room at 6:30 PM (Handicap for wife) Put us in a room for the night and changed rooms the next day, Total 3 night stay.  Special shout out to Kimberley who went far beyond to make us feel welcome and comfortable.

title: The price to big for service
text: The price is too high for the service provided. Only good things about this hotel: location and cleanliness. Breakfast is terrible. no cheese or ham. Boiled eggs are icy and very overcooked. The breakfast room is small, about 50-60 seats, and the hotel is on the 31st floor. You have to wait up to 30 minutes to be seated, some eat at the reception. There are too few elevators, because going down from 7:30 to 9 in the morning you may have to wait for the elevator for 20-30 minutes. The windows in the room are leaky, so there is noise from the air conditioners of the buildings here around, making it impossible to sleep. The room is cool and the heater is so loud it's hard to have a conversation. We asked to change the room, they refused.

title: Good spot
text: Great location. We were able to walk to many places. Multiple subway stations and restaurants are nearby. The hotel was very clean, and the lobby was decorated for the holidays. We each received a free bottle of water at check in. Breakfast was good and the ladies who work the breakfast area kept it well stocked. Everyone at the hotel was very kind; The manager saw us sitting in the lobby and introduced himself. I would recommend.

title: Worst experience ever with a hotel
text:
Terrible experience (and I am a Hilton Honors Diamond member!) 
Called around to find a room with two queen beds + sleeper sofa for party of 3, two being seven-foot basketball players.  Made reservation with Hilton Honors 800 number for room as specified.  Got to hotel and there are NO SUCH ROOMS at this property. The manager was totally uninterested in helping us (again; HHonors Diamond). First night was so bad (two of us in one queen bed and the sever-footer awoke with terrible back pains that we canceled the second night of reservation. It took FOUR months and countless emails on my part to get the 80,000 points returned to my account. Asked for additional points for how we got screwed but Hilton not interested in making such a gesture to a loyal guest. 
The kicker: I got 2-3 texts from the manager during my stay asking how everything was.  But NO responses when I replied. I was later told he was not willing to help me because I was a "troublemaker."  My dad built a company from 10 stores to 105 because of excellent customer service.  This was the worst!!!!!

title: Pleasantly Surprised
text: Stayed here in August 2023. Chose this hotel because I had tickets to see Some Like It Hot on Broadway and have Hilton Honors. Staff were friendly. Nice clean lobby. Never felt unsafe. Stayed on the 8th floor and hardly heard any city noise considering I was super close to Times Square and Port Authority. I had a king room and for a NYC hotel didn't feel cramped but same time not too big either. Just perfect. Nice comfortable bed and air conditioning was very nice.

title: A Great Place To Stay
text: I just got back from a business trip to NYC. Being business, my schedule was a bit tighter than a leisurely trip. I needed help with my accommodations and Shane and Lisbeth were so helpful. They turned a stressful situation into a great experience. All of my needs were met and they really exceeded expectations. This will be my new “go to” hotel because of Lisbeth and Shane!

title: Veliké zklamání
text: Strávili jsme zde 2 noci a za nás nedoporučujeme. Sice příjemná recepce, dostali jsme po příjezdu 2 vody a děti balení bonbónů, ale ačkoliv jsme rezervaci dělali na 4 osoby (2 dospělí a 2 děti ve věku 11 a 13 roků), umístili nás do pokoje pro 2 hosty, takže na jedné posteli (trošku širší než standard pro osobu) jsme museli spát 2. Že jde o pokoj pro 2 a standardně tam prostě bývají jen 2 osoby jsme se dozvěděli od manažera hotelu až po odjezdu po vyplnění jejich interního hodnocení. Pro nás nepochopitelné. Navíc jsme měli pokoj ve 4. patře do vnitro bloku a celých 24 hodin i přes zavřené okno rušil zvuk/motor elektrocentrály buď od hotelu či přilehlé budovy. Pokoj pro 4 osoby extrémně malý, kufry jsme neměli kam umístit. Snídaně průměrné, papírové talíře a kelímky, málo místa k sezení, musí se prostě čekat, až někdo odejde (ve frontě...). Lokace dobrá přímo u Times Square, ale předražené jen kvůli lokaci. Ve vybavení pokoje nic navíc.

title: BEWARE … this hotel is NOT it used to be
text:
We have stayed at this property multiple times over the past decade.  So when we arrived this time, we were surprised to find that the hotel had been refurbished.  And this change was not for the better.

Rooms are significantly smaller.  In fact, the King size rooms are just big enough for one person to walk around the bed.  There are small shelves on each side of the bed,  one shelf below the window, and a few small shelves next to the window.  This means there is very little room for comfort much less luggage.

The bathroom open area is big enough to turn around in.  

The breakfast area has been reduced and is no where large enough to accommodate the large crowds coming and going for breakfast and offers very few seating options. The water dispensers were empty all morning.  The juice machine was broken.  The food was cold and flavorless.  

The new smart elevators are a disaster.  They squeeze hold maybe ten people if there is no luggage and stop at multiple floors even when there isn’t room for another person.

And if the changes to the hotel were not bad enough, be prepared for poor staffing and management that is non existent.  We booked 2 rooms.  One was not clean/ready when we arrived.  We spent some time in the city and returned 4 hours later.  The room was still not ready.  It took them an hour to find us another room.  We paid extra for a city view room and the new room was NOT a a city view.  Staff did not offer to adjust the cost… simply saying they were sorry and that was all they had.

The only thing positive I can say about this place is the location and that it was clean.  

If you are looking to stay here, know that any reviews older than September of 2023 are no longer accurate.  Look for someplace else to stay,

title: poco più di un ostello
text:
Ero a NY per la maratona ed esigenze logistiche nonchè l'offerta della società a cui mi sono affidato, mi hanno veicolato nella scelta di questo albergo.
prezzi esorbitanti per un servizio da ostello. Albergo "abbastanza" pulito, vicino ad ogni servizio ma con colazione, inclusa nel prezzo, da mensa. Piatti ed accessori di plastica in uno stanzone ultra affollato dove trovare un posto seduti è un'impresa. persone che mangiano nella hall sedute e caos ovunque; ci vogliono anche 20 mi uti per utilizzare l'ascensore sia per scendere che per risalire nelle stanze.
personale cordiale per la media americana
se potete eviate

title: Karen is the best
text: Karen was AWESOME! I arrived on a whim and she greeted me in the lobby. Kind, courteous, beyond friendly and she informed me of offers and deals for which i was eligible. She is definitely a bright spot in this location.

title: Stayed in the most centric place in NY
text: It was a nice stay in this Hotel, rooms clean and God thank you for the coffee in the lobby, Karen is an amazing employee and so charmin’. Five star experience here and continue to give this type of attention to the guests!

title: Good hotel, great central location, clean rooms.
text: Despite some negative reviews we had a great stay at this hotel. Clean room with comfy beds (every day clean towels and beds made). The breakfast buffet was good and sufficient but more fruit and fresh yoghurt would make it even better. Other hotel facilities are basic but clean. Staff is friendly. Good Wifi. Times Square is just around the corner but not causing any noise (but we had a room on 24th floor). A lot is accessible on foot. Good connections to bus and metro.

title: Great location for theater; clean with friendly staff
text: Overall I was happy with my stay here. The hotel  is in a great location if you’re planning to see some shows. My room was spotless and the staff was very friendly, particularly in the breakfast room. I do wish they had more space for people to sit at breakfast as it got very crowded. I also got a good deal of street noise coming in, even though I was on the 21st floor. I know, it’s NYC, but I’ve been in other Times Square hotels and the rooms seemed better insulated from street noise. Maybe the Hilton needs to invest in some better window glass! I also wished my room had a refrigerator.

title: Super hôtel et superbe équipe !
text:
Nous sommes allés dans cet hôtel avec mon mari, ma mère et ma soeur et sa famille. 2 chambres et la 1ère fois pour ma mère, ma soeur et sa famille. Tout a été parfait du début à la fin, emplacement au top à 5-10 min de time square, proximité des métros. Une équipe adorable, bienveillante, à l'écoute. Les chambres propres et parfaite et un petit déjeuner copieux.
Je recommande 1000x cet hôtel, allez y les yeux fermés!!!

title: Decent hotel but add time
text: My stay itself was good.  The location was convenient and the room was nice and clean. The reason my rating is not higher is that the congestion when using the elevators detracted from our trip. Only 3 elevators for a hotel that holds that many people is not a good plan.  Long lines would form when trying to go up or down.  We had to allow extra time to come and go from the hotel for this reason.  Also, the congestion in the room at the breakfast buffet made the buffet almost impossible to use.

title: Perfect hotel in perfect location
text:
Excellent hotel in a perfect location and we couldn’t fault it .
Rooms were more than enough in size for 1 adult and 2 kids shared a bed in a twin king room.
Breakfast was more than adequate but get there prior to peak hour (7-8 ) is the best time after this it gets crowded.( 8-10 ) as expected.
Laundry was excellent @$6 a wash n dry in a very larger commercial washer n dryer .
The gym / lifts / room service / doorman / 
Reception was excellent and very friendly service 
Water coffee / tea  station on ground floor reception area .
The location was 3-5 minutes walk maximum to the bright lights of time square .
This hotel location is perfectly tucked away from the craziness and noise of time square.
Great security hotel with a key pass to enter after dark and key pass to the hotel floors .
The doorman got us a black SUV within 3 minutes to take us to the airport and a very reasonable price paid directly to the driver .
Highly highly recommend this hotel and very well priced compared to other hotels around time square 
Couldn’t fault it and would 100% recommend !!

title: THE HOTEL U SHOULD CHOOSE‼️
text:
Pre Cuise Stay- ANY NEGATIVE REVIEWS ARE COMPLETELY WRONG‼️

From the moment a very GREAT UBER DRIVER UNLOADED our luggage on the ride from JFK AIRPORT ($140)  The HOTEL was perfect for our 3 night pre cruise stay.  Kimberlii at the front desk was SO NICE... as ALL THE STAFF... I knew  I HAD DONE GREAT when I overlooked the few Negative reviews that gave me a little concern. 

THEY WERE WRONG & Obviously TRAVEL SNOBES. 

I worked on the road for 50 years.  Hotels are HOME‼️. And as a HILTON GUY this hotel in the center of NYC IS GREAT. 

I am from the South and HOSPITALITY and just good manners with easy going demeanor took me around the WORLD discovering THAT ALL MANKIND CAN MAKE OUR LIVES MORE ENJOYABLE - Even in Tough Times -that 99% of humans respond WELL given the respect EVERYONE DESERVES....even in the Tough NYC. 

READ THE OTHER REVIEWS.  Large NICE hotel rooms - clean neat HOTEL. 
THE BUFFET BREAKFAST IS NYC BUSY...BUT I FOUND IT FUN AND ENJOYABLE as PEOPLE FTOM ALL OVER The  WORLD WERE THERE. 

And they were friendly IF U GAVE THEM that in return... I wore a GEORGIA TECH BALL CAP... FOOTBALL TTPE... ICE BREAKER and great conversation starter.   It WAS AMAZING TO MEET THE WORLD CITIZENS right there near TIMES SQUARE. …. a few hundred steps away. FOOD, SHOWS, Landmarks.     ALL SO CLOSE.   A GREAT VISIT‼️‼️

title: Best Hotel to stay if wanting to be near Times Square
text: I picked Hampton Inn /Times Square Central because we wanted walking distance to theaters, food, Times Square, and Broadway shows.  It was the perfect spot! Joe's NY Pizza was around the corner, we right near Times Square, went to Broadway show, Crispy creme doughnuts, M & M store - all within waking distance! The free breakfast was good and plentiful! We got rooms on the second floor - so no wait for elevators! The people who work for Hampton Inn were knowledgeable and very helpful. They hold your bags for no fee! It was nice to have cold water or hot tea or coffee in the foyer to take to your rooms. Rooms were clean with plenty of fresh towels. I was able to get a refrigerator at no charge to keep my medicine cold! I would HIGHLY recommend HamptonInn Manhattan/Times Square Central!!

title: A gem in Times Square
text: From the moment the checked in (super early) and they let us have our room to the moment we checked out the customer service at this location was top notch! All the staff, every shift was lovely and friendly. The night shift however, Rochelle, Kimberli, Carlos and a gentleman whose name escapes me ( but you know who you are) were SO AWESOME! They went above and beyond for us and especially for my kids. Giving them treats and walking them around and just interacting with them and making them feel special. It was a stellar experience and we will for sure visit that location again. Also the location of the hotel is perfect.

title: amazing hotel and staff
text: the hotel is very clean and i feel safe. the location is great as it is right around the corner from times square! the staff are AMAZING!! they are all so friendly and helpful! if i come back to nyc in the future, i’ll be coming back here!

title: Very good location and comfortable room
text:
We were in NYC last month for2 days and nights prior to a cruise.  The last time that we were in NYC a number of years ago, we stayed at a Hampton in mid-Manhattan because of the location and was looking to do so again but that property was no loner there / not a Hampton.  After a quick search, I found this one that was a few blocks more west.  

We had an early Saturday morning flight from Orlando and made it to the hotel around 11:30am.  I had requested early check-in if possible but didn't expect to be able to get into the room this early but a very nice front desk clerk was able to get us in a room right away which was great.

The room with a king size bed was very comfortable.  The property seems to be fairly new and in good shape.  We asked for extra pillows and they were brought up almost immediately.  The service was very good and everyone was very friendly and helpful.

The breakfast area gets a lot chaotic but the attendant worked hard at cleaning the tables as people left them and keeping the breakfast items stocked.

Overall, we were very pleased with this location as it was convenient for our Broadway Show on Sunday afternoon and close to the port that we were sailing out on Monday (about a $30 Uber ride to the cruise port on the west side of Manhattan).

title: Lovely Hotel and Staff
text: I loved staying here. It's such a convenient location, and everything is walking distance. There was complimentary breakfast provided. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. My hotel room was clean, and there was some rooftop access as well. Albeit, there were no chair or tables on the roof, and it was a bit of a small space. Checking and checking out was a breeze. I'm happy I chose to stay at Hampton Inn Manhattan and would most definitely come back.

title: Posizione strategica ,vicinissimo a time square  ma situato in una via secondaria
text: Seppur albergo un po datato e ristrutturato:pulizia della camera e sostituzione biancheria  ogni giorno ,colazione abbondante e variegata tra dolce e salato,personale gentile .Dotato di palestra, lavatrici ed asciugatrice,presenza fissa di distribuitori di caffè caldo ,acqua calda e acqua fresca .Unica pecca non avere in bagno il tubo flessibile  della doccia ma solo un soffione fisso a parete ed un rubinetto.

title: Many attractions within walking distance of hotel
text: Location is excellent for Times Square, Central Park and subway stations. Hotel is good value, basic breakfast, rooms are clean and quiet. Hotel staff are professional, friendly and provide excellent customer service.

title: Vicinissimo a Times Square
text: Hotel a pochi passi da Times Square e dai maggiori teatri di Brodway. Ottimo punto di partenza per visitare la città. Stanze pulite ma non troppo spaziose. Buona colazione anche se un po troppo affollata.

title: Convenient Location / mediocre accommodation and staff
text: A block from Time Square but not in the high pedestrian traffic way. Front of house staff not very accommodating. Elevators are often full and took long to get up and down from our room.  Breakfast was nice.

title: Excellent Staff
text: We had such a pleasant stay that I was compelled to write a review.  The staff at this Hampton Inn is top notch.  Over and above friendly - and always looking for ways to help or improve your stay.  I have never experienced a more accommodating and happy staff - excellent experience.  Thank you!!

title: Great location clean and comfortable.
text: Great location, nice breakfast although very crowded. Clean and comfortable although very small rooms but typical for NYC. Had some difficulty getting on elevators at times so the lower floors to use the stairs worked out well. Also recommend rooms to the back of the building away from the street noise which was nice and quiet. Would definitely use again.

title: Perfect spot and great customer service!
text:
This hotel was perfect for me and my two teenagers.  We had never been to NYC before and wanted to do all the tourist attractions and spent a lot of time on the subway. 42nd/Times square is a major stop in that line and it is literally across the street from the hotel. We also were within walking distance from our Broadway show, and dining places (you need a slice of Joe’s). 

The staff was so pleasant and treated us with the utmost respect. There is a convenience store in the lobby which made it so great to just run down for a water or cokes. The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. My two favorite things are the free breakfast and the fact that they stored our bags for us after we checked out since we had a late flight. Concierge also made arrangements for a car service to pick us up so we didn’t have to leave a Rideshare or taxi line to chance. Five emphatic stars.

title: Great Lacation and Clean Hotel
text:
Great Location. Half a block from time square, subway and bus services,
Perfect for taking a bus if going to Met Life Staduim.
Rooms where nice and very clean. Breakfast was good but too crowded and difficult to find seating.
Overall a very good Hotel and Location. Great service from front desk staff.

title: Super clean and great place to stay
text: We stayed in this hotel for six nights on our first NY trip as a family. This is the place to stay in NYC for many reasons. Centrally located in Times Square, the Empire State Building, and all other attractive places in NYC.  Most importantly, first-class hotel service with complimentary breakfast, super clean rooms (cleaned daily), and friendly and professional staff from the front desk to the breakfast bar. I can`t remember the names of two smiley ladies in the breakfast bar who provided great hospitality.  If it was not that standard you can`t enjoy a week's holiday. The staff, breakfast, and cleanliness were first class. We had an enjoyable time on our NYC family trip and the hotel was one of the great parts of it. It is a lifetime memory. If I go back, I would definitely book this hotel. Highly recommend.

title: Nice place to stay before our cruise in the middel of everything
text: This was a good hotel to stay at for the night before our cruise left from the Manhattan Cruise Terminal.   Being in the Times Square area, there are a multitude of places to visit and eat at.   The staff was friendly and there was good breakfast in the morning so didn't have to go out and find something.  The room was comfortable and quiet.  We have no complaints about the hotel and would stay there again.

title: Great location great stay
text:
A great hotel
Centrally located in NYC Times Square. Front desk was friendly at checking. Coffee , tea and water available In lobby. Breakfast 6-10am in large room features waffle irons , egg,sausage,potato, cereal breads and pastries. Breakfast staff helpful and works hard to keep everything well stocked. King room was small but didn’t spend much time there. Bonus. Rooftop view was nice

title: Exceptional service
text: I love staying in hotels that provide me a adequate breakfast for free! Every morning there were eggs, either bacon or sausage patties, waffle makers and the accompanying condiments, yogurt, oatmeal, muffins, bagels, and toast…on and on and on! The rooms were clean, tidy and spacious, and the staff was amazing! The front office supervisor Jose Taveras was accommodating as well as the entire front desk staff and Security.

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: This is THE place to stay in NYC.  Centrally located at 41st and 7th next to Time Square, the hotel provides all of the services you need, to include a concierge. The complimentary breakfast is first rate, the rooms are super clean and cleaned daily, and the concierge service is invaluable. It seems that anything you need to help make your stay more enjoyable is a basic part of their job description.

title: Great spot.
text:
This location was great for our visit to NYC.  The staff are friendly and professional and the accommodations are great. 
  That was the end of my review, but the requirement of 200 minimum characters forces me to continue to type.  Stop!

title: Avoid this Hotel
text:
As our usual hotel on Times Square North we booked this hotel after seeing the good reviews. We checked in online via the App and chose our rooms. Upon arrival we approached the desk where Cesar greeted us. He was very slow and just kept pressing buttons behind the computer and didn't speak. After about 5-10 minutes he requested payment of the first room, which we done. The then advised us both rooms weren't ready despite it being 1.5 hours past checkin. We asked how long rooms would be and he said it may be another 2-3 hours and just leave our bags and come back, he was working until 11pm. No apology, no explanation. Nothing!

He then tried to take payment for the second room which we paid, to be told it wasn't ready. He didn't offer any apology once again and was extremely slow and distant. 

He managed to find one room which was ready after we explained we had stuff book and had been travelling all day. This took another 5-10 minutes. He then tried to take a third payment. 

We left and headed to the room to drop our stuff off and went back to speak to a manager. As there was a queue the bellman spoke to us who was was very helpful and friendly, he got the managed for us who was helping another customer, so Shane assisted us, found us a room straight away and away we went, we are still unclear what the issue was but Cesar should not be on the front desk with the lack of assistance he provided.

Rooms are dated but tidy. We had Room 2405 and 2104 and they done the job. The safety deposit box is huge and this was a great help as we travel with alot of camera equipment it all fitted in with space! 

We went elsewhere for breakfast as the breakfast room was full and we had to eat in the lobby one morning as guests were sat not eating in there, this was regardless whether it was 8am or 10am. We walked past one morning at 630am and it was still busy.

Elevators are another issue. There are through for the whole hotel, one wasn't working during our stay, the queues for lifts anytime of day were stupid. It took 25 minutes on a morning to get down to the lobby or back to the room. All guests said the same thing and staff were also getting frustrated at how slow they were.

The hotel size is not suitable for only 2/3 lifts and a small breakfast room. 

There is tea/coffee available in the lobby but this was often empty but again the bellman was filling this on occasions, he deserves a raise as was the only one running around trying to help. 

We asked for late checkout which was given to us and we could stay until 1pm this was helpful as the morning we left t was very wet!

There are a few friendly staff around the hotel but compared to other Hilton properties this is far worse, we will not be returning to this location.

title: Great hotel in a great location.
text:
We enjoyed the hotel during a Road Scholar tour.  Nice buffet breakfast (& decent coffee!).  Clean rooms, towels switched daily. Great location for exploring the Times Square region.  Even caught a show just 1/2 block away.  Nice location!!
Especially:  Joseph the Bellman was very helpful, including getting us a ride back to EWR airport.  The driver ended up trying to inflate the price, but Joseph's rate was all we paid.  Joseph is DA MAN!!

title: Endless wait for the lift
text: The rooms are ok, but the endless wait for the lift really impacts the stay. We will choose another hotel next time we are in NY. It is not uncommon to have to wait 8 to 10 min when it is morning rush hour and guest are having breakfast. As I said, we will go somewhere else for this price.

title: Perfect..
text:
Perfect stay and location.
Great view of the manhatten skyline from the room 

Stayed for 2 nights for work purpose. Location is central and good for transport links. Clean and faultless room. 

Good breakfast or plenty locations local to eat out. 

Definitely recommended

title: Attentive, friendly, comfortable, convenient
text: From check in to check out, we found the staff and services great. Our room was not overlooking the street and we didn’t hear a sound. The AC was quiet as well. The beds and bathroom are comfortable. Breakfast had a large variety and food was plentiful. The staff was friendly and polite. Front desk and manager were very approachable and helpful with any questions and requests. We will definitely be back!

title: Good location and helpful staff!
text:
We loved everything about our 4-night stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square Central! There are many Hiltons in the Times Square area, but we chose this one because it included a hot breakfast buffet. The breakfast did not disappoint!! We had an ADA accessible room, and it had all the features we needed. The location of the hotel was perfect, with easy access to restaurants and public transportation. 

But what we liked the most about the hotel were the people that work there. All of the staff members were always friendly and helpful. In particular Joseph, the concierge, was fantastic! He helped us with all of our transportation needs. In fact we called the hotel several days before our arrival, and asked if anyone could help us with transportation from JFK airport. Joseph took care of all the details and reserved us an SUV for our arrival and departure. Also, Jorge in the breakfast area was very helpful. I was in a mobility scooter, making it difficult to move around in the congested room. Jorge greeted us every morning, helping to get us a table. Highly recommend this hotel!!

title: Embarrasing experience
text: DId reservation over the phone with hotel employee. I had to run my personal info and my credit card number in order to secure the room. When my friends arrived, all info was missing and my friends were held in the lobby until I was reached. Front Desk Manager and GM did not alllowed my friends to get into the room until I was found and my card was run for a second time. My friends arrived to NY after a 12 hour flight. Not fun.... very poor experience.

title: Great hotel, impeccable location
text: Hotel was great! Staff was incredible, room was as expected, hot breakfast every morning, perfect location. We would stay here again, no questions asked. As other reviews mentioned, breakfast area was busy every morning (we were there at 9am most days), and the elevator could get a little backlogged, but we just anticipated all of that so it didn't take away from our stay. The beds were VERY comfortable, and the full sized toiletries were a great touch. We booked this hotel based on the reviews we read here, and am so glad we trusted our gut. We will happily return!

title: Great hotel choice in Times Sq
text: My stay at the Hampton Inn Times Sq central was very pleasant. Clean, friendly staff, and convenient location. I’ve stayed at many hotels in the area, and this one was one of the better ones I have stayed in. The room was nice and cool and the bed was very comfortable, allowing me to have a great sleep. Would definitely recommend this property.

title: Great 1st time in NYC
text: The hotel was great. Our son had his guide dog and the were very accommodating!  It was our first time in NYC and Joseph made it pleasure. He is a real asset to the hotel!  He helped us navigate the area, and gave great restaurant tips!

title: If you value your sleep, don’t stay here
text: Don’t stay here if you want to sleep in preparation for the next busy day. Im staying on the 12th floor facing the front of the hotel and the noise from outside is unbelievable. Sounds like Times Square is in your room and it doesn’t stop all night. Can’t be bothered changing rooms because we’re only here 2 nights thank god. Location perfect, rooms spacious for New York, air con noisy but it works. Breakfast is a cattle market and self serve on paper plates with plastic cutlery. Expected more for a $380 a night room! Won’t be returning

title: Great stay and I recommend this hotel
text:
This is our second time staying here. This time, we stayed here for 3 nights. Location is fantastic! Rooms are clean and we had room service every day (fresh towels). We didn’t ask for this- it was done automatically. Hair dryer is in the bathroom. Bathroom had a shower no tub. This seems to be the norm now - totally fine with me. 
Rooms are on smaller side but that is to be expected. I didn’t feel claustrophobic- plenty of space for us in the room. 
Breakfast was good and included with the stay. It is buffet style and can get very busy. Breakfast was offered 6-10 am I think. 
People are generally good and share space easily. Staff was great at the hotel, they were very pleasant and helpful. They held our bags on the first day of visit and also arranged for a cab to the airport when we checked out. 
A few minor downsides but I’m not sure how they could rectify - elevators are very busy every day because the hotel is busy, and hotel is starting to look a little dated because of decor. The charging ports are on the desk rather than at the night tables. Not a huge deal! 
Good change I have seen is that the  shower gel, shampoo, conditioner is in containers on the wall- I rather that, then trying to deal with small tubes while showering. 
I would recommend this hotel.

title: Bon rapport qualité prix et chouette emplacement
text:
Hôtel très bien placé: proche Times square et métro, tout en étant préservé du bruit. 
Accueil sympa, chambre correcte pr New York. Dommage qu’il n’y ait pas de frigo. Le micro-ondes était en bas avec quelques produits à acheter et couverts à disposition.
Un peu d’attente au petit déjeuner, et pas tjrs simple de trouver une table mais bon l’offre de petit déjeuner comprise était bien pratique. 
Pas mal d’attente aux ascenseurs aussi. 
On était au 14eme étage avec vue sur l’arrière d’une salle de spectacle. 
Dans l’ensemble et au vue de la localisation je recommande cet hôtel pr une famille. Bon rapport qualité prix.

title: Service with a smile
text:
Please read all - the best is last!
Location - honestly 41st feels a little shakey. But this hotel is next to the Nederlander Theater and close to the busy 7th Ave corner. In addition, you need a key for elevators, and the front door even in the afternoon at times. Feel safe.
Rooms - nice size. Clean and comfortable. Lobby is smaller than pics, but who hangs in the lobby? Elevators - 3. But never waited very long even though there are lot of floors. 
Breakfast - typical Hampton. Reliable, good. Does anyone not live the make it yourself waffles? Delicious.
And the best for last - the staff. Excellant + . I dealt with the front desk, breakfast crew, an engineer, and housekeeping. All were very attentive and extremely quick to respond. I felt important - they went over the trying to please; they wanted to make sure I knew I was valued. Personable and professional. A special thank you to them!

title: You can't beat this location for theater and as a base for exploring the city.
text:
Our flight was delayed and we arrived very early in the morning and the staff was very welcoming. I was worried about street noise being on the 6th floor, but didn't find it to be a problem. Also, while all hotel rooms in New York City are small, I found this room to be a good size and the beds were comfortable. 
Breakfast is provided in the morning and it was satisfactory. The breakfast area gets crowded pretty quickly and one morning we ended up grabbing breakfast somewhere else because the dining area was full of a travel group all eating at the same time. I wish there had been some fresh fruit on offer. During the summer we appreciated the flavored water in the lobby. 
We had a late flight out and the hotel kept our luggage until we were ready to leave while we went out and explored the city. I appreciated that service very much. 
The location is great, just down the street from The New York Times and Times Square, perfect if you have a lot of theater tickets! There's a great bus to the Upper Westside across the street from the hotel and subways are easy. 
I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. The hotel is well managed and well kept.

title: Excellence
text: As a family we had a great time at the Hampton time square.it’s proximity to time square and all the nice restaurants is fantastic.The accommodation and the complimentary breakfast is amazing.I highly recommend Hamptons

title: Posizione buona, Hotel un po' scarso
text: Zona Times Square, a circa 100 m dalla 7ma Avenue, stazione di snodo metropolitana vicina. Sulla posizione il voto è certamente positivo. La stanza era piccola, arredata in modo anonimo. Letto matrimoniale piccolo. Bagno con vasca, piccolo e scomodo. Avevamo la colazione inclusa, ma con poca varietà.

title: Excellent hotel, perfect location
text:
Family of 4 travelled in August and we had a wonderful stay in NY. The hotel is on West 41st Street between 7th and 8th Avenue, pretty close most of the major attractions. Our room was clean and beds comfortable. Housekeeping is by request in keeping with environmental issues but you can request towels, toilet rolls etc when needed. The staff were very friendly during our stay. One of the few hotel in NY that has a breakfast option.
Would definitely stay here again.
Nice hotel, great service, perfect location.

title: El peor desayuno del mundo
text: No puede haber un desayuno peor. Esta bien ubicado y la habitación está dentro del tamaño habitual de NYC para este precio pero el desayuno es nefasto. Desde mi punto de vista ganaría mucho el hotel si no ofreciera ese desayuno. Nada recomendable

title: Highly recommend
text:
We chose the hotel due to its location and excellent value.  Very close to Times Square, the subway and easy walking distance to the Park.  The rooms are a good size, clean and the beds very comfortable.  

Special mention to Mo on the front desk - friendly, helpful and professional.  He checked us in quickly.  Joseph the concierge - again very helpful and friendly.

All the staff we met were friendly and nothing was too much trouble.

Free water, tea and coffee in reception is a nice touch.

title: In the Thick of it with Breakfast Included!
text: Stayed here for the breakfast included onsite! The need a larger room for breakfast. Of course there isn't one available. Two elevators were not enough for the entire hotel. Great location! Next door to the Nederland Theatre and walking distance to Times Square & other theatres. Great food everywhere you walk. So much to do and see in NYC! Would stay here again!

title: Great Hotel Stay
text: If you are going to vacation in NY and want a fairly central location, this is the place for you.  The hotel is on a semi-busy street (which is a relief from the overwhelming bustle of Times Square), so the location is perfect.  The front desk staff (especially Rochelle and Bobby) were a pleasure to deal with and accommodated all of my needs!  The buffet breakfast (which I only partook of on 1 of my 5 days there) was ample and the hotel was really clean!  The rooms had all of the amenities that you come to expect at a Hampton.  Plus, the showers were all modern and really nice!  I couldn’t have been more comfortable (bed included).

title: Staff Amazing!!
text: Had a great time with my son. Location great, rooms not huge. Great view from my room. Breakfast not 5 stars, but it served it’s purpose the first day. The second day we bought some coffee and breakfast outside;  but everyone is very kind, customer service was great. I love my stay with my son. I would come back if I have to.

title: Paying for Location With Unexceptional But Acceptable Rooms
text: This place is quite centrally located. Security is excellent as room keys must be used to enter the building, use the elevator, or enter the stairwell. Spacious and well appointed lobby. Rooms are well done but lack a refrigerator and microwave, a suprise considering the high cost of the room. Service was generally friendly, but there were moments of disappointment. For example, we were not initially given much info on where to eat but other staff gave us a listing the next day. Most, but not all staff were informative when assistance was requested. The breakfast was very good with very attentive staff assisting. Housecleaning was by request but nicely done once asked.

title: Great Experience
text: Great NYC hotel experience. Perfect location in the heart of Times Square and the theater district. Rooms have been recently renovated. Full complimentary breakfast. Secure lobby and room key only access to elevator.

title: Great hotel for families, good room with view and breakfast
text: Stayed here for ease of access to trains and times square we had a room with a view on the 29th floor. (Use the Observatory on floor R good views) bedroom view was good concrete jungle of NY nice at night. Can see the edge and the spire only of ESB.  Breakfast was good kept the kids busy with the waffle maker. Staff were great wonderful and helpful. Checkin firstly thought was going to be awkward as the staff passed us on between each other but they were polite just tired I guess.. Madhusa was great he took some time to chat to us about the area and our trip conversed and gave us pointers. Thank you to the kitchen staff who were great. Loved the place convenient for central NYC . Room. Was next to elevators but did not cause any noise issues, AC was worthwhile especially during the summer heat in NYC.

title: Stayed twice; family friendly!
text:
We're a party of four: me, my husband, our 17 year old son, and our 16 year old daughter, and were staying in NYC, splitting our experience in half(with Niagara Falls in between) so I needed somewhere to stay twice.  We were looking for a hotel right in the middle of Times Square, close enough to subway and train stations, with complimentary breakfast and coin laundry.   Looking through many options on the web, I've come across Hampton Inn, and I noticed that it not only caters to business travelers, but also to families, and since we were on vacation, we booked there and gave it a try.

On July 11, and after a 3 hour Amtrak delay from Washington DC to NYC, we rushed into the lobby for check-in.  We were panting, and felt and looked hungry and exhausted, so Lizbeth from front desk promptly and gently gave us our keys to room 1105 while we helped ourselves to a cup of complimentary lemon water, and then we headed to the elevators, expecting them to take forever to go down but they were really fast considering that the building is 30 stories high.

Room 1105 was located right behind the elevators, however we never felt any bothersome noise; in fact, our room turned out to be next to one of just a few ice machines in the building. Once inside, we blinked at the tiny space in front of us; it was so small! Much to my dismay, I looked at the emergency map on the back of the door and I realized that Lizbeth was kind enough to give one of their more spacious rooms because the rest of them were even smaller so I sighed and just said, "Ok, this is a pre-war building that was reconditioned into a hotel, so I guess they made the most of it... it is what it is."  The room faced the back of other Manhattan buildings, and it consisted of two double beds, a closet, flat-screen TV, a small desk, private bathroom with superb Zero toiletries, drawers, a coffee maker, and an ice bucket with paper cups. There was no fridge so thank God we were next to the ice machine in the hallway.  This said, we had a wonderful sleep even though storing our luggage was a challenge; besides, water pressure and temperature from the bathroom faucet was great. 

We completely agreed on and supported Hilton's policy on not doing housekeeping until after three days; after all, we were given enough toiletries for our entire stay and we're not too messy to begin with; this said, I expected more cleanliness in the bathroom... I had to use tissue paper to remove some mold from the tiles prior to showering; besides, one furniture was "one-legged" and they put an empty soap carton underneath, this was tacky on their behalf.  Other than that, the room served its purpose of being a good source for showering and rest.

Don't miss the view from the roof!

Both times we stayed we took advantage from the coin laundry located beneath the main floor. There's only two washers and two dryers, but nobody seemed to make use of them so I didn't have to wait for someone else in order to do my laundry.  Each load was $3(Welcome to NYC) and I didn't incur in laundry detergent charges since I brought one of my own.  You can either pay with coins or straight from the ShinePay app.

Breakfast was filling and satisfying.  Among the items there were yogurt, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, omelettes, milk, tea, coffee, fruits, cold cereal, assorted bread, breakfast potatoes, sausage, and a waffle maker.  There were always several breakfast attendants available, and they were very helpful and open to any dietary request.

Both check-outs took place right on front desk; they were uneventful.

Our second time we were given room 2206, right in front of the elevator(something great  in such a tall building).  It had a nice view of 41st and 42nd St, however it was even smaller than the first one, and the closest ice machine was located on the 27th floor; still, beds were a delight and the bathroom was cleaner than the first room we stayed in.

Overall I would stay here again because the entire staff was wonderful and rates were reasonable given the complimentary services and the proximity to transportation hubs and main attractions; this said, the only reason I give it a rating of 4 instead of 5 is because I strongly believe something needs to be done with breakfast space.  One thing is to run out tables on peak hours, and another is for guests to have to wait for the elevators to come down in order to take their breakfast to their rooms because even the additional table on the lobby was busy; this delayed the elevators' waiting time, and turned out to be an ordeal duting our first check-out in which we ended up carrying our luggage 11 stories down using the stairs given that elevators were busier than ever because of people having no other way than to carry their breakfast back to their rooms .  The Hampton Perfect Mix Lobby is quite oversized and on the same floor level as the breakfast room, both right next to the elevators, so why not turning some of that lobby space into an additional breakfast area with a second breakfast station? This way not only would guests enjoy their breakfast without it being a nuisance, but also a second station would end the awkward situation of guests bumping into each other for their servings and/or waiting a considerable amount of time for the waffle maker to finish.  

Breakfast logistics issues aside, I recommend this hotel.

title: Great place to stay
text: The hotel is right by all the action and easy to get everywhere. The rooms were clean and the staff were friendly and knowledgeable. The Bellman Joseph was very helpful with questions we had about NYC and made it easy to secure transportation to the airport. We will definitely stay here again when in NYC.

title: Nojento. Quartos fedem chulé!
text:
Uma decepção, de bom apenas o fato de estar colado à Times Square.  Quarto fede forte a chulé. Ainda tem carpete no quarto,  que deve estar lá desde a época de George Washington. 
Serviço de quarto tem que ser pedido na recepção com um dia de antecedência. Se não pedir, só entram no quarto 5 dias depois. 
Tem que suplicar para que ao menos troquem as toalhas. Sabão então, impossível ser reposto. 
O café da manhã é bem fraco e muito cheio, achar mesa para sentar é uma penitência. Desistimos… 
Fujam! Roubada total.

title: Three very positive recent stays here
text: I stayed in this hotel three times in the last few months. The facility is clean, quiet and centrally located. The staff is great- especially Joseph, the personable, helpful bellman who offers great customer service (directions, ride coordination to airport, suggestions, etc.)

title: Hotel was ok
text:
Was a little bit disappointed with my stay, the Hotel and the room were basic, purely functional but its location was perfect with Times Square just around the corner.

Found the Breakfast to be perfect with lots to choose from and the staff where very attentive.

title: Did not disappoint
text: Our stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square dis not disappoint us. Great stay with an amazing location! Throughout our time at the hotel, Shane went above and several times to assist us. We will stay at this location in the future.

title: Mis vacaciones con mi hijo…
text:
Visité Times Square del 4 al 9 de julio 2023 utilice el hotel Hilton tiene un servicio de excelencia con un personal muy atento.
El servicio de desayuno incluido de muy buena calidad y todas las facilidades comunes limpia y en excelentes condiciones.
Luego salí en la tarde y reservé en Long Island el hotel Hilton con una limpieza impecable un ambiente bien tranquilo y familiar con una buena piscina para el deleite de sus huéspedes un lugar maravilloso para descansar muy tranquilo.
La verdad que la firma Hilton es una de las mejores y espero regresar el próximo año.

title: Noisy room
text: This was my third time at this hotel, but this time I had trouble sleeping because of loud elevator noises and the hotel changed my room the next day. The roof-top elevator motors make a banging noise when the elevators start or stop moving. The noise can easily be heard on the top two floors (31 and 30), and especially in the rooms adjacent to the elevator shafts (3103, 3105, 3003 and 3005).  Avoid these rooms!

title: Great Location
text:
The Good:
This hotel is in a perfect location if you want to experience Times Square or Broadway as it is literally in the middle of both.  Central Park is nearby as well.   The rooms are small but efficient. The bathroom is modern and the shower is large. 

The Bad:
Breakfast is served at 0700 which is too late. The breakfast area was crowded and it was hard to find a table. Most Hampton Inns start breakfast at 0600.  We left for the airport at 0630 and they didn’t offer us a Go Bag like most other Hampton Inns would.  They don’t clean your room unless you ask them to.  We asked but our room didn’t get cleaned.  We had to throw out our own trash each day and we left them a pile of towels on the floor.  

Would I stay here again?  Yes, if I wanted to be near Broadway but I had enough of Times Square and the insanely crowded streets.  Cleaning the room was a negative but fixable.

title: WARNING - AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ANY COST!!
text:
I have been traveling quite a lot and must have stayed at at least 100+ hotels. THIS HOTEL IS THE WORST I HAVE STAYED AT. DO NOT STAY HERE AT ALL!

We "prepaid" for 3 nights and our flight got delayed due to bad weather so we couldn't call that we will be checking in late. When we arrived at 3am with 2 little kids - their pathetic manager named Khaleed cancelled our room (personally) and left us scrambling to book another hotel nearby while our 2 little kids including a toddler were super exhausted after 14 hour, delayed journey. We have checked in late at night plenty of times when we do longer drives on weekends and never faced a cancellation, particularly when the room was completely prepaid. Even Tripadvisor supervisor said that she hadn't heard of such example and the employee jumped the gun (they fully refunded the expense)

Do not even interact with this manager named Khaleed who has to be the worst hotel employee....a racist, and maybe high on weed. Another couple that was white checked in at exactly same time as us but didn't face this result.

My family had the worst experience there with him yelling at us - particularly in front of our 2 little kids. Can you imagine a hotel employee yelling at you at 3 in the morning??
Again, boycott this hotel for sure and Hilton chain if you can. If this is the quality they are going for then they are sticking at the bottom of the gutter.

title: Great hotel for a Times Square stay
text:
This was a great choice for our stay in NYC - incredibly convenient to everything in Times Square and the subway to get everywhere else. Even though the hotel was busy, the elevators were fast and the building was quiet at night. Everyone I encountered working here was incredibly nice and helpful. Highly recommend. Get to breakfast on the early side of the hotel
Is full.

title: Excellent location with complimentary hotbreakfast.
text: Excellent location, complimentary healthy hot breakfast. Front desk employees are very friendly. On site cleam Laundry for nomi.nal fee. Jim is very nice. We enjoyed rooftop access with nice city view.

title: Enthusiastic Staff, Safety Focused, Excellent Choice
text: From my pre-arrival phone calls to Kimberly to get our 3 rooms close by or on the same floor to our last hug good-bye from Joseph as he loaded us into our to-airport car, this staff will be sure you enjoy your time in NYC!  Enthusiastic breakfast hosts Lloyd and Ishmael will ensure you have plenty to eat at breakfast in a tidy dining room.   They even let the insiders like me <wink> know which morning will be bacon morning.  [Insider tip:  get downstairs early to avoid the lines]  The hotel is convenient to subway stations, Times Square chaos and Broadway shows.  The housekeeping staff keeps the hallways, common areas, elevators spotless.    Concierge Joseph will swoop by with an answer before you even know you have a question.  Con:  We had planned for one evening’s meal to be a pizza party on the rooftop deck, but found there was no furniture up there.

title: Well located, clean, helpful staff
text: We had a great three nights stay in the hotel in June 2023. It was very well located and we were about 15-20 min walking away from almost everything we wanted to see (Central Park, Empire State, MoMA) with our kids (6&9, very good walkers). The staff is very helpful. The room was clean and functional. The kids enjoyed the warm breakfast. It is true that the breakfast area can get pretty crowded : we made a sure to be down by 8:30 to avoid that. Same goes for the elevators. We left our car at the parking close by (note that you can't go back and forth to the car).

title: Great hotel stay
text: We had a great hotel stay. The hotel was easy to find and was in a good location. The hotel rooms and common areas were all clean and well decorated. The rooms were on the small side, but I think that’s typical for NYC. I appreciated the free breakfast. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. They were able to hold our bags for us after we checked out until later in the afternoon. Great stay!

title: Good Location if Broadway Bound
text: This hotel is well located for anyone who intends to take in a Broadway show and have easy access to all parts of New York on the subway, which is about a 3 minute walk from the front of the hotel. The Times Square area is a bit frenetic. Don't pick this area if you want quiet. There are endless fast food and other restaurants, shopping, including a Target.
