There is also a ton of smoking (including pot), chaos from crowds and cars and general congestion. The hotel is also less than a block from the Port Authority. The primary downside is that rooms have "complimentary housekeeping on request" and 24 hours notice must be given if you want your room serviced. I found that annoying, and opted not to bother. But I think the rooms are not kept as clean that way. This is not the fault of the staff, but the cost of leaving it up to the guest. Shampoo and other products are from filled dispensers. There was no refrigerator in the room which was a real negative. Ice is available on specific floors. I also had the the absolute worst view of a brick building. The free breakfast is good (limited fruit but waffles, meats, eggs, breads) and served from 7:00 AM by an enthusiastic and helpful team. Coffee is available 24 hours in the lobby. The room itself was small, with plenty of USB ports but limited space to enjoy a meal if eating in room. The bed was comfortable, if a bit soft. The hotel will arrange a fairly priced car to the airport (cabs are just as expensive). The gentleman who did this for me was excellent. The front desk staff were friendly. Overall, it was an acceptable stay but I would also look at other hotels that offer more amenities and features that I like. I have stayed at many properties in New York and this ranks in the middle in terms of amenities and value.

title: Worth the Stay
text:
Visited this hotel for Memorial Day weekend, and it was worth it. The staff was very nice. 
The hotel is close to everything, we walked from Central Park back. 

A few cons, the rooms are very small, walls are thin, and the roof top view is not worth your time. 

One thing, we had noisy guests next to us, which made it very hard to sleep, no fault of the hotel.

title: Great Location and the staff is Top Notch
text: We were here to get my Neice moved into the dorm for her summer program in Times Square. The location is PRIME for Times Square. Tons of great food. Her dorm was located by Grand Central. We checked out and walked over. Had lunch at the Mermaid Oyster! It was delicious and the staff there was wonderful too!

title: Couldn't be happier! Best staff ever!!
text: We had the best experience! We stayed for 6 nights and it's safe to say the staff are the highlight of our stay, everyone is incredibly welcoming and caring. We were even asked which floor we would like to have the room on and when we mentioned as high as they could provide, the receptionist was very accommodating and kind about the request and put us on the 20th floor with a great view! A special mention to Priscilla Welch and Fatima for making my mornings every single day, with the brightest smiles and the most incredible energy you could ever ask for, such a delight to have met them, so sweet and helpful! Great breakfast each day hot and fresh, really helped to get the day going and keep us going on our adventures in NYC. The hotel is exactly as advertised, with clean updated rooms, and house keeping on request, friendly staff, lovely breakfast, plenty of amenities such as a gym and rooftop deck... what more could you want?? The location is also perfect, literally 5 minutes walk from Times Square and Bryant Park. Overall we had a great experience and I personally think this is the best value hotel you'll find in New York, will definitely be returning again! Breakfast is from 7-10 am and I'd say it's best to go as early as you can to avoid the crowd and get your day started early, especially if you're there to explore the city as much as you can.

title: Posizione invidiabile per chi vuole vivere la magia del centro
text: L'hotel si trova in una posizione comoda per raggiungere a piedi le zone centrali di Times Square ed è ben collegato con diversi mezzi pubblici disponibili a pochi passi (metro e bus).  La colazione abbondante ma ripetitiva, inoltre nel fine settimana data l'affluenza maggiore di clienti suggeriamo di andare presto a fare colazione, altrimenti si rischia di non trovare posto facilmente. Le pulizie della camera vengono svolte su richiesta alla reception la sera prima, altrimenti verranno effettuate ogni 2 giorni.

title: Excelente ubicación
text:
La ubicación es ideal si buscas ir a sitios turísticos en Manhattan o simplemente quieres hospedarte en un punto medio para cualquier lugar, 
Está unos 3 minutos caminando de Bryant Park y a unos 2 de Times Square. Hay una estación de metro a una cuadra. 
La habitación es pequeña pero muy cómoda, limpia y suficiente. El personal fue amable.

title: VERY NICE HOTEL.. GREAT LOCATION
text: I have said it earlier .. will say it again.   This hotel is one of the best in NEW YORK City. .. Time Square. Location is just awesome. Everything in walking distance.  Staff members are just amazing. Restaurant crew is top notch .. good breakfast.  Thanks to all the staff members .. you guys know who you are …   Will stay here again in a heartbeat .. FAIZ

title: Uma ótima opção na Times Square
text: Ótimo hotel, ao lado da Times Square e de duas estações do metrô, nas proximidades do Bryant Park. Funcionários cordiais  a atenciosos, quartos de bom tamanho, com cofre  e com limpeza diária, se requerida. Excelente café da manhã, acima dos padrões dos EUA, com academia bem aparelhada 24 hrs. Wi-Fi de excelente qualidade.

title: Highly recommend, great staff!
text:
Everyone on the staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make our stay very enjoyable and easy. From the moment our bellman Joseph stored our luggage early, the check in staff, even a maintenance guy and a housekeeper helped me outside of their regular duties.
The breakfast was nice and the staff there very friendly, one particular lady so very friendly and making sure all the women felt special on Mother's Day! J. Was very friendly and helpful with my Hilton Honors needs! I would absolutely recommend this location!!

title: Clean and great location
text: Great location. Very basic rooms. Housekeeping per request- we had no issues at all receiving daily housekeeping. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful at every encounter. Breakfast area was clean and well taken care of by staff. Would recommend if you don’t need anything fancy and want a good location.

title: Shane, made it five star.
text: It all starts at the front desk. We had a 3pm Broadway show and a 3pm check in time. Shane was able to check us in early so it made our lives easier. Hotel location is great. Small rooms. Elevators (3), can some times be a little challenging. Clean and well staffed.Have stayed in 2 Hamptons in the Times Square area, this one I liked better

title: Convenient and comfortable stay in a busy part of town.
text:
Very comfortable and quiet.  In a busy part of Manhattan but on a side street near to services - particularly shops in Port Authority bus terminal and subway lines.
The usual satisfactory Hampton hot breakfast, though starting at 7am that is later than most.
Rooms a bit small, but well equipped and comfortable.  The staff were particularly pleasant and helpful.

title: Very Good Stay Here!
text:
Excellent location. Very clean. Super clean. i felt very safe here, also. Good staff.
Good breakfast, included. That really saves some money.  Competitive pricing here, also. Elevators were working very well. If you want to be steps away from the theater district with breakfast included and want an excellent choice, stay here.

title: Best Place to Stay in mid-town
text: We had a group of 40 students here for 7 days. Kevin and his staff are the friendliest most accommodating I’ve had in bringing groups to New York City in 15 years. If you want amazing service and want to stay in mid-town look no further.

title: Friendly staff, enjoyable and clean -  in the middle of Times Square
text: First trip to NYC in 40+ years and was pleasantly surprised at the friendliness, and attentive staff.  Small but clean room with a view of the city.  Breakfast and elevators crowded (expected in a large city) -  close to Broadway Shows!

title: Friendly Staff, Clean And Comfortable Rooms
text:
We went to celebrate a birthday and had stayed at this hotel back when it was a Hilton Garden Inn and liked the location even though it was now a Hampton Inn we decided to stay there again.

Even though the name had changed, the staff was just as friendly as the previous staff.

Especially friendly were the two ladies, June and Amy, who worked for Hilton Grand Vacations.

Our room was clean and comfortable. 

If we make it back to NYC, this hotel would be on our list of choices.

title: Great location / Super value
text: The staff was awesome and caring.  The hotel is extremely clean.  The rooms are good size for New York.  The breakfast was amazing.  The perfect location in Times Square.  Restaurants, excitement, and Broadway Shows just around the corner.

title: We can’t wait to go back!!!!
text: This is our 2nd stay here.  It is the perfect location!  Staff is so friendly and helpful.  I have to give a “shout out” to Joseph and Fatima!!!  I hope Hilton appreciates you two!!!  Joseph is the bellman/concierge, and treats everyone with kindness and respect.  He helped us with directions, tickets, suggestions- really anything we needed!!!  Fatima is the beautiful lady who greets all the guests as they arrive for breakfast.  She makes you feel so welcome.  The breakfast is immaculately presented- thanks to her attention to detail, and hard work -and is always fresh and delicious!  We loved our stay, and can’t wait to visit again soon!!!

title: Great location, great value!
text: Great location!  If you want a central location close to the metro and walking distance to great bars and restaurants in midtown NY, this is it.  The rooms are kind of small, but it is NY.  We are hardly in our rooms anyway.  We were always out exploring the city and just needed to beds to sleep.  My kids loved the observation deck on top.  I would put a few tables and chairs out there to enjoy with a glass of wine.  The complimentary breakfast was awesome and Fatima took great care of the food.  It was always a little crowded, so get down there early if you want to sit.  Would stay here again

title: Best location!
text: You cannot beat this location, steps away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Kimberli at the front desk was so engaging with my daughter when we first arrived.  There's an observation deck on roof that is just lovely to head up to and take in the city from above.  The staff members were all very friendly and went out of their way to say hi and ask if we needed help.  We stayed in the highest floor available, which can mean a little bit of a wait for the elevators during the busy breakfast and checkout times.  Otherwise the room was quiet, clean, and just what we needed for an overnight stay.

title: Great Place To Stay Near Times Square and Theater District
text:
We had a great time during our stay here! It’s beds were comfy and the rooms were clean. We also had complimentary soap, shampoo, conditioner, and lotion in our bathroom. The free/included breakfast had waffles, bagels, eggs, potatoes, meat (bacon, smoked sausage, or sausage links), fruit and oatmeal. They also had complimentary coffee and hot tea all day. We were able to use the laundry (only $2.00 to wash & $2.00 to dry, we brought pods and dryer sheets from home but they have for sale).

The staff was very nice and helpful! We had never stayed so close to Times Square and the Theater District and they helped us a lot with walking and subway directions. They also let us print out our theater tickets. Our flight was later than check-out so they stored our bags, arranged a car to the airport, and gave us a bag of waters and snacks (Thank you, Joseph!). I didn’t get everyone’s name, but the staff was very friendly and helpful. 

If you want to stay near Broadway Shows, Times Square, and lots of restaurants - this is a good one. The Nealander Theater is next door (now showing Shucked). Shnipper’s is right down the street (burgers, shakes, salads, fries). Pizza and Red Lobster nearby. You can walk to Carlo’s Bakery, Shake Shake, Smash Burger, and Italian eateries all within a 10 minute walk. We saw 7 Broadway Shows and toured Radio City Music Hall and it never took more than 10-12 minutes to get there. 

Definitely would stay here again!

title: Fantastic!
text:
BUCHA WAS AMAZING- HELPED US PLAN OUR ADVENTURES in the city
We didn't even know billy Joel is playing tonight we are ao excited a check off our bucket list. She is so helpful in the best way. Hampton always a wonderful stay

title: Great location
text: I stayed here for 2 nights, good location but I was disappointed with my room on the 9th floor. As soon as I walked in I noticed filthy headboard. Big mirror on the wall was not cleaned properly, carpet was dirty and there was an empty water bottle under AC unit.  No fridge or microwave. Water in the bathroom was coming out hot even from the cold faucet. Bed was comfortable, I slept well. Concierge Joseph was fantastic, took great care of my bag when I told him that I have records in there. Breakfast lady was incredible, greeted everybody with enthusiasm and compliment, very inspiring energy so early in the morning. Coffee at the hotel was excellent. Everybody at the front desk was welcoming, nice and polite.

title: A charming Hilton Property
text: I have stayed at this property a few times.  It is charming, conveniently located in the Times Square district, close to almost everything Mid-town.  They have some of the best Front desk team. Warm, friendly, professional, and caring.  I will surely return to this property.

title: Da tornarci
text:
Situato in zona strategica a tutto, da qui puoi raggiungere qualsiasi punto della città e non solo.
Albergo senza grosse pretese, pulito, personale cortese, buona offerta la mattina a colazione per iniziare bene la giornata.

title: Nunca nos pasó. Una lástima.
text:
Lo primero que voy a destacar son las cosas buenas del hotel. Su ubicación es inmejorable a pocas cuadras de times square. La habitación fue de un tamaño mas que aceptable, la cama muy cómoda, la ducha y el baño muy buenos y no se escuchaban ruidos de otras habitaciones. La atención y simpatía de una de las chicas del desayuno es para destacar.
Lo malo, en 6 (SEIS) días completos que estuvimos alojados, nos hicieron la limpieza de la habitación solo UNA vez. Y solo reaccionaron ante varios reclamos que hicimos personalmente y por el teléfono de la habitación. Nunca hubo en recepción alguien que hable español y tampoco fueron amables. 
Un punto a mejorar es el desayuno, claramente está pensado para turistas estadounidenses y europeos, no había nada de panificación, solo salchichas, huevos, panceta, wafles, etc.

title: Great location and great staff in a nice clean hotel close to everything!
text: Great hotel in a wonderful location!  The staff was very friendly, the breakfast staff was amazing keeping all the food going and the food was very good!  Easy walk to the heart of Times Square.  Great food options nearby and close to many theaters.  Not scary walking around this area.  Felt very safe.  Beds and pillows were so comfortable and rooms were decent size and looked very updated!  Will definitely return the next time we are in NYC!

title: Great Hotel
text:
When we arrived at the Hotel we were advised that are Agent had not paid for our room. We did no what to do. We tried to contact them with no luck. Jennifer was on duty at the time. She was extremly helpful in sorting things. I just want to say a big thankyou to her for everything.
The rest of our stay was excellent. Staff are so friendly at both reception and breakfast room nothing is to much trouble. Location is good just a short walk to Times Square and plenty of eating places. Coffee available 24/7 which was a bonus when out all day. Breakfast was very good. Lovely choice and making waffles was a surprise. Would definitely recommend and would stay again.

title: Front Desk, Brianna.
text: Brianna at the front desk was amazing. Very friendly, informative and helpful. Our flight got cancelled and she helped me rebook at the last minute. Couldn’t be more thankful for her, working with me and getting rebooked, especially being so busy, thank you.

title: 10 Stars!
text: I have stayed at 5 star luxury hotels and this was so much better!  The minute I walked in I was greeted by Joseph and Kareem.  They made me feel like family.  Quenasha who looked like she was modeling at fashion week was phenomenal she's at the front desk and super warm and caring.  Everyone's energy was amazing.  The rooms are spacious and very clean.  Complimentary coffee in the lobby which I enjoyed. Fatima at breakfast makes you feel welcomed.  Her energy and charisma is what I needed this morning.  I highly recommend this hotel it's on a side street but in the middle of Times Square.  Walking distance to Chipotle McDonald's Old Navy and so much more.

title: Fatima's Energy will get you right for the start of the day!!!!
text: I recently visited Manhattan on a professional business trip and stay at this hotel.  I didn't have the best welcome because they had difficulty locating my roommate in their system.  I later found out that her name was transposed and they didn't even bother using critical thinking skills to solve that issue.  The saving grace for this place was their employee in the breakfast area- her name is FATIMA.  And oh wow, her energy each morning that I was there was on fire.  She really made my stay turn from sour to sweet.  She was extremely pleasant and welcoming to not just me but to every person that came to eat breakfast.  She had a name for the breakfast serving of the day and she remembered my colleagues preference for gluten free items.  You could tell that she was very genuine with her personality.  Everyone she came across received the same energy.  I'm not sure why this woman, FATIMA, isn't on a billboard somewhere really showcasing hospitality.  I honestly can't say enough about her.  She really made me want to have a Tik Tok so that I could show people what I mean.  The woman needs a raise, a promotion, something because she's definitely a Hampton Inn best kept secret talent.

title: Great location, view, security and breakfast
text: Great location near Time square, great access to restaurants and public transportation, spectacular roof top, good daily breakfast, very clean hotel, modern facilities, elevators and great friendly staff.

title: A fantastic stay!
text: My favorite hotel in Manhattan. The staff is wonderful, the rooms spacious, and the amenities were exactly what I wanted. The team could not have been more generous, friendly, or accommodating. Thank you!

title: Wonderful!
text: Great hotel.  Staff are great.  Ricardo always has a smile and remembers return clients! The rooms are nice. It's a bit of a pain in the butt to get through times square, but that's okay because it's easy to get to midtown clients.

title: Très bon rapport qualité prix
text:
Cet hôtel est vraiment une bonne option pour un séjour à New York à un prix relativement contenu.
Niveau emplacement, on ne peut presque pas faire mieux, Times square à 5 min à pied, station de métro au bout de la rue, rue calme...
Nous avons trouvé la chambre propre, il faut demander la veille à l'accueil si vous voulez qu'elle soit faite pendant votre séjour.
Le gros plus est le petit déjeuner, il faut arriver tôt car la salle n'est pas grande, mais nous nous sommes régalés. Le petit déjeuner est compris, chose de plus en plus rare.
Il y a du thé et du café disponible dans le hall toute la journée.
N'hésitez pas à aller au dernier étage "rooftop" pour une petite photo des building.

Le personnel est sympathique et serviable, garde des valises avant le départ, appel d'un taxi.

Bref je recommande cet hôtel

title: Great Hotel in Great Location
text: Amazingly clean and friendly hotel. Room was very comfortable. We even had a terrific view! Breakfast was great incredible (shout out to Fatima). Front desk staff very helpful and pleasant. Will definitely be back!

title: excelente localização !!
text:
Fiquei uma semana hospedado neste hotel e gostaria de deixar minhas impressões:
O hotel é  bem localizado,  fica a poucos passos do Port Authority,   da Times Square e de  estações do metrô, ou seja, você vai para qualquer lugar com  facilidade.
O quarto é  bom !  cama king, travesseiros muito bons; roupas de cama e banho limpas e novas... Possui cofre, secador de cabelo, tabua de passar, tv com vários canais e uma cafeteira. O banheiro é espaçoso e tem uma ducha boa...
Algumas pessoas reclamaram da demora nos elevadores e realmente em alguns horários, eles demoram um pouco, entretanto, nada que atrapalhe sua estadia, inclusive, sugiro um andar alto.
Os colaboradores são bastante prestativos ,  educados. A Fátima, o café da manha é nota 10 !!!! Alegre, feliz e sempre disposta a ajudar !!  hotel possui café da manha. Coisa rara em Nova York.
O café da manha é bom e com alguma variedade, mas o espaço é pequeno para tanta gente, algumas pessoas levam o café para o quarto ou tomam na recepção do hotel...
Seria bom se o hotel aumentasse o  horário. Talvez de 6;00 ate 10;00 ou de 7:00 ate 10;30..  fica  a sugestão.
O check in e o check out,  foram rápidos. 
Se  chegar  cedo, eles guardam suas malas e vc pode dar uma volta até a hora do check in...
Quando vc chega , o hotel oferece água ou uns cookies e deixa a disposição dos hospedes, na recepção, chá e café durante todos os dias, quando vc chega da rua, com frio, é muito bom tomar um cafezinho...
Bem, recomendo esse hotel sem medo de errar !!

title: Estadia hotel
text:
Mi estadia en el hotel a sido excelente, mi familia y yo hemos disfrutado mucho y quiero destacar la amabilidad del personal del Hotel. La ubicación del hotel es excelente.
Quiero destacar de sobremanera la amabilidad el personal del hotel y especialmente la persona Bellboy

title: The BEST hotel experience!
text: I am so glad that I went with this hotel (220 West 41st St)! The location is perfect for seeing shows and Times Square. The subway is right there for getting around to other sites. Not only was location prime, but the staff at this hotel are AMAZING. The staff greeted us right away with smiles and a sense of cheerfulness. They all genuinely seemed happy we were there. We had an easy time checking in. This Hampton Inn is like others I've been at, so expect the Hampton Inn experience. In addition, our family felt extremely safe staying there. In order to get into the hotel, you need to use your key card. The staff at breakfast were delightful. They made the start to day wonderful!

title: A fine Hampton Inn stay
text:
We were part of a group so I didn't manage my reservation personally. I always request to be away from the elevator and other noisy gathering points but couldn't do so for this trip. We exited the elevator on our floor and there was our room. I was worried it would be super noisy. However, there aren't many rooms per floor so it wasn't an issue. We were on the 5th floor and could hear street noise. Pack earplugs if you are a light sleeper.
The room felt really dark (decor) and there weren't a lot of light
The room felt a bit careworn. It was clean but it might be time for a bit of a refresh.
Lots of towels but, alas, only 1 towel hook. I don't think I'll ever understand that.
The bathrooms have that annoying barn door style, which do a very poor job insulating sound. Because the room is very small, there's really no privacy so keep that in mind if traveling with people you might not be totally comfortable with. 
I am not a fan of Times Square at all so the location of this hotel wasn't a favorite. It was convenient to Broadway shows, a bit out of the manin TS crush and an easy walk to Bryant Park though. 
We didn't get breakfast because the lines were always really long. Plenty of good places to eat in Manhattan though. I did grab coffee, which is kept out all day.
There is a rooftop viewing area but it closed at 8pm. Worth visiting, if you can.

title: Second visit didn’t disappoint
text:
Returned here again and it didn’t disappoint , we came in 2019 for our daughters birthday and brought the rest of the family this time .
Amazing warm welcome as always ,the staff absolutely make this place so engaging and friendly.
Rooms were ok I had wanted to email prior to arriving to let the hotel know we were repeat guests in a case we got a cheeky upgrade but there is no direct email for the hotel tried Insta and fb but seems not monitored rooms weren’t as great as when we first visited but you don’t spend much time in the room anyway .
Shower was great in our room nice and hot and powerful loads of towels and shampoo conditioner and shower gel in dispensers along with body lotion and there is also a hairdryer .
The second room we had the shower didn’t work on the second day but it was fixed really quickly.
Breakfast is great and sets you up for the day but go early any time after 8am expect to sit in reception to eat which is no big deal .and quite  nice watching the world go by .
Tea and coffee available in reception all day which is a greatly appreciated after a long day sightseeing .
Lifts are chaos and reset when someone gets
out so you are up and down like a yo-yo we often took the stairs to our room on floor 10 great to work off the breakfast , it was a really busy week lots of groups visiting but the hotel seem to cope really well , one night we were absolutely exhausted and not really feeling going out for dinner so we got a pizza from just a few steps from the hotel which was absolutely amazing took it back and ate In reception.
The staff kindly disposed of the pizza boxes for us .
This hotel really does tick every box , the location is perfect with a subway station right outside , staff are exceptional and the breakfast is great to set you up for the day and get going .
This is a good solid 3 star and a perfect base .

title: Family trip to NY
text:
We stayed here from Sunday 12 February to Thursday 16 February. After a 7 hr flight from UK then a 1hr transfer we were warmly welcomed by reception. The facilities were explained to us and a damages charge of $200 was put on my credit card which would be refunded at the end of my stay. This is still showing as pending on my credit card hoping it will be reimbursed by next week.
In the reception there is a table with paper cups and collars offering hot water and coffee along with cream sugar and variety of tea bags. This is a welcome treat if you have been out for the day or coming back at night after a show. We used this regularly.
There is an observation deck on 31st floor. There is a gym and laundry facilities in the basement level.
Our room was in 29th floor we paid extra for a city view (see photos of our view)
We didn’t experience a problem with the lifts however we were up and about around 630am
Breakfast opens at 7am - Fatima was amazing and helped us find our feet on the first morning 
Breakfast - a couple of hot options - bacon or sausage, scrambled egg or omelettes, cubed potatoes. The hot options alternated each day. Also had cereal, fridge full of yoghurts, hot oatmeal, waffle station, toast grills, bread, bagels, muffins, fresh fruit.
There is also a machine to fill up your water bottles for the day.
Everything used for breakfast is disposable - paper plates and cups, plastic cutlery, plastic cups, 
On our last day we checked out at 11am. Our pick
Up to airport wasn’t until 430pm. The hotel kept our luggage and when we returned to the hotel after walking all day we were able to used restroom facilities to freshen up and change. This was much appreciated.
Hotel is in a good location and there is a Target one block away for snacks, juice etc for your room or if you’ve forgotten anything.
I would class this hotel as a 3 star superior in the UK. The bonus was getting breakfast included and you only really sleep in your room. Bathroom facilities were fine - shower wasn’t really powerful. Iron and safe and hairdryer in your room.

title: Best Hotel In Manhattan
text:
If ever you are in New York. You have to stay in this hotel!

It is within walking distance of the Famous Times Square, Bryant Park, New York Public Library, and 5th Ave.

The hotel is clean. The staff are accommodating - special thank you to the Front Office staff for allowing us to check-in early to our room to rest (God knows we needed it after a long haul flight).

They offer free breakfast. I am impressed with Fatima who works at the breakfast cafe. She was phenomenal. She treated every guest like an old friend, she took care of families with little children. Help us to get a table when it is super busy.
It is so nice to come down and see her beautiful smile and warmth to start our day.

I am now a fan of Hampton Inn, a fan of Hilton. Thank you so much for the delightful stay!

title: Phenomenal!!
text:
I have stayed here multiple time. Just about every week, and you guys need to know that ARIF!  NEVER SEEMS TO FAIL ME. He's always professional, very pleasant, kind with all the guest, along with accommodating. Definitely an asset for the company, and reason I keep coming back. Keep doing what you do ARIF you rock!!! 

Franky V

title: Excelente hotel
text: El hotel tiene una ubicación excepcional, estas cerca de todo, de la estación de bus, del metro, a cuadras de la estación del tren, restaurantes, almacenes, supermercados, todo esta relativamente cerca para ir caminando, lo recomiendo 100%

title: Busca otro lugar  donde no roben
text: Llegas y te piden un deposito de 150 dolares, ese te toma por sorpresa, empezamos la estadia muy bien porque la habitacion estaba en excelente estado y el desayuno muy bien, siempre lleno pero tomas tiempo y no es problema, la pesadilla llego el dia que hicieron la limpieza, te aconsejo que mejor rechaces ese servicio ya que ese dia salimos de paseo y al regresar nos habian robado unos earpods, estaban dentro del zipper de una chamarra, nos dimos cuenta y fuimos de inmediato a recepcion a reportarlo, solo dijeron que al dia siguiente lo comentarian con la gerente de limpieza para que preguntaran a la persona que hizo el aseo a ver si no los vio, al dia siguiente nos dijeron que no sabian nada y no nos dieron solucion, solo al hacer el checkpout me pidieron un correo electronico para ver si habia alguna respuesta, ya paso casi un mes y no hay respuesta, asi mismo respecto al deposito de 150 dolares, estuve batallando para la devolucion pero ellos dicen que ya fue hecha pero que en mi estado de cuenta del banco no va a aparecer, realmente estoy decepcionado por el servicio, ya que el hotel esta bien ubicado, tiene buenas instalaciones, pero te roban en todos los sentidos

title: Recommend this hotel.
text: It was the best and most convenient hotel if you want near times square. I’ve been staying here every time I come to NYC. Very clean and very friendly staff. I recommend you to stay new rooms too compared to the last time I was there. Very fast service and I’m very happy with my stay.

title: Hit or Miss
text: I have stayed here multiple times.  It can go perfect or terrible.  It seems to be based mostly on who checks you in and also how busy they are.  There is tremendous difference in experience based on room location and whether you need to request anything extra afterwards.  If you are able to use the app, pick a room online that is not changed at check in (keep track of room you picked) and manage to get it right with the first room this can be a great base in Times Square.  If something goes a bit off and the service seems really bad, it can be disappointing.  So my 3 stars is combo of various 5 star stays and two stays I would struggle to even give 1.

title: Shane is awesome!
text:
Shane at the front desk is awesome. Super friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable about the surrounding area. He gave me advice on the best places to eat and they were a hit!

The rooms are also clean and nice.

title: Great location and value
text: Stayed here on a trip to NYC to see some plays.  Excellent location if you want to be in the Times Square area...lots of food options nearby and easy walking to the various theatres.  Given that we were right next to Times Square, the noise level in our room was very low...great sleeping.  Excellent value though the rooms are small.  Breakfast at the hotel was good...easy way to start the day.  A shout out to Joseph (Bellman/conceirge)...gave us some great advice on getting around and places to grab a quick  bite.  He made the stay even more enjoyable.

title: Usually Hampton Inn enthusiasts
text:
The room temperature was problematic.  Some came to fix the problem, but it recurred more than once a day...either too hot or too cold.

Breakfast area was too small for the number of people, and quality of the food was not up to our usual experience.

People were pleasant and helpful, but the infrastructure inadequate.

title: Great time for a short weekend.
text: Overall, staff was great. Hotel was minutes from Times Square and close to restaurants and close to most current shows. Ask for Joseph or Kareem for great tips on where to go. Staff was friendly. Breakfast was pretty good. Pillows were very flat so ask for more if you need to be propped up. Great time.

title: Buena ubicación, gran atención  y actitud de sus trabajadores.
text: Gran ubicación del hotel, cerca de muchos restaurantes y lugares de interés además de muchas líneas del metro y autobús para poderte mover por toda la ciudad. Excelente servicio y atención de Shane muy buenas recomendaciones y buen gusto.

title: Fantastic bellman Joseph
text: Everyone was really nice and it was a great place to stay! Joseph the bellman was just absolutely wonderful. He made everything easy for us very friendly and professional, very savvy and high-end. Nice guy! Took care of our things that we didn’t know anything about in the city.

title: Employee: Shane at the front desk
text: Shane maintains excellent social & problem solving skills. He is smart, kind, empathetic and cares about his work… and the hotel guest. His assistance was helpful beyond measure. He is definitely ‘A Good Man’.

title: Great stay for exploring the big city !!
text: Excellent rooms . We stayed on 2803 that had a view of the city and a small view of the Hudson River! Breakfast was free! Front desk was super nice ! The lady that ran the breakfast was super nice and energetic! The hotel was near many things ! The only issue has absolutely nothing to do with the hotel ……. The smell of marijuana was all over time square which was very disappointing! The hotel was great and the rooms were big in comparison to other New York rooms! We had stayed at Hilton garden in in midtown the night before and this hotel was much better!!

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: Wonderful stay!  Everyone there was so nice!  Joseph greeted us and Shane took care of us for the rest of our stay!  Our room was clean with an amazing view of the Edge and the breakfast was delicious!  The hotel is so conveniently located to Times Square and the Subway stations.  We will definitely be back!  Thank you Shane and your entire team!  Cheers!

title: Decent stay
text: Decent city hotel, with a good view of the city, if you ask for a higher floor. Nothing dramatically fancy, but the rooms are very clean and nice.  Breakfast is decent, I'd rather go out and buy something to be completely honest. I think I'd stay here again. Not too bad.

title: NICE HOTEL
text:
Very Nice Hotel with very good geographic situation 
 Breakfast is good but every day is the same 
Tips for Room ask upper floor to have great view on the city 
It was second time i went in this hotel

title: He's the man!
text: 2 night stay to see a show and peruse the city, seeing Rockefeller Center Christmas tree...  Whatever you may need please ask for Joseph.  He stands in that lobby next to the front desk, just looking for folks to help out.  Any thing from a car service to directions, to something you need in your room.  He has recommendations for anything you ask him an opinion on.  Always helpful and pleasant.  The entire staff was very accommodating.  We  would go back.

title: Pleasantly Surprised.
text:
Just completed a three night stay at Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square South.

I was looking for a place to stay this time in the city that wasn't going to break the bank after the holidays. 

Upon arrival I was met by Kevin at the front desk. Very accommodating and was able to get me situated with a room very quickly,

The room itself was fine. To me the first thing I notice is how clean is the room which this was. The size of the room was adequate for my needs. Possibly for more than two people it might get a little cramped.

Elevators might take some time depending on the time of the day but if you have an appointment, theatre and such take a few minutes exy=tra into account.

I was late for breakfast the first day but as an alarm in the hotel went off the morning of my second day I was wide awake to try it on day two. Honestly would have preferred to have stayed in bed as it was a late night prior but a fire alarm has a way of waking you up very fast,

The line for breakfast was very long as I think a lot of people must have come down the  same time with the alarm.

First person I saw in line was Fatima who was very gracious with a good morning. I don't know how this woman does it but I swear she was in three places at once in the restaurant. She is a great person to start your day with. As the breakfast was very busy it was nice to see either a manager or GM helping it. I didn't get her name but the theme of very welcoming people continued with her.

After breakfast I had a few hours of work to do so I camped out in my room. All was fine till I was in the middle of conference calls when the loudest of a drill started working I believe in the room on the same wall as mine. This went on for awhile so it was difficult to continue working. As the area in the lobby area was always crowded there really was nowhere quiet to continue working.

The alarm and the drilling are things that I assume would be one offs it shouldn't affect ones choice at staying at the hotel.

The pros more then then outweigh the cons.

I am in the city quite a bit and would check out the hotel again if I am traveling solo.

title: More than I expected
text: We stayed for a week and found the location to be perfect for our first visit to NYC: walking distance to almost everything, convenient situated between Broadway and Madison Square Garden, different metro lines at both street corners, easy to reach JFK. Our room faces 41st, yet the street noise wasn’t a problem. Acceptable room size for a family, quite clean, but not outstanding. Complimentary breakfast was the same every day and average: scrambled eggs, sausages or bacon, potatoes, pancakes, few pastries, no vegetables at all … Fortunately they had hot chocolate, red apples and bananas. On the third morning we found good coffee, sandwiches (e.g.: avocado, salmon) and salads at Bluestone Line across the street. Hotel personnel is polite, helpful, very efficient. Mini fridge can be rented from front desk for 20 USD/day. Beds and pillows are comfortable, offering a good night sleep after a busy day. I totally recommend this hotel, it is a little bit more than I expected.

title: 3 night stay to see Rockettes!
text:
Convenient location.  Caught the Coach USA bus from Newark airport and was brought to Port Authority drop off, a block from hotel.  East walk to Bryant Park Xmas market, Time Square, Rockefeller and many other sights/restaurants.  However,
my 75 year old mother and I had to take the stairs from the 9th floor each morning as the elevators were so busy.  Also, we were in room 909 and the music each night until the wee hours was AWFUL.  People across the hall did not hear it so I’m not sure if it was where our room was located.  Front desk also claimed to not hear it.  My mother could hear it very well, without her hearing aids!  We were there 18th-21st.  Music played Sunday & Tuesday nights.  VERY annoying.

title: wonderful hotel with five star service
text: My daughter and I traveled to NYC for a long weekend in December and are so thankful we chose Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square!  We selected the hotel because of the reviews and location.  Upon check-in, we were greeted by Bellman Joseph who was kind and so very helpful during our stay.  We relied on Joseph for many recommendations and transportation to the airport.  Our hotel room had great views of the city, was clean and surprisingly quiet.  Every morning we took advantage of the complimentary breakfast which was bountiful and delicious served by a super friendly staff.  Front desk was friendly and helpful.  The location of this hotel is in the heart of the city minutes from Times Square.  We would highly suggest Hampton Inn Times Square!

title: Amazing Hotel , friendly staff and great location
text:
We always received a warm welcome from the reception staff and one in particular called Shane was extremely helpful.

Very clean & nicely decorated, breakfast yummy very comfy room and perfect location.

title: Péssima experiência!
text: O hotel é péssimo! Foi uma tremenda decepção. Não sei como ele está com essa pontuação acima de 8. Não daria nem 4. O hotel é velho, precisa de uma reforma urgente. O café da manhã é precário: ovo, pão, café e iogurte. Tinha acabado as frutas no único dia que tentei comer ali. A palavra cordialidade não existe no staff do hotel, pelo contrário, teve um dia que a funcionária falava gritando comigo. Fizeram duas cobranças de cada quarto no meu cartão. Eu tentava explicar mas não se esforçavam para resolver. Esse é um lugar que realmente faço questão de lembrar para nunca mais voltar. Não recomendo!

title: great customer service
text: We had a great experience and were especially impressed with the breakfast bar staff.  They were friendly, positive, and  went out of their way to ensure that everyone had what they needed! We highly recommend.

title: Gem in the heart of Time Square
text: Even though this was a quick trip, this hotel was great. I truly understand why they receive excellent reviews, the customer service is top notch. Our flight got in early and Steven went above and beyond to get us into a room in time before we were to attend a broadway play. He was very  kind and gave excellent recommendations. This hotel is in the perfect location to all of the action. I would stay here again.

title: Nice hotel
text: The lobby is pretty nice.  The location was also pretty great.  The breakfast was better than a normal Hampton breakfast.  The rooms are quite small.  And on my floor there were only like 8 rooms. That’s actually nice as there isn’t a lot of noise from the hall.  The room was also very clean.

title: Vacaciones familiares
text: La ubicación es excelente, el servicio de los empleados del área del desayuno excelente. En lo que entiendo deben mejorar es en los elevadores. Uno espera demasiado tiempo en las mañanas para poder bajar. Creo que deberían tener uno para bajar y otro para subir en las horas pico. Por lo demás nos encanto. El tamaño del cuarto bueno para cuatro personas.

title: Dirty room & broken tiles that caused injury
text: We are Diamond Hilton Honors status. Because of this, we were "upgraded" to an accessible room that is larger. The room, however, was very dusty. In addition, there were broken tiles in the bathroom and the shower flooded. One of the broken tiles was raised and our daughter caught her foot, causing a cut. We reported it to the front desk, but they were busy and didn't offer any resolution. We would appreciate a call from the hotel and some sort of refund for our stay.

title: Wonderful stay at Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square Central❤️
text:
I took my daughter to see Billy Joel at Madison Square Gardens for her 21st birthday and chose this excellent hotel. I messaged beforehand that it was a big occasion for us and immediately, the lovely Lesly replied to say that they were all looking forward to seeing us and that they would make my daughter’s stay special.
They did not fail and in our room was a delightful welcoming gift for her commemorating the occasion and a personalized card which was just so thoughtful. I’m Gold with Hilton so that may have had an influence here but still, this wasn’t expected or asked for. Thank you Lesly and team!
We had a lovely, big room which is not common I find in NYC with everything we needed for a memorable stay. Comfy Queen beds, nice toiletries and all you would expect from a Hilton hotel.
The hotel was incredibly busy so breakfast was a little crowded when we visited around 9am so I recommend getting down from, say, 7.30am onwards. The staff in the restaurant were very helpful, especially a young African-American guy who was so warm, attentive and cheerful….I only wish that I had got his name to thank him personally here too but thanks, my man!
Our location was second to none for The Gardens and for doing all the sights so I have only great things to say about this hotel and the staff there also. I look forward to visiting again soon - thanks again Lesly and the team there and see you soon!

title: Ideal hotel
text: Excellent service and stay. They were very accommodating to all our needs and very helpful. Shane behind the desk was a star and able to help us with our luggage during our stay. Fatima was just what you needed in the morning to start your day the right way. Always so cheerful and helpful. The location was perfect. Would recommend to everyone.

title: Great location and friendly and helpful staff
text: The location is perfect for catching all the attractions near times square. The subway is right there and connects you to everything you would ever want. The room was clean and comfy with a good view. All of the staff was easy going and very helpful. The bellman, Joeseph, was extremely knowledgeable and very helpful.

title: good sevice excellent breakfast host
text: stayed 3 night for a christmas break. the room was spacious and clean with free wifi .must give a mention to fatimya the breakfast host who was extremely friendly and helpful. the breakfast exceeded our expectations. would stay here again

title: Hampton Review
text:
Our stay at the Hampton Inn Manhattan/ Time Square Central was convenient. We choose this hotel for 3 reasons: location, free WIFI, and breakfast. We stayed for two nights and three days. The location was central to all the activities and restaurants we wanted to visit. The noise level surrounding the hotel wasn’t intolerable, given the fact we were so close to Time Square. We would occasionally hear car horns and sirens but not the entire night. The free WIFI was useful, other hotels didn’t offer this basic amenity. For the price of my stay, basic WIFI should be offered to guests free of charge. This is just another example of hotel’s price gauging their guests. Complimentary breakfast helped save us a little money. New York is not cheap, and every little penny adds up.

I want to give a huge shout out to two amazing Hilton employees from the breakfast staff: FATIMA and LLOYD. Both employees had excellent customer service skills. Fatima greeted every single guest when they walked in the room. Lloyd made sure the breakfast station was always clean. Both employees are doing an amazing job and it did not go unrecognized.

Upon arrival, we were informed that housekeeping will not be servicing our room due to the length of our stay. If we needed anything, we had to call the front desk and ask. They did not make the beds, replenish new towels, or empty the trash. I WAS EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED WITH THE LACK OF HOUSEKEEPING SERVICE PROVIDED TO US. I’m sure their excuse is that it’s eco-friendlier. The reality is the hotel industry is getting cheaper with basic room amenities. On the second night, I contacted the front desk to ask for clean towels and to empty the trash. I waited for 10 minutes and then called the front desk for a second time. Someone from housekeeping finally arrived after I called the second time.

title: Nicest front desk staff/clean rooms/great location/free breakfast
text: Relative to other prices of hotels in the city, this is pretty affordable and the nicest front desk staff, helpful and fun. Shane helped us pick our restaurant and made himself available to answer questions about and plan our stay. Free breakfast, fitness center, and right in the heart of times square. Worked great for a few day get away with my daughter.

title: Best Place to Stay in New York
text: Overall stay at the Hampton was such a wonderful experience. The whole staff of the hotel was very helpful, respectful and very accommodating. The whole hotel was very welcoming, clean and comfortable. The only two downside of the hotel was the elevator because it took a little longer and the breakfast felt cramped, other than that everything else was perfect. The location is very good close to Times Square. I would personally would like to recognize the lady from breakfast didn't catch her name, but all i can say about her is that she was a delightful soul, very welcoming, very sweet, up spirited and overall made us feel happy. The other staff member that I would personally like to point out is Joseph, Joseph from the get go was attentive, helpful, respectful and very accommodating because he was able to assist us with questions, our bags and also with a last minute ride to the airport. In the end the whole hotel was such an awesome feeling, not once did we ever feel out of place or anything. If you plan to stay here, i can guarantee you will feel at home and welcomed through the wonderful / respectful staff.

title: Great Hotel
text: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights whilst visiting New York for the first time. Upon arrival we were checked in pretty quickly which was nice and told about breakfast times etc. When we arrived at our room it was a lot smaller than what I imagined however it was clean with plenty storage space and fairly modern which was all that mattered. The staff who worked in the breakfast room were extremely friendly and helpful which was nice. The hotel is literally a 30 second walk from Times Square so it’s a really good location. When checking out we were offered a place to put our luggage until we were picked up, and the staff had no issue letting us sit in the lobby. I have stayed in many Hilton hotels before and am aware that Hampton by hilton is more of a budget friendly franchise however I was pleasantly surprised with my visit and would certainly return again.

title: Amazing Stay
text:
just returned from a 5 night break in NYC, the hotel was a perfect location for exploring the City by foot or subway. All the staff were friendly and polite from us checking in, helpful answering questions about NYC to us checking out. Room was great and clean, Breakfast was excellent and plentiful and enough to set you up for the day and the staff pleasant and helpful
We would certainly return to the Hampton Times Square Central and highly recommend it

title: Staff was super friendly.. especially Shane!
text: Awesome location, buffet breakfast every morning, me and my family enjoyed the whole experience. Staff was very nice and helpful. I spoke with Shane at the front desk multiple times who was extremely helpful. Definitely recommend.

title: Great location & staff
text: Staying at the Hampton Inn Manhattan in Times Square made our first visit to NYC so wonderful! The location was great and we were able to see all the sites on our bucket list! Also, the staff was wonderful. A special shout out to Shane who was incredibly helpful and welcoming. We would revisit and recommend this hotel for the exemplary service he provided!

title: Amazing stay, Very welcoming hosts
text: I spent the weekend here with my girlfriend.  The hotel was amazing, right  at the heart of Manhattan and mostly at a walking distance to all attractive locations. Rooms were clean and room service was available at any time. Shane at the front disk was so helpful and always available to answer our questions with a big smile on his face. I highly recommend it

title: Tops in our book
text: Have stayed in several Hampton on annual trip to NYC. By far, this has the most to offer in room size, comfort, and a great staff. Bonus: street not as heavily used at night and it was actually quiet!.

title: Great New York city hotel
text: Excellent customer service. Friendly and helpful front desk. The staff in the breakfast area was outstanding. Great location. The bed and pillows were very comfortable in the room. Very affordable price. I would stay at this hotel again on my next trip to New York City

title: Very Good option near Times Square and Bryant Park
text: We have stayed in this hotel for 6 nights and it is was really a good surprise. Location is great, walking distance from multiple interesting places like Times Square, theaters, Bryant Park, Summit.. it is also very close to the subway. we really loved our stay. Breakfast was complete in American standards. We were always early so we didn’t have any problem to find a table. We would definitely recommend this hotel and plan to go back soon.

title: Love this hotel!
text: I’ve stayed at this AC quite a few times and it keeps getting better.  The rooms are updated and the service is amazing!  Special shout out to Ricardo who went out of his way and took fantastic care of me!

title: Will book again when in NYC
text: The location alone is what makes this hotel so good. Right on times Sq by a few mins. The room wasn’t huge but had everything I needed. Comfy bed, big TV, plenty of towels, hairdryer large closet and safe. I had room on 10th floor and was peaceful. You can really fill up at breakfast and grab a hot drink from lobby anytime. Staff were helpful. No kettle so bring one if needed also I would have liked a bathrobe.

title: Location and service
text: I highly recommend the Hampton Inn Times Square Central! The location is amazing. You can walk to any play as well as Rockefeller Center, Radio Music Hall, or Macy’s! The staff and service are top notch! Excellent property!

title: Good location but so so hotel services
text:
Location is good between 7th and 8th ave. Easy access to subway and go to Times Square.

Room is smaller than a usual Hampton Inn room but that's expected for the central location. However, the carpet condition is disgusting and beyond dirty.

Contrary to other 5 star reviews, some front desk staff are not helpful and not familiar with the surrounding areas around their own hotel. 

Bellman became less friendly when we refused to use him to get car services.

title: Awesome customer service!
text: Shane was awesome! He went above and beyond with great service! He was very friendly and had great suggestions. Overall ,The staff here was absolutely amazing! Rooms were clean and plenty of extra amenities were offered.

title: Experiência para esquecer
text: Estrutura inadequada para atender os hóspedes !Café da manhã lotado ,com filas de esperar para conseguir um lugar para sentar,bastante tumultuado. Elevadores lotados ,com tempo estimado de 15-20 de espera em média. Serviços básicos agora são on demand e com agendamento de 24 hs, e mesmo quando solicitado,não fui atendido ..

title: Excellent staff!
text: Location was central (and within walking distance) to all the places we wanted to go: Times Square, NY Public Library, Bryant Park, Grand Central Station, multiple Broadway theaters. We felt safe here. Lots of great food places within walking distance. Hotel (inside and directly outside) was clean. Room was large enough to fit my family of 4 and all our travel gear. Breakfast was decent. Plenty of food, even near the end of breakfast time. My favorite thing about this location was the staff. Everyone was helpful and friendly. But in particular, Fatima and Shane were the stars of this hotel. Fatima is the Hype girl of Hampton Inn! She welcomed everyone at breakfast each morning with a warm good morning and complimented everyone! “I love your dress!”, “isn’t he so handsome!?”. She helped elderly customers as well as children and those with special needs with such love and kindness and without hesitation. She was proactive in helping everyone and making sure everyone was happy and had what they needed. She is a star and should be recognized! Shane at the front desk was so helpful and patient with me and gave excellent subway directions!! I was worried I would get lost, but with his help I got to my destination without any problems. He helped me with my room and even helped with my ice.  Having helpful and kind staff is really important to me and I was not disappointed.

title: Love New York
text:
Shane at the front desk was very helpful and knowledgeable. He recommended some awesome places to visit and eat. 
Rooms are smaller than what we anticipated, but it is New York. 
We will definitely stay here again.

title: Sarah
text:
I will say a basic hotel, not fancy but totally perfect for what was required. Right in the thick of Times Square, just exactly where you want to be. 
I visited with my daughter for 3 nights and you are a stones throw from all the theatres, Rockefeller, 5th ave and if you feel like it you can even walk to Central Park!
Staff really friendly and helpful and even organized a car back to JFK! 
Would definitely recommend and would stay again without a doubt x

title: Welcoming, clean, and beautiful view
text: Amazingly friendly staff all around! Shane especially was awesome at check in and engaged us with genuine conversation to make us feel welcome. Well worth paying a few dollars extra to have a room facing the southwest side for a fantastic city view.  Room and breakfast spaces were very clean, and staff was well organized to feed the hundreds of people at breakfast time. Food was plentiful and hot. Will be staying again

title: Great location and employees
text: Just checked out after a great weekend trip to nyc. Location is great- can walk to so much. The breakfast was great- eggs, sausage, waffles, and more. The lady greeting everyone at breakfast is amazing and has great energy. The elevators were surprisingly fast. The room is basic but has everything we needed. I checked in online but for some reason the room wasn’t ready after 4pm and we didn’t get the room we picked.

title: Awesome employees
text: Ricardo and Davon was amazing from the time I stepped into the hotel lobby.  They made my stay worth every penny.  Very helpful when I needed directions and food recommendations. It was a pleasure meeting them.

title: I Hope Dayvon and Ricardo ARE STILL THERE when I return!!
text:
This AC Hotel was GREAT! Our room was very clean, the decor attractive and the space, comfortable. But what made it AMAZING was Dayvon and Ricardo, who both greeted us, when we arrived. They were personable, attentive, courteous, professional, and extremely PATIENT with us (...being ultimate New York tourists)!!  
Dayvon went the extra mile by sharing a complimentary beverage coupon, after finding out I was celebrating my birthday.
Ricardo took time to both share info about a useful transportation app AND explain its use, when we ventured out to Harlem and Brooklyn for the day.
TRUE ASSETS to this property!! Stellar customer service! They would be the primary reason I'd consider staying at this property again.

title: Clean, and close to everything!
text: Room was very clean, good view on the 14th floor. Shane at the front desk was extremely helpful. He took care of us all weekend. Always greeted us with a big smile, much appreciated. Suggested restaurants, bars, and clubs we could visit. Staff was polite and professional. We enjoyed our stay, we will be back!

title: Fabulous staff!
text: What a wonderful experience. Shout out to Joseph and Quenasha for outstanding customer service.  Made our visit to NYC all the more enjoyable!   Will be recommending this delightful hotel to friends and family!

title: Non consigliato
text: Viaggio organizzato da agenzia per la maratona di New York. Si confermano le recensioni che avevo letto prima della partenza. Camere piccole e senza vista, fila per la colazione e spesso senza tavoli disponibili, Wi-Fi debole in camera, aria condizionata alta negli ambienti comuni, fila agli ascensori. Ci deve essere di meglio a quei prezzi a Manhattan

title: Prima volta
text:
Ci sono stato per la prima volta in occasione della Maratona.
Posizione strategica per andare ovunque, varie linee metro a 1 minuto, stazione bus a 200 mt
Camere un pò piccole ma ben tenute e pulite
Colazione ottima compresa dalle 7 alle 10 nella hall sempre presente distributore per caffè e the gratuito, nei giorni più freddi mettono anche il succo di mela caldo
Personale molto gentile e cordiale

title: Great stay
text:
Had a week here great location just off the busy Times Square, 
Very friendly & professional service, complimentary tea & coffee available in reception, breakfast is very busy but plenty of choices & stocked well plenty of tables but try to avoid the busy times, the bedroom’s large bathrooms a good size great toiletries, rooms serviced on request & very clean, the lifts can be busy but for us we just laughed & went with it, it’s your holiday don’t stress, take trip up to the roof at sunset small terrace but nice view…. Would recommend & would stay here again.
All members of your team were so happy helpful & a credit to the hotel

title: Extremely happy with the stay
text:
The hotel was a good surprise. It was very clean and located centrally. Times Square was just a few minute walk from the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. 
The only thing that I was jit impressed was the breakfast.

title: Nice hotel
text:
The hotel room had plenty of space and clean with a great view . The breakfast we only managed to get a table 3 times out of 7 because it's a very small space and the hotel seemed busy, no where near enough space for everyone and it didn't matter what time we tried so we ended up going out for breakfast and spending someof our budget on breakfast. There was on some mornings guests eating breakfast in the lobby right next to reception which wouldn't have been a great welcome and fist impression for new arrivals.
 So a  nice hotel in general and we loved our holiday but Still waiting for our £250 you have to pay as a deposit on arrival and been home a week .

title: Great first trip to NYC
text:
Just back from an amazing first trip to NYC, and highly recommend this hotel. Great location, within a few minutes walk from the red steps in Times Square and very close to subway.
Walking distance to the likes of Grand Central; Bryant Park; St. Patrick's Cathedral; Rockefeller Centre and Central Park.
Room was nice and comfortable for the 4 of us, and breakfast was a real bonus. Staff were all very friendly and special mention to Tracey (apologies, I think this was lady's name) at breakfast who was so helpful and was lovely with our son. 
Hot drinks in lobby and snackbar is a great touch too!
Reception staff and Joseph and Eddie were excellent - getting us a cab back to JFK and even managing to get an earlier one when we started to panic! 
Our son needed a plaster and some cream when he hurt his finger, and the staff couldn't have been more caring and attentive.
Would not hesitate to stay here again, really made us feel welcome!

title: Great location and staff
text:
Rooms are quite snug for 4 people - the double bedrooms really are double beds so be prepared if you have teens sharing! Rooms are clean and nice cozy pillows and towels. We didn't have a great view from our floor unfortunately. The gym is very well equipped and clean and open 24 hours. 

Staff on the desk and concierge were very helpful and friendly - they arranged transportation for us. Breakfast staff always had a smile and were super fast to respond to any requests and spillages. Food always topped up and hot. Nice to get a breakfast included. There is coffee and hot drinks on tap in the lobby to help yourself too which was a nice touch. 

Location was brilliant to be in the thick of NYC and super close to Times sqaure, 5th Ave, Rocker etc. Metro station less than 5 minutes walk away. 

Not cheap but not expensive by NY standards.

title: Bien situé mais
text:
Nous mettons 2 étoiles car l'hôtel est vraiment bien situé.Tout proche du métro,de times square, empire state etc...Les chambres sont correctes.En revanche,elles n ont jamais été faîtes en 4 jours. Bruit extérieur de la clim.
Petit déjeuner: salle trop petite par rapport à la taille de l'hôtel. Omelettes ,bacon ,pommes de terres( produits ne sont pas de bonne qualité), jus d orange chimique.le seul côté positif c' est l appareil à gauffre. 
La dame du petit déjeuner est adorable. 
Accueil moyen concernant le check in et check out .Pas très chaleureux. Sans saveur!
Le gros point NEGATIF  ce sont les ascenseurs à l heure du petit dej.Armez vous de patience.
En résumé  très bonne localisation mais pas à la hauteur par rapport au prix.

title: Home away from home in midtown Manhattan
text: As an overdue birthday present we chose to have our teenagers have the New York experience.  We chose the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times square Central as our base.  We could not have been more pleased. We had adjoining rooms and they were clean, light and comfortable.  The included breakfast was a treat that allowed us to wake up gently without having to proceed directly from bed to bedlam.  One of our party had some mobility issues and they were   respectfully handled by the bellman, Joseph. In fact, Joseph became our go to guy for everything from helicopter rides to Empire State building tickets.  After a hard days touring, it was so nice to be greeted by Josephs cheery smile.  He made us feel like we were coming home.

title: Friendly staff
text: Our first trip to New York and on the whole very pleased with the Hampton Inn. The positives being the very friendly professional staff who were very welcoming, informative and helpful. Reception staff, housekeeping, breakfast and porters all went above and beyond. Our room was spotless but typically corporate with everything needed for a 7-night stay. The negatives being a little disappointed with the breakfast which is served on paper plates with single use plastic utensils giving an impression of a cheap offering and with little variety over our 7 visits. I can't fault the staff who sometimes struggled with the number of guests but some mornings it was a bun fight to find a table. This would be an excellent hotel but the morning breakfast needs a rethink. We visited New York expecting it to be busy, noisy, crowded and chaotic and it lived up to expectations. We perhaps were unprepared for the grim, dirt, drugs and the unfortunate homelessness evident on the streets around Times Square which we can't be blame on the hotel but the city authority. We felt safe in the hotel and its location close to some major tourist's sights and with easy access to the subway with plenty of restaurants and theatres nearby was an excellent choice for a first-time visitor However should we return to NY we would probably stay in a different area away from the mayhem of Times Square.

title: Would stay here again based on location, cleanliness and price
text: We stayed at the HIM/Times Square for 5 nights and were pleasantly surprised by a nice view from our room (no up charge).  The breakfast was great, lots of room to sit if you go early!  The front desk was accommodating for all of our needs, we did not have our room serviced (our choice).  They have a great service to and from the airport with great drivers at a reasonable price!   The only negative was the pillows.  They seemed old.  We will stay here again based on our overall experience and the location was awesome, close to subway and restaurants.  Very clean facility.

title: Centrally placed ideal for Times Square
text:
Nice enough hotel centrally located just off Times Square, rooms were a good size we had both a king size room and an double queen across our group, all clean and tidy on arrival. Still blaming covid for not cleaning the rooms or changing towels on a daily basis but this could be requested with 24 hours notice!!

Slight issue at check in when the room booked via the Hilton app on the 23rd floor miraculously became a dingy room on the rear of the 7th floor, but we weren’t here for the room so didn’t moan too much.

Breakfast is great addition setting us up for the days our sight seeing… we walked miles!!

Special mention to Joseph who helped us store our bags and arranged a cab back to JFK truly professional service he alone nearly got my review back up from 2 stars to 4!!!

title: Viagem em família - Plenamente satisfeitos
text:
Local: nota 10 para se fazer turismo. O hotel fica próximo à Times Square mas longe da aglomeração. Há 2 estações de metrô na esquina que levam a toda NY.  Ao lado da Port Authority. Os quarteirões no entorno do hotel não estão degradados como os da 36th para baixo. 
Hotel: limpo, bem cuidado, recepção confortável. A equipe da recepção é resolutiva e dedicada, mas não espere gentileza explícita (típico de NY). Café e chá disponíveis o dia todo no hall de entrada. Tem um mini-market. Academia disponível, não usei. Pode-se deixar as malas com eles ao chegar mais cedo que o horário de check in e também na hora do checkout. A equipe  consegue transporte de volta para o aeroporto por um preço próximo ao do Uber/Lyft. Só não se esqueçam de deixar uma gorjeta para o Eddie (quem cuida disso) como eu infelizmente fiz (me desculpe!). 
Não há luxo, você não será mimado. 
Quarto: por conta das avaliações, pedi para ficar no andar mais alto possível e essa é a decisão acertada. Quem ficar em andares intermediários encontrará os elevadores lotados nas horas de maior movimento. Me hospedei no 29 andar, ótima vista para o sul da ilha. Limpeza muito boa. Piso acarpetado mas sem cheiro de mofo. Camas e roupas de camas macias. Havia uma pequena geladeira, o que foi ótimo. Não tinha microondas. O isolamento acústico funcionou. O banheiro tem ducha e banheira, bons também. Limpeza do quarto somente por requisição.
Café da manhã típico de hotéis americanos de custo menor: pães de forma, waffles, iogurte, cereal, leite, suco, café, omelete ou ovos mexidos, uma porção de proteína. Copos e talheres descartáveis . Não é variado mas atende quem vai com crianças e adolescentes ou quem não gosta de caçar o que comer cedo no dia. Mandatório chegar na primeira hora do serviço, pois fica cheio (e o espaço não é tão pequeno como dito aqui). A equipe do refeitório é bem animada e ajuda a você a entrar no ritmo.

Em resumo: o hotel presta um serviço excelente e é bem localizado. Com toda certeza indico e voltaria a ficar hospedado no Hampton Inn Times Square Central

title: AWESOME EXPERIENCE
text: We have been to NYC a couple of times before, so we knew that the room would be small, but we were still very happy with our room! The front desk staff was so very nice! The staff brought everything that we needed to our room every day (we use a lot of towels...haha) and the bellman Joseph was top notch storing our bags and answering all of the questions we had about tickets, events and such. The room became very homey for us! We could not have asked for a better experience!

title: DOES NOT HONOR COVID ILLNESS CANCELLATIONS!
text:
Flying to NYC from Minneapolis to meet a gf for four days fund trip. She was I feeling a bit "off" and tested positive for Covid!  Hotel wants 72 hrs notice.  We made many phone calls trying to speak with a manager, left voice messages, etc.  Front desk said it is no longer their policy to refund for Covid....period!  I finally spoke with one of their manager and was told same thing.  SO......we have been stuck paying for our first night's stay.  $364.     JUST BE AWARE TO CHECK FOR THE CURRENT HOTEL POLICIES.  We even asked for a credit that we could use on our future trip there......as we will be making this trip later.  That would assure them of our future stay.....so win win for both of us.  However, NO, they would not do that.
We both travel alot and also traveled for work...(now retired.)  I haven't run across a hotel recently that was so firm on this, however, here it is.  Just be aware.
           Covid doesn't give you 72 hrs notice!  
  AND....initially they tried to bill my friend's cc for the room plus tax.  I called and told them they cannot charge us TAX on a room we did not occupy...per NY state law!  She was then refunded the tax amount.

title: Fall Break in the Big Apple
text: Stayed here with my husband and our 2 boys last week over our fall break. The hotel is older, rooms are on the small side, but clean. The breakfast was ok. The best part of our stay was the staff! Everyone at the front desk were helpful, friendly, and welcoming. The bellboy, Joseph went above and beyond to help us throughout our stay, from getting us extra towels, to arranging a ride to the airport, he was great!

title: Very Poor Service and refusal to refund security deposit
text:
We stayed at this hotel in September 2022. While the location was good, this is the only good thing about the hotel.   For the price and reviews we expected more.   Both lifts were broken during our stay with staff manually operating one.  We waited over 40 minutes for a lift before being forced to descend 393 stairs to get out.  Most staff were inappropriately dressed (gumboots on a female staff member and pants half way down the bottom of a male staff member) and incredibly rude for the duration of our stay. 
Breakfast was simple and of a poor quality.  The breakfast room is not big enough for the amount of guests and served on paper plates/cups with plastic cutlery.
However, upon check in we were asked for a $75USD per night security deposit which we were told would be refunded on check out.   At check out we were told this would take 7-10 days.   We are now 14 days post check out and our security deposit has still not been released.   I have contacted Hampton Inn and they wont do anything about it.

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Good location
text: Stayed here in September 2022  great location the  staff were really helpful especially Joesph the bell boy who went above and beyond to try and accommodate you and would stay again  and highly recommend.

title: Ideal base
text:
Excellent location, friendly helpful staff. Fabulous breakfast, made better by the super friendly staff. 
Enjoyed complimentary hot drinks in the lobby. 
Fast lifts (after reading lots of reviews of other hotels this is apparently an issue)
Comfortable clean room, good size bathroom, very clean, good shower.
Quite noisy even on the 19th floor, would recommend ear plugs. 
Would definitely stay again

Since Covid they do not service the room daily, unless you ask them to. They ask you to inform reception if you need it servicing or new towels.  This wasn’t an issue for us.

Across the road from a subway, so great access everywhere.

Took just over an hour in a taxi from JFK to the hotel around $85 inc tip & toll.
Returned via subway and air train, cost $25 for 2 people and took less than an hour. Really simple to do, even with large cases.

title: Great stay with disappointing breakfast
text: Location is excellent. Staff were friendly. Room was clean and has a great view. Elevator can be frustrating with the morning peak rush. I’m mostly disappointed in the breakfast. We had broiled sausage patty for 3 days straight, then cut sausage links, finally bacon on last day. More upsetting was I get there at 9 and the they had already run out of flavored waffles. I had a day of pumpkin spice only. Two days, it was cheese omelette and I’m lactose intolerant so not great for me. Location is great as it’s just 3 minutes walk from Port Authority stop so direct bus from Newark airport for $26 one way. Very easy to get to LaGuardia too. Also very close to the hop on and off tour buses. It’s far enough from the time square so it’s quiet but not far from all the attractions. Love the Carnegie pizza next door and Whole Foods is 4 minutes walk right before Bryant Park.

title: Brillient
text:
Stayed here in October 2022. Having stayed in Hampton inns before I knew what I was getting, a comfortable room, comforted and a good breakfast. 
This hotel is at a central location and you need a key card to enter the hotel door and the lifts. Of the 31 floors we were on the 28th, with a twin city view room, from our window we could see the Hudson yard skyscrapers as well as the top of the Empire State Building, it was well worth the upgrade. The rooms were quiet with 9 rooms per floor however we could hear the lifts as we backed onto them. All of the staff were very friendly and very helpful. There was a good choice of breakfast, we had breakfast at 7-7:30am, it was a bit busy but lots of seats available. Not drinks are available at all times in the lobby. Overall a brilliant stay and we would definitely return.

title: Right in the Heart of Times Square/Theater District
text: Whether you visit New York City for business or leisure, Hampton Inn Times Square Central made my stay worthwhile. I received good service, average amenities and prime location in NYC’s Times Square District! This hotel is near Port Authority MTA Station, Garment District, numerous shops, restaurants, bars and Broadway Theaters. Hotel has a 24-hour fitness centre, not the very best, but has an inviting complimentary breakfast, Free Wi-Fi. Business Center, and Rooftop Deck. Rooms are relaxing with a comfortable bed, air conditioning, medium size bathroom with low pressure showers, mini-refrigerators, desk, coffee maker and paired with a magnificent view of the city. Hotel room was missing a few pieces. Wall clock or alarm clock bedside, USB charging portal, and bottle water. Other than that, Location, location and location is ideal!

title: Great staff and service
text: Hotel is perfectly located for exploring the Big Apple . Only a 15 min walk from the piers that run the trips for the statue of  Liberty 🗽. Clean and a good breakfast service. Staff are excellent and the concierge Joseph was fantastic. He sorted all our trips and visits out for us

title: Convenient location
text:
As we have been to nyc before & stayed near central park, we chose to stay in Times Square this visit. 
The hotel is in a good location however Times Square a bit more busy, crowded and has more going on. A lot of undesirables about and at times a bit intimidating however a lot of police presence about so not all bad. 
Hotel clean and brekkie included which is a bonus as most are just room only. 
Staff very helpful & friendly, we booked a couple of trips with Joseph at the desk. 
They have a policy where they don’t clean or come into the room and if need change of towels they replaced in reception & anything else that is needed which worked well. 
As we were out all day & just slept here it worked well. Not the biggest room but you dont need this when in this city. 
3 lifts & 31 floors which sometimes meant long waits.

title: Excellent service, location and breakfast
text: Amazing service, excellent central location. Breakfast was the best and cheerful customer service. Special thanks to fathima from breakfast area!!! Would definitely recommend to people visiting time Square!!

title: Awkward start turned out for the best
