text: My family and I used an online trip service to reserve 3 rooms for 2 nights at the Hampton Inn, Times Square, NYC, in July 2022.  Then changed plans to have it only be the first night.  The trip service said I had to change the reservation with the hotel.  I called the hotel and cancelled the second night and got a confirmation e-mail.  Showed up to check in and they tried to insist we must pay for both nights.  Had a huge argument, got the manager, finally they agreed to cancel Night #2 with no penalty.  This taught me NEVER to book a hotel through a third party.  Only book with the hotel from the start.  The hotel was nice, good location, modernized rooms, quiet, comfortable.  Decent breakfast included.

title: Brilliant stay
text: We loved everything about this hotel. We arrived by 2pm and were able to check in. We stayed on 27th floor and we barely heard a peep. Considering it’s right by Times Square rooms were quiet. The staff at breakfast were so welcoming and there’s ample of choice. We were concerned how best to return to airport and the concierge was excellent and sorted everything for us. If I return to nyc I would definitely return to this hotel.

title: The worst value for money of my life as a traveller
text:
4 nights in this hotel, 500 $ per night, the second most expernsive hotel of my life (after The Marriot Doha, a top quality hotel).

The few highs: an average room with a good location, close to Timés Sq, and the kindness of some of the breakfast staff.

The many downs. A completely unstable wifi what it is simply unacceptable when you travel for work, I lost a couple of virtual meetings. Even worse, when I called the service at 9.30 pm the staff said there was no support and that I had to call directly the external technical service. Obviusly I refused. When the next morning I asked again for technical assistance, they promised that an engineer would go to my room. I am still waiting for...
If you pay 500 $ or even a tenth of this, you deserve a top high wifi, with backup and service.
Breakfast. Yes, I konow that there are other hotels that don´t even serve breakfast. In my case it was included in the price. I have been in some humble hostels of the Camino de Santiago where breakfasts are far better and you pay 30$ for the night and food. 
Awful eggs, bread, limited choice of everything, almost no fruit but some dead oranges...cardboard plates and plastic cutlery¡¡ in 2022 such an expensive hotels uses plastic knives and forks. Unsustainable, unacepptable in terms of quality of service.
There is no place to meet, just few seats in the lobby. Elevators are collapsed in the morning.
The shower was not going well, little water.
The reception service was less than average and unhelpful when there is a complaint. As if I was not a client. 

Yes, I know, this is NY, and a heavy week. This is the market, you have to pay a lot just to have a bed. That said...a good hotel treats guests different. 

Try another place¡¡

title: Fantastic hotel even better staff
text:
This was our 2nd trip to New York in three years and this hotel was exceptional in every way
The walk to Times Square takes less than 5 minutes but where it’s situated you don’t hear the noise from Times Square 
The room was spotless the bed very comfy no problems with the lifts at all  .the shower very nice
In our opinion the best part of the hotel are the staff
Everyone was so polite and welcoming and nothing was too much trouble for them
But would like to mention 2 people for special praise the 1st one is Kenneth in breakfast who had a massive happy face everyday and welcomed u in at 7am everyday with a lovely happy face and the other person was Joseph the bellboy who gave us great directions helped us to use the subway as never used it before and always acknowledged us with a friendly wave each time we saw him
Both of these staff are a credit to this hotel
Can’t wait to return many thanks
Richard and Tracey uk

title: Excellent centrally located hotel
text:
Excellent hotel. Quiet, clean with super friendly staff. Nothing was a problem - printing boarding passes and arranging an airport car for us. Rooms were well sized for Central Manhattan, and the view was amazing. Breakfast was standard Hampton fare, served by a couple of staff members who seemed very proud of it all. Wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.

Only very minor issue is one mentioned elsewhere - with 30 floors and 3 elevators, sometimes you have to wait for a couple of minutes. But only once was the wait annoying.

title: Vacaciones
text: Excelente ubicación.  Cómodo hotel. Lo único malo q no tiene frígobar ni restaurante. La atención muy buena. En la misma cuadra mucho ruido por construcciones.  Pedir habitación en piso alto . Camas Excelentes. Limpio. Buena calidad de productos en el baño.

title: Lovely hotel just off times square
text: After reviewing many hotels in new york for mine and my daughters 1st trip here we settled on this hotel and it most certainly did not dissapoint... the reception staff are really friendly and helpful. The rooms are a really decent size, we had a twin double room, lovely and clean with a safe, hairdryer, iron and board, plenty of storage for clothes etc. Excellent location just off times square so a bit quieter at night which is nice..i think the worst thing in the hotel is that only 3 lifts for 30 floors, so at breakfast time it can take a while to get in a lift.. Would i stay here again.. MOST DEFINATELY... see you next year hopefully

title: Visit to NYC
text:
This hotel is the nicest we’ve stayed in the city for the price. Hector, the front desk manager and Joseph the bellman could not have been nicer. The rooms were very clean and the breakfast was awesome. 
We can’t wait to return during the holiday season.

title: Book this it’s a gem of a hotel
text:
I had read a few reviews moaning but because it was so close to time square we took the chance and it didn’t disappoint the staff were so helpful and the hotel perfectly placed rooms were a decent size and we could see a glimpse of time square from our window 
Yes the lifts get busy certain times but they are super fast and u have over 30 floors to use the three lifts but just be patient for a few minutes 
We would defiantly stay here again 
And yet again can I say the staff were super friendly and helpful even in the breakfast room they made u feel so welcome and also the breakfast was good and you can make urself ur own waffles perfect

title: Great location, free breakfast, though rooms a little tired
text:
ON THE UPSIDE:
We didn't use amenities, though we loved the location (minutes walk from Times Square and shows!), and the morning breakfasts were great. Breakfast was super busy, so expect a bit of a lineup but worth it. Lots of choices. The concierge guy was very helpful. Great value! We would definitely stay again.

ON THE DOWNSIDE:
The greeters at the front door were useless. Never greeted us as we arrived or left. Spent their time looking at their cell phones. They need training or a talk-to.

title: Great Hotel and Great Staff
text: This hotel is a great location and right on Times Square. The staff were super friendly, the rooms were clean, free in room wi-fi and an excellent breakfast. The rooms and bathrooms were spacious. There is also a rooftop lookout which is sort of cool too.

title: Nice location and great staff
text: Nice room for the price and was especially pleased with Joseph at the bell desk who SAVED us when we nearly missed our flight-- he found us a black car ASAP and was so courteous and helpful in getting us out to the car and on our way. FIVE STARS for that alone--thanks Joseph! Also breakfast staff was VERY sweet and did a great job feeding a LOT of people all at once.

title: Wonderful Gem in NYC!
text:
I absolutely loved this hotel. First of all, you’ll be greeted by every staff member throughout your trip. When we arrived our room wasn’t ready, but our bags were safely stored until it was time to check-in and the front desk agents were giving us tips on what to do and where to eat (hint: Carnegie Pizza is a few doors down and one of the best spots in the city). 

What a luxury to have three elevators in a NYC hotel! We never had to wait more than few minutes, even during the busiest times. Hint: if you do feel you’re riding too long, sometimes go down to go up or go up to go down.

I found our room to be nicely sized for three of us in the middle of the city, and we were even able to request a refrigerator and have it fit comfortably in our room. It’s $20 for the stay which isn’t bad at all. There was an ice bucket and safe inside the room as well.

COVID protocols are still in place in terms of housekeeping not servicing daily, but you can request it and if you need anything the front desk is more than happy to assist, from fresh towels to toilet paper.

Now let’s talk breakfast. Signature Hampton breakfast with just enough tweaks each day to make it feel new. But here is where the staff really excels. You’re greeted upon entry. You’re told what all your options are. They’ll assist you with any questions or requests and in fact noticed I was struggling with the waffle batter and told me they’d be back to refill it before I could even ask. While it can get super busy, we scored a table each day as the team is quickly wiping them down and helping move it along. This crew made my morning every day!

Finally, if the great hospitality and amenities don’t help make the decision for you, let the location. It’s in a safe location a block away from Times Square… so you get all of the convenience with none of the noise (especially on higher floors). Plenty of food, shopping, shows and the Subway only steps away. Security was too notch as after a certain time you need your room key to get in and you always need your room key to use the elevator.

Also, it is walking distance to the bus station (across the street) and the train station (eight blocks). If you want to catch rideshare,  they never had trouble finding the hotel front entrance for pick up or drop off. The team will also help coordinate transportation if you need it.

From this hotel we were easily able to do: a Yankees game, a Mets game, The Empire State Building, Times Square, Statue of Liberty, 9/11 Memorial and One World Observatory to name a few. It is easily able to be your home base for all things NYC. I’ll absolutely stay here on my next trip to NYC. Thanks for a great stay!

title: Wonderful Staff and Great Location
text: The staff at this Hampton Inn location is the best we had ever experienced over many other Hampton Inns we had stayed before. They are friendly, enthusiastic and extremely helpful. None of the "I have to ask my manager" or "My manager told us that...., the manager is busy,,," The staff here was able to make professional judgement and decisions. In addition, it is located in Time Square, everything is within walking distance; quick walk to many attractions and restaurants. Subway station is right around the corner, easy access to travel to downtown or uptown. The room is clean and spacious lobby is a plus.

title: Ok hotel with great staff
text: We were here for 5 nights, the hotel was ok, nothing special, not in a particularly nice area and very noisy at night due to its vicinity to Times Square (our fault for booking so close to TS), breakfast was adequate, they had ready made omelettes but the had ham in them and as I’m vegetarian this was no good for me, there was scrambled egg, sausage, bacon, toast, fruit, yoghurt and cereal. As it’s part of the Hilton I expected a bit more.  We had to use paper plates and plastic cutlery.  The staff however were lovely especially Kenny who was so helpful and friendly.  The room was nice and big enough but after seeing reviews from other hotels it’s not somewhere I would go back to

title: Room clean but missing some amenities
text: No Mini refrigerator, no Ice Bucket , small room but that understandable in time square even I believe they can add it easily. internet is so bad we could not connect at all in our room , staff are friendly , breakfast team are professional

title: Room was not cleaned.  Manager Kevin did not address it even after bringing to his attention
text:
Room was not clean and manager did not address the unclean room issue.  Location of hotel is great.  Breakfast was good - make sure you communicate to clean room if u r staying more than 2 nights 
Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxccccccccccccccccccccccccccc

title: Perfect place to stay
text: This hotel is perfectly located in times square. It is steps away from stores, restaurants, theaters, subway access and anything else that one could possibly want.  The staff is super helpful and friendly. The rooms are small but very clean. The breakfast is surprisingly good and there is a great exercise room.

title: A show stopping stay in NYC
text:
From check in to check out... Hotel staff was amazing! Shout out to Quenasha Quintyne at the front desk for superior service and friendliness. She was a Broadway rockstar and helped answer questions and make our stay amazing.

Easy check in and bag holding until the room was ready so we could begin our NYC adventure. We returned in the evening to claim our bags with ease and go right to our room. 

The room is a standard room as far as beds, desk, bathroom, etc... window view was nice and when standing up to look out could catch glimpse of Times Square area. 

Location is a block from Times Square and on the back side of the Aladdin theater. Easy walking to your favorite attractions and restaurants. Breakfast is served in the mornings until 10am and includes many of your favorites.

Shout out to the bellman Joseph for excellence in providing assistance with our bags as well as arranging for car service ti the airport so we could enjoy every last possible minute of NYC without worrying about finding a taxi or Uber. 

Nothing but positive people and experiences await while staying here. I couldn't recommend it enough.

title: Perfect for theater night, terrific staff makes this Hampton stand out
text:
Had to give this Hampton Inn 5 stars due to its excellent location - we were within easy walking distance of the theater district and Times Square.  The staff was excellent from Argenis (sp?) at the front door who helped me with my luggage, Esther at the front desk who was pleasant and welcoming during a super fast check in, and Kenneth at breakfast who was pleasant and conversational and made me feel welcome. Breakfast was a full buffet with considerable variety, a welcome return to re-COVID services.

Some minor downsides:  yes breakfast area was crowded, the elevators were quite busy in the morning, the room we had was smaller than other Hamptons I've stayed at but still quite serviceable, there was no refrigerator in our room, and the ice machine on the 6th floor was not working when I asked the front desk where I could get ice.   

I didn't consider these show stoppers by any means, overall the stay was excellent.  I'd highly recommend this Hampton and will definitely return when I'm in the area.

title: Perfect location and friendly staff!
text:
Everything in NY is expensive - and our room was no exception. But it WAS worth it : the incredible location on Times Square (and close to the bus station!), the smiling, spontaneous staff, the room with a view...

Knowing that you only have to walk 2 min to get back to your room after a long day through Manhattan is a game changer. If you can afford it, go for it!

(As for the room in itself, it's your regular Hampton Inn, if you've been to one before, you'll know what to expect)

title: Good location, busy breakfast and elevators
text: Location is super good, close to the metro and bus stations and in the middle of Times Square. Rooms are small and clean and elevators are busy in rush hours (morning, night). Hotel staff are gentle, specially Ibrahima who was often receiving  guests in the breakfast with courtesy and good mood, even in a busy and super crowded breakfast.

title: Pleasant Stay
text: Very good experience staying at this hotel with family on a 5 day trip to NYC. Location is very central, close to times square, theatre district and other attractions. Hotel amenities meet the needs of value conscious families. Breakfast was good with various options and staff was very courteous and pleasant. to. Free coffee round the clock was good. Its secured entry using the room card is a good security measure. Only downside was its kind a tight with space but considering NYC probably thats the norm. Overall had a good experience and its recommended.

title: Perfect place for a New York getaway
text:
First off, the staff was really great. Very welcoming, helpful and all smiles! The room itself was small but clean and the shower pressure was divine. The breakfast buffet was more than adequate. The hotel location was perfect - close to Broadway, Times Square, and the office, yet far enough to not hear the cacophony of sirens and other city noises. 

We would definitely stay again!

title: Great breakfast thanks to Kenny
text: Hotel location is excellent for being in the heart of Time Square. Room was k8nd of small, but clean. There was coffe in the lobby and a small store. Best was Kenny and his energy at breakfast! He was very helpful and made us feel welcomed.

title: Hands down one of the best hotels I've ever stayed at.
text:
Let me preface this by saying that I used to travel for extensively for work in the past. This hotel is hands down one of the best that I've stayed in ever. 

The staff was very nice. The rooms were exceptionally clean and for NYC actually a pretty good size.

The location is pretty central to Times Square and the two NYC train stations. 

There also wasn't any hidden fees that most NYC hotels are charging these days.

I cannot say enough about this hotel! I would definitely stay here again!

title: Great for families
text:
Great location right at Times Square.  Smooth check in and check our process. Free breakfast! That saves a lot of money when traveling, especially with children. 

We've stayed here multiple times and will continue to do so.

Excellent service especially from Joseph. 

Tip: request a low floor and you'll save several minutes waiting for an elevator,  especially in the morning.  And hit breakfast before the final hour of breakfast in order to beat the rush.

title: Great stay and perfect location!
text:
We had a great stay and for the primo location the price was very reasonable.  We were able to walk most places our entire stay.  
Large room for NYC hotels, very comfortable bed and huge shower.  Staff was wonderful anytime we asked a question or recommendation and the amenities were great especially post COVID which included a decent breakfast in the morning with  a variety of hot and cold options
It was also extremely quiet which is unusual for a New York City stay -the street outside does not seem heavily traveled.  
Regardless of the employees we encountered or shift they were working-everyone had a smile on their face and said hello.  
We would definitely stay here again.

title: Delicious Breakfast and Wonderful Staff!
text: Had a quick work trip to NYC. Convenient and quaint rooms great for the quick stay. Definite highlight of this hotel is the delicious breakfast buffet and the outstanding breakfast crew; Kenny, Dhey, Traci, Ibraham, Lloyd, and Will! They greeted every guest with a big smile and we’re all around just helpful. An amazing staff that gets your day started right!

title: The best hotel for our family
text: We had a great stay at this hotel and the location was perfect for everything we did. We had a great experience at this hotel for our daughters first trip to NYC. We will definitely stay here again when we come back.x

title: Great service and will come back
text:
Booked 2 rooms with city views and both were on the 28th floor - great views.  The room was very clean and tidy and you had a choice if you wanted daily cleaning or not. Cleaning lady was very helpful and friendly.
All the staff went out of their way to help. The breakfast room staff were polite and welcoming and the desk staff were very helpful as well.
The bell was very knowledgeable and looked after us.
The hotel is minutes from Times square and quiet.  A great base.

We will be staying here again.

title: Over Night Stay for Yankees Game
text:
Almost an excellent, very very close. Awesome Stay and great staff. Joseph, a staff member who took our bags upon arrival was great!!! We arrived early (11am) and the staff held our belongings while we were about to search for something to eat. This is where Joseph suggested Galaxy Diner on “Restaurant Row”!! It was great. Joseph was very knowledgeable about the area and was extremely helpful. 
The morning crew in the breakfast area were all smiles and helpful. Awesome complimentary breakfast.
Here’s why it was almost excellent. I was well aware of the 3pm check in policy. However, upon arrival at 11am, the front desk advised that our room was ready but there was a $50 early check in fee. Really? Again, I was aware of the 3pm check in but think they could’ve accommodated us. 
Overall awesome experience and very happy with Hampton Inn Hilton staff 
Room was clean and a good size for a Manhattan Hotel.

title: Excellent stay
text: This hotel is centrally located with the subway real close. Rooms were clean and yes they will clean the room daily if you ask. Front desk and breakfast staff were very friendly and attentive. Would definitely recommend.

title: Fabulous
text: Just retuned from this amazing hotel, staff all super friendly,  especially Joseph the bellman. We stayed in a room which had two double beds which was perfect for us as a family of 3. The hotel is situated in a perfect spot just off Times Square so super easy to get everywhere either by walking or using the subway. Breakfast is included which sets you up for the day and is constantly being topped up by the fabulous staff who work in there. Would definitely stay here again when we return to New York and would recommend it to anyone visiting the city.

title: Great location
text: Amazing location! Front Desk staff was great. Rooms were adequate and the cost for the location near Broadway shows is a great deal. The breakfast was adequate. The coffee was a little rough but there is a Starbucks on every corner! Lol. Great choice is traveling for a Broadway show.

title: Great location. One of the best hotels I’ve stayed at in NYC.
text: No complaints at all. The staff rooms and breakfast was excellent. Location is a plus.  One street from time square which kept the street noise to a minimum. This will be my go to hotel when visiting NYC. If you are looking for a hotel in time square choose this one.  You want be disappointed.

title: Location and personalized service!
text: The staff at the Hampton Inn Times Square went above and beyond to help make our twins' NY birthday a memorable one!  From the warm and special welcome when we arrived to the friendly, personalized greeting we received each time we passed through the lobby, this hotel values its guests and it shows!  The location was great, room was clean, and breakfast was included.  Have already recommended this hotel to a friend, thank you again!

title: First trip to New York
text: The staff at the hotel were all absolutely amazing.They were so good to my three kids, the lady working the breakfast was on top of it and She even made my kids waffles. The bellman Joseph went over and beyond for us. We were so happy and would stay again.

title: Son's 21st birthday trip to NYC
text:
We are first time visitors to NYC and we selected the hotel for the location as I was not confident to use the subways. I cannot even do the underground in london- maybe next time!
The room we had was large with 2 double beds , TV, fridge, safe,  iron and board and a hairdryer. 
Not great amount of storage for 3 people but we made it work.
Coffee maker with tea and coffee bags.
Water and maps on arrival is a nice touch.
The room was Spotlessly clean, due to the pandemic the room service cleaning is on request, which was no problem for us. The staff replenished towels or toiletries as you needed them and emptied trash if left outside room.
Thr bathroom was spotless and I personally would have preferred a full size tub after a long day but The shower was hot and free toiletries if forget.
Our room was on the 25th floor and we had great skyline views and could see the EDGE and the top of the empire state. 
The windows kept out the noise of the City.
The staff at reception were amazing , they all went above and beyond to help with advice or questions. Eddie and Joseph in the concierge service can book tickets and arrange a car service to the airport, taking all the stress from the holiday.
Just call reception from the room if you need anything like towels and they areive so promptly. Camille is so friendly and helpful on the end of the phone to help.
The hotel was always being cleaned and I felt confident all the areas were cleaned.
Coffee and tea in the lobby from around 5.30am a lovely touch after a long day out.
There is seating in the foyer area to rest or eat and a gym on the ground floor.There is also an observation deck on the 32nd floor which is a nice photo spot- don't try to go up during breakfast or you will have to wait forever for the lifts.  I felt very safe as the lifts and front doors you need a key card to access so I appreciated that safety aspect in an unknown CITY.

The little irritating points were to do with  breakfast. The breakfast room is very small and often having to wait for a table, not helped when we were there by large groups of youngsters not looking where they were going or occupied tables even when finished eating and  looking at their phones and the chaperones of the groups did not seem attentive or remind them of manners. When the large groups had left -  breakfast was busy but not bad. The staff again were amazing so friendly and helpful, they have to go bags if you sooner have breakfast in the room etc. Breakfast was waffles, bread and cake, cereals fruit and 3 hot choices each day with juices and hot beverages,  good way to start a busy day.
It was not the hotels fault but maybe the large parties could have an allocated seating time to make it more pleasant for the other guests. 
WiFi on the high floors is patchy but not a major issue for us.

From the hotel we walked everywhere we wanted to visit which includes; rockafella centre and shopping on 5th avenue, central park, the edge at Hudson yards, the high line, the circle island ferry round manhatten, the library, St Patrick's cathedral, Bryant Park, MOMA,  took in a show on Broadway and of course times square!

We had a great week and the staff are superb here and we would return here on our next visit to NYC.

title: Great location and great bellman
text: We loved the hotel and thought the location was perfect. They directed us to a good parking garage near by and we we’re able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. We also purchased a bus tour and one attraction through Joseph the bellman. The bus tour they offered was a great option for our family and when we accidentally gave away our attraction tickets to the bus tour people, Joseph was just a phone call away and he helped save the day. We would definitely stay here again. Very clean.

title: Excellent! Comfortable rooms, fantastic breakfast, perfect location for a first time family trip.
text: I spent a lot of time researching hotels and this one checked all the boxes. Simple, clean, quiet, comfortable rooms. Fantastic breakfast- a must have for our family of 4 and the kitchen staff was absolutely amazing plus a perfect location. We spent each day sightseeing all over NY and then came back in the evenings to clean up and could walk through and see a little of Times Square (which is all we needed as a little goes a long way) on our way to Broadway shows rather than having to take a subway. Afterwards we could walk to grab dinner on restaurant row and then walk back to the hotel. This was awesome. I picked this hotel based largely on the positive reviews from which I now know are well deserved. Kudos to the staff here. We look forward to returning!

title: Great hotel for families!
text:
NY hotels can be worn down, dank & underwhelming. So I was so glad to discover Hampton Inn was GREAT!

LOCATION: 2 blocks off Times Square/ Theater District. Was afraid it’d be loud, but it wasn’t at all. Times Sq is kind of a tourist circus w electronic billboards & such. But the hotel feels nicely removed from it, and very safe. We walked to Central Park & MOMA- around 2-3 miles round trip. 

ROOMS: If you book thru Hilton, they’ll let you pick your room on their app. Nice touch. We chose the 22nd floor (of ~30) for the view. The room wasn’t big (it’s NY…), but it was clean, airy & decorated in a modern aesthetic. Had a hair dryer, safe, mini fridge, lots of USB outlets & clean bathroom. 

BREAKFAST: Great for families. A full hot buffet— cereal, toast, sausages, eggs, waffle maker, juices, oatmeal, etc—not just a continental breakfast. Hot food changes daily. Not gourmet, but c’mon…it’s great for free. Served until 10am. 

PEOPLE: Everyone at the hotel was sooo nice. Esp. the folks in the breakfast area. They went out of their way to be helpful & their friendliness surprised me. :) Good job hiring, Hilton!

PARKING: None at the hotel. Nearby garage prices vary considerably, so I recommend using SpotHero or a similar app. The cheapest we saw was $50/day and only 2 blocks away. (No in/out privileges)

PRO TIPS: 
- Download the Hilton app. You’ll be able to unlock the lobby door, elevator, and your room with the Bluetooth digital key on your phone
- Fill up your water canteens at the breakfast buffet
- The elevators are super busy btwn 9-10am. You might have to let a few pass because they’re too full. Plan accordingly. 
- Carnegie Pizza is on the block & open late. Yummm Ask them to warm the slice for you.

title: Very Good Location, Very Good Staff
text:
Location is relly convenient, Times Square, Broad shows are in walking distance. 
Subway station: 42nd street/timesquare is nearby.
Restaurents, Shopping, whole foods, brynt park are walking distance too.
Staff is very friendly and caring. Breakfast is decent.
Rooms was nice, nothing fancy but worked very wel for us.

title: Good Location if You Need to be in Times Square - Staff are Professional
text:
I selected this hotel because it was a five minute walk from a training program my daughter was in. There is a Target around the corner for your needs. 

I do not like to stay so close to Times Square if I don't need to be close. It may be fun for a day or two,  but the noise, grime and smelling marijuana everywhere gets old. I am for the legalization of marijuana nation wide. However, I don't enjoy smelling it and walking through smoke everywhere and Times Square area is full of people smoking on the streets, with mobile weed trucks everywhere. If you plan to walk to Broadway shows this location is great. It's also close to Bryant Park and the lovely main NYC Public library (I recommend taking a tour here.) When we had late night hunger - we had great service from the small walk-in pizza spots. Also had a wonderful lunch and takeout from Tony's de Napoli. 

The hotel Bellman Joseph is wonderful. First Class. He helped my party get an SUV to the airport that was very comfortable when our Lyft driver did not show because he was at the wrong address. The car Joseph arranged for actually cost a little less than our Lyft from the airport to hotel and I was immediately at ease. Joseph is the epitome of professionalism, giving us updates as we waited and offering water bottles for the ride. If you need help - find Joseph and tip him well. 

The hotel front desk staff are very professional - especially Fernando. The first room we were given 605 had us worried. It looked like it had not been cleaned very well, curtains hanging off the hooks, bathroom dirty, surfaces not wiped etc. We went back downstairs to desk and asked for a different room. Fernando got us room 506 and he went up with us to ensure it worked for us. I don't know if a hotel staff member has ever given me that level of consideration. He is first class. The difference upon opening the door was striking. This room was clean. I can recommend room 506 - the only downside is the door opens right up to the elevator doors. We did not hear much elevator traffic from inside of our room but it can be a little awkward to get into when others are waiting for elevator. The nice thing is if the elevators are busy - you have a quick walk up or down the stairs for floor 5.

The rooms do not have housekeeping unless you ask for it. I don't mind this as we don't need to change linens here anymore than we do at home, and we reuse our towels. However, we were there for 10 nights, and I do think around night 6-7 there should be an automatic cleaning that I don't have to ask for. I wash my sheets and clean my home weekly and considering a hotel room is your place to live, sleep and eat - it needs at least a vacuum. I could have asked for housekeeping, but it required a 24 hour notice - and I would simply forget. In the interest of security too, it seems staff from housekeeping should attend to rooms after a set amount of days. That and garbage fills up so fast, that if you want me to empty my own garbage, please leave some liner bags in the bottom. I don't like calling for garbage bags every other day. 

Anytime we called for fresh towels, they came up pretty quickly. I am allergic to feather pillows, and when I let them know they quickly gave me different pillows. The front desk is attentive. I didn't eat at the breakfast, but one person in my party did and said it was adequate and staff friendly. The biggest thing I missed here - having a small fridge. The ice machines were empty at times. 

The staff here works hard to make sure your stay is good. Their job cannot always be easy.

title: Amazing hotel!
text: This was a lovely hotel! The staff were what made it incredibly special. Joseph the bellman went above and beyond to provide great service. After we had to check out he held our bags, gave us water bottles and let us use the restroom when we came to retrieve our bags. The staff at the breakfast were also super friendly, I can’t wait to stay here again.

title: Couldn't ask for a better location for the rate
text: I recently took a business meeting to NYC and used the hotel. The location is amazing if you are looking to be right in the heart of things. It was so easy for us to move around the city, and with most of my people never having been to NYC before, it was easy for them to make their way back. I personally didn't eat breakfast, but appreciated that it was included in the room rate. We were able to bypass it with our check in time, but there were lots of people dropping off and picking bags ups between 1-4 so just be aware of that and add some time.

title: Perfekt placering men små værelser
text:
Vi var der i sommeren 2017. 
Hotellet har den perfekte placering få meter til Times Square. Selve hotellet er fint dog er værelserne ret små. Vi havde booket et værelse med to queen size senge og når man åbner døren vælter man nærmest ned i den ene seng.

title: Godt hotel nær times square.
text:
Vi var tre afsted i sommeren 2017. Værelset lå på 28'ene sal så udsigten ned til gaden fejlede intet. 
Men værelset var virkelig lille, når man åbnede døren kunne man ligge sig i den ene seng da den stod klods op ad døren. Toilettet havde en fin og rummelig størrelse.. Der var 3 elevatorer men det var nærmest umuligt at få fat i en, pga der var så mange gæster og etager. Vi ventede i lang tid på at kunne komme med en, det var lidt ufedt.

Beliggenheden var fantastisk, den kunne nærmest ikke være bedre. Hotellet ligger omkring 4 minutter på gå ben fra times square. 
Kan klart anbefale hotellet.

title: Great location and service
text: I would give this a 4.5 because the only issue we had was the elevator.  The rooms were clean and anytime we requested something we had it in under five minutes. The breakfast crew was amazing. Great energy and always so helpful in the morning.  The location of this hotel is close to everything Times Square (without being too close) and Broadway shows.  We took the subway a handful of times but felt most everything was walking distance. Would definitely stay agian!!

title: Wonderful Hotel with Unbelievable Employees
text: This was the perfect hotel for our quick 5 day stay in NYC. Although, I've been to NY many times this was my wife's and kids first time. What a hotel to stay in, from the moment we checked in with Jenny and Fernando, who were very nice, outgoing, polite, professional and funny, to Eddie the Bellman who brought up our bags. Eddie made my kids feel welcome by letting them pick their own toys from the "Treasure Chest" behind the counter.  I knew we picked the right hotel. Besides being within walking distance to Times Square and the Empire State Building, it was the ideal location for all that NYC has to offer. There are a ton of eating options from your mundane Corporate restaurants like Red Lobster and Applebees to your NYC only Carnegie Pizza and Le Pecora Italian Restaurant across from Bryant Park.  The rooms were nice and neat, we did have a slight issue but Fernando and the maintenance guy fixed it ASAP.  The breakfast area was awesome, so much food and variety for anybody's taste. They had make it yourself fresh waffles, to toast, bagels, muffins, yogurt to fresh made eggs, potatoes, and sausages. You really had plenty to choose from. Fatima, Zakiyah, Ray and Jorge were unbelievable. Fatima especially went out of her way to make sure you felt welcome, which we all did. Great staff all around. The only thing is that the rooms are small, so 3 big adults is the max for your comfort, but that's with all the hotels in NYC. They are small and only offer double beds and not queen size bids, because the queen size beds won't fit. We had 2 small kids under 6 and 2 adults so it was perfect.  If we ever want to stay in the theatre district again, we will definitely choose this location for sure for it's location and such friendly staff.

title: Location great staff is horrible
text: This location is a perfect time square hotel and garment district. The staff is not pleased to be servicing customers. They do not want to help or answer questions. Who knew that after 10:00 in NYC there would be no support staff.

title: Graduation Celebration
text: Stayed here for 5 nights with my grandson Ben and always felt safe! The staff is so friendly and helpful, especially Joseph the bellman. From the point we stepped out of the cab from LGA, he was very gracious and took our bags right inside. The lobby is spacious and clean. Our room was the same way. We had the option to have daily cleaning of the room but we opted for just clean towels...loved that! The breakfast was good but there should have been more dark-roast coffee served. That is my only negative. I would stay here again! Bonnie

title: OK hotel
text: We stayed for 4 nights, the hotel was fine for our purposes. We had a large room with 2 double beds on the 21st floor, the beds were comfy with nice bedding. Breakfast was basic, hot options included eggs, yukon potatoes and sausage patties as well as toast and waffles. Downside is no fridge in the room, it was pretty hot while we were there and it would have been nice to have a fridge to store cold water, etc. The hotel also offers free tea/coffee but the urns were frequently empty. I feel there could be information given at check in with regard to internet access, check out time etc. We weren't given any info and no brochure with regard to hotel facilities in the room. The hotel is well situated and although close to Times  Square it was quiet at night. Overall we enjoyed  our stay.

title: NYC 50TH BIRTHDAY IN HAMPT0N INN TIMES SQUARE CENTRAL, SUPERB!!!!!
text:
Simply Greattttttttttttttttt!!!!!!!!!!!!
great hotel, great location, great staff
Special Mention for Rochelle, Arif, Fernando, Lise, Jenny, Camille, Ilana, Charelle, Eddie, Joseph

on a scale of 1-10 this hotel is 15!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Prime Location and Exceptional Service
text:
The hotel is perfectly located. Every single major attraction in Manhattan was walking distance and the hotel felt safe. It was always exceptionally clean and the staff were amazing. Kudos to Joseph who was just absolutely super! He was extremely pleasant, beyond helpful and always there when you needed him! The room was adequate but very clean. Breakfast was fine, nothing fancy but the staff were amazing!
The only con is the elevators. On the day of our arrival only one was working and it was a bit of an inconvenience but the overall experience surely surpassed the little inconvenience.

title: Traveling with a special needs group of adults
text:
New York City in June is beautiful. The weather was wonderful. We were located in a great spot near so many activities. The Hotel was quiet and nice.
The front desk was wonderful. The employees were helpful. The breakfast was great

title: Excellent location
text:
Viisted New York for the first time in May 2022. 
We chose this hotel due to his location and it did not disappoint. Very close to Times Square and within walking distance to lots of other attractions and to the theatre district. 
The hotel itself is a bit tired and is basic however it was clean and tidy and the room was comfortable. We were initially given the wrong room to what we booked however this was swiftly sorted out by the reception staff who were really helpful. 
Basic breakfast is complimentary which is a really nice touch however this is not really monitored and we witnessed some guests filling up carrier bags with food to take with them during the day leaving a limited selection for other people. 
Concierge were also reallyt helpful with giving directions and booking transport etc. 
Overall this is a great all round hotel if you want to be close to the action.

title: Excellent Choice
text:
This hotel turned out to be an excellent choice for our 4 day trip to NYC with our 14 year old grandson.
It is a great location for both walking and subway stations.  The room was clean; the beds were comfortable.  The street noise was not noticeable since we were on the 35th floor.  The staff is excellent.  Because our stay went smoothly, we had minimal contact with the front desk, but Joseph was extremely helpful with directions, etc.  The breakfast area is clean and inviting and staffed with exceptionally friendly, polite and helpful people.  Eating there made every day start with a positive experience!

title: Great People Work Here
text: Joseph the Bellman is awesome! He helped us with the bags, gave us water, and helped us find a ride. Fatima was great at breakfast! The food was always  good. Jenny was very helpful and patient with us at the front desk! She helped us check in and get a late checkout. The people who work here make the place what it is.

title: Great Location
text: Centrally located and on a quiet street. Rooms were average… and on the smaller side but we didn’t go to NYC to hang out in the rooms. Staff was friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was average but very busy and crowded… it was often hard to find anywhere to sit. Room cleaning is only done every 4 days unless you ask for them to come sooner. That’s ok, however it lead to towels and garbage in the room piling up. No fridge in the room. Not a big deal but it would be helpful for drinks and food since there is no room service.  We stayed on an upper level room with a city view. There are only 3 elevators, small in size, and no matter if you’re going up or down, they constantly end up stopping at mult floors. I’d suggest staying in a lower level room… floors 2-5… and utilizing the stairs if you can. Two pizza places close by… Carnage and Joes… both were great! Overall this is a great middle of the road hotel. Not crazy expensive and not cheap. Amazing central location to Times Square and shopping. Bryant park was close and is a nice little spot to sit, eat and people watch. BRING walking shoes! Side note… wasn’t an issue but the amount of marijuana in the area was not expected. RV’s that sell marijuana are parked everywhere. In some areas people were rolling joints on the street corner and smoking it non-stop. We didn’t care, but it wasn’t expected and caught us off guard as we aren’t use to that. So don’t be shocked to smell it often. Overall was a great trip and an amazing city!

title: Great Location and Clean Hotel
text: We had a small hiccup with check-in as we were looking forward to the higher floor room but ended up waiting for a long time and ultimately had to compromise with a lower floor room with no view. Having said that, one person from the Staff, Charelle was exceptional and very kind, attentive and welcoming during the entire stay. I only wish and hope more amazing people like her join the Hampton Inn Staff and improve the experience for every guests. Location is fantastic.

title: Great experince
text: This hotel was clean and friendly. Right in the heart of Times Square. We were able to walk to Central Park and almost all the sights. Lots of convenient restaurants in the area. Comp Breakfast.  Lots to do in the area. I had a room right behind the elevators we were expecting there to be loud elevator noises but we couldn't hear them.. The noises of the city no such luck but it's NYC it never sleeps.

title: Fatima at Hampton Inn Central
text: Fatima went above and beyond during breakfast. She was genuinely happy to help, said things like “I don’t want you waiting, let me get that for you, anybody that wants scrambled eggs, let me know… the other staff was excellent and friendly too. Hotel was clean, nice terrace for a view. I hope Fatima gets a reward.

title: Great location. Clean hotel. Attentive staff.
text: We stayed here for 4 nights as a family of 4 in a room with 2 double beds. The room was small but clean. Good job we were out and about all the time or we’d have got cabin fever in the room.The complementary breakfast is ok. The highlight for my boys was the make your own waffle stand, there was also toast, bagels, cereal, porridge, fruit, yoghurts and 3 hot items such as sausages, omelettes & potatoes, everything is on disposable plates with plastic cutlery which created a mountain of rubbish each day. The coffee was drinkable and the fruit juices were pleasant. The location of the hotel is fantastic, only a few minutes walk from Times Sq. there’s a lovely little bar next door and a little pizzeria that serves huge slices of pizza. The staff were friendly and overall we enjoyed our stay here.

title: Perfect in everyway
text:
this hotel was in such a great location for us. walking ditance to everything we needed and Subway just across the way. 

Staff friendly, breakfast was nice to.

Eddie was very helpful with booking us taxis to and from airport etc. 

Only thing which slightly let us down we wasnt informed for housekeeping we have to ask day before,it was on a notice in the room admittedly but if you are like me i dont tend to read small signs on walls in bathroom. 
We then asked for room to be serviced yet noone never came, This wasnt a massive deal for us but a need to know if staying.

Overall i would 100% stay here again NYC was amazing

title: La prima volta a NY
text:
Hotel situato in ottima posizione (3 minuti da Time 
Square, 1 minuto da metro e teatri in zona). Struttura non recentissima, ma camere confortevoli (ottima insonorizzazione). Pulizia piu che buona (cambio salviette tutti i giorni).Ascensori "quasi" sempre efficienti (31 piani). Nessuno parla italiano alla reception. Sicuramente consigliato per la 1^volta a NY

title: A great little hotel
text: Having just left this hotel after a 5 night trip with my 14  year old son,  I have to say I am very happy we stayed and took the recommendation from our travel agent. Whilst the hotel has no frills, it is simple, friendly and a great location! We had to get over the weed selling, weed vans (legalised in NYC) and general feeling of slight unease on the first night whilst walking in Times Square, but we soon realised it was in the whole city and not just Times Square. The hotel served a basic breakfast but this was a huge help as food is very expensive and with a teenage boy, was a great help! I would’ve like to see fruit, they had apples and oranges, but maybe fruit to go with pancakes and waffles. It’s a busy hotel so you have get amongst the crowds in the morning which didn’t bother us at all. The staff at breakfast were amazingly helpful and friendly! As were the bell boys, arranged a taxi to take us to the airport and stored our bags with no trouble for our 11pm flight. My only gripe was the room noise, which I think was just bad luck with where our room was.  We didn’t have a great view, fine, but we had a big air condition unit outside our room which was very noisy, we asked to switch rooms but they were too full, we then got used to the noise or too tired to care. There was also loud music and talking out on the street the first few nights, which again you can do nothing about. So to round up, a very pleasant stay, location spot on and we had a brilliant time !!

title: Times Square central
text: Great convenient place to stay, walking distance close to Broadway within 10 minutes, comfortable beds, good breakfast.  The only problem we had was no Tv the 1st night, but the maintenance tech came right up the next morning.

title: Assez bon séjour d’une semaine…
text:
... contrarié par des détails matériels inexcusables au regard du prix du séjour.

Points forts : 
- Bonne situation à Midtown, proche de Times square, Empire State Building. Beaucoup d’autres endroits peuvent se visiter à pied.
- Exigences chambre respectées.
- Efficacité de l’agent chargé des taxis.

Points faibles généraux :
- ascenseur (1 seul opérationnel, 1 en panne, 1 autre fonctionne en fonction de son humeur, ). Je m’étonne qu’une chaîne hôtelière comme Hilton ne soit pas en mesure de faire réparer 1 ascenseur en moins de 1 semaine. Le jour du départ, il a fallu attendre 1/4 heure pour pouvoir descendre avec les valises.
- Petit-déjeuner peu imaginatif avec un roulement sur 3 jours : patates / steak de saucisse / œufs brouillés, patates / saucisses en rondelle / omelette aux légumes, patates / saucisses / omelette fromage. Tout est industriel.
- absence de gobelets certains jours pour les boisson en libre service. 

Points faibles chambre :
- Ménage : pas fait pendant 3 jours, il faut le réclamer la veille et encore !
- bouteilles d’eau Honors: il faut aller les réclamer
- Prise USB : 3/4 défectueuses
- Ecoulement lavabo défectueux
- Eau chaude douche ; attendre 3-4 minutes avant de l’obtenir.

title: Perfect for last minute overnight
text: We had a quick one night staycation while welcoming out of town visitors. Room was fine. Comfortable, quiet, clean and cool. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Definitely a great value smack dab in the middle of Times Square. Will be back next time we theater tickets.

title: Not the best
text: As a hilton diamond member we've stayed in numerous hotels and unfortunately this was by far the worst. We were put on 28th floor and soon worked out how awful the lift situation is in this hotel. Only 1 works fully, the other was temperamental...the demand was too high and every morning and evening getting back to your room was nothing short of a nightmare. It would stop on nearly every floor and regularly be full. On our check out morning we timed it and the lift took 22 minutes to take us downstairs. Walking down 28 flights of stairs, with 2 kids and luggage wasn't an option. Our room was tiny, guess that's standard for the city but 4 of us in a room smaller than my bedroom was a bit much. Our bath plug was broken, the panel on our air con unit was hanging off and the walls in bathroom were full of dust and hair! I immediately complained and after speaking to a manager was told it would be sorted or we could move rooms. Moving rooms wasn't an option on our first night as the hotel was full. As promised repairs were made to room and we were given a nice gesture from management too. However for over $500 a night I would've expected way more. Breakfast area was small and very crammed in, selection not great either. Perfect location near Times Square/metro so big plus for that and friendly staff when we needed them, just not the best.

title: Returning to Broadway and Hiltonhonors
text:
Our Times Square home hotel the Hilton was permanently closed due to COVID. We then started using the Hampton on 41st. Although we miss Brandon manager at Hilton and Gazi from breakfast area no we are comfortable to call this Hampton Inn as our new home hotel as Hiltonhonors. 
 It perfect this weekend really only one elevator working for the demand of 31 floor hotel but everyone has been very pleasant. 
One to provide kudos for excellent services to customers the following hotel staff Arif from front desk very professional and friendly. Fatima and Jorge from the breakfast area. They keep the area super clean and Fatima friendly morning greetings create an environment of peace and friendliness 
Kudos to Arif, Fatima and Jorge

title: Ideal for short break
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights in May.  Great central location for theatres, restaurants, shops, subway & some key attractions.  Room was clean & comfortable.  Large walk in shower, no bath.  Housekeeping is every 4th day unless requested - we asked for this to be daily at check in and it was.  Free wi-fi and business cetnre. There are 3 lifts and one was out of action for our entire stay - not a major inconvenience, but sometimes a short wait at busy times.  Breakfast was included 7 - 10 daily and had a decent choice too - a different type of sausage & egg each day, make your own waffles, yoghurts, cake, toast, bagels, good coffee and a water machine - good for filling up bottles for the day!  It was busy at 7am when we went, but plenty of tables.  Staff were delightful and really helpful - both Reception & at Breakfast.  There a roof top view at the top of the hotel - unfortunately no bar or seating area!
Our only grip was returning to the airport.  Joseph suggested we book a SUV car through the hotel for $100, which we did for 4pm.  No car arrived!  In the end we got a yellow taxi at 4;30pm and it took an hour and a half to get to the airport through traffic!  Thankfully airport check in and security were efficient & very well organised and arriving 2 hours before our flight was OK. (Manchester airport could learn a lot - no faffing around taking liquids etc out of your bags!)  
Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

title: Great location & big rooms but painfully slow & broken elevators
text: Great location, good price, helpful staff, and decent and relatively big room for NYC. However, two days later, I'm still sore from having to carry all of our luggage and NYC purchases down 18 FLIGHTS of stairs to check out because we couldn't get onto an elevator, even after a 20-minute wait. The day before, we also had to take the stairs, both up and down, because of the elevator problem. One elevator was broken for the entire weekend, the 2nd never came, and the 3rd was always too crammed to get on or stopped on every floor on the way down as people tried to get on. The front desk staff said the one elevator had been out of service an unusually long time because they needed to order a part, but I wish someone had warned us when we checked in that we might want to take the 2nd floor room that was also available. A staffer was apologetic but told us that the elevators are often a problem because they're small and break due to their weight limitations being exceeded. Unfortunately, I would not stay here again, which is a shame because of the reasonable price and great location. I can't fathom what elderly or disabled hotel guests had to deal with all weekend.

title: Great hotel A+++
text:
I've been going to that hotel on a regular basis since 2018. So I can judge it accordingly.
Pros:
- Rooms: well maintained, clean, TV with a lot of channels, nice view. The 2 Queen size rooms are way better than the King size rooms that are way too small.
- Bathrooms: always spotless
- Staff: nice. The staff in the breakfast room is just amazing. So attentive, kind, helpful and joyful!
- Breakfast: free, very delicious, lot of choice. Literally the star of that hotel.
- Location: central to everything business or touristic in the city. Everything is walking distance close to many restaurants, stores, banks etc. Safe area 
Cons:
- No fridge nor microwave in the room
- No free early check-in

Over, I 100% recommend this hotel. Great service!

title: Great Location, perfect accommodation
text: Check in was easy and they had early check in.  Bonus since our flight arrived at 8:30 a.m.  Room on the 31st floor.  Quiet.  No rooms are large in NYC but for the price the room had king size bed, nice bathroom and a small frig.  Breakfast was a plus.  You just have to time when you want to eat, they are rushes.  Food is basic but good.  Very close to subway and times square.  Shout out to Joseph who helped with some bookings, luggage storage and car to get to airport.  Staff very attentive and great to work with.  Some other reviews have complained about elevators being slow.  We only noticed when it was check out time and everyone was trying to us elevators with luggage, so they filled up.  Otherwise, we had no problem with elevators and wait time very minimal.  Definitely would stay here again.

title: Otimo custo beneficio
text: Excelente custo benefício! Otima localização  para quem busca proximidade com a Times Square, metro quase na porta e é possível muita coisa a pé. Quartos com bom espaço para o padrão de NYC. Café da manhã bom, staff educado e atencioso. Nao cobra resort fee. Com certeza me hospedaria novamente.

title: Perfect accommodations
text: We were visiting New York City to attend a few shows and see the sites.  I looked for a property that was centrally located and affordably priced.  This property was rated highly partially for the free hot breakfast offered as part of the room rate.  We were able to walk to all of the sites we wanted including shows, Times Square, restaurants, St. Patricks Cathedral, etc. etc.  Very secure and comfortable location and it worked perfectly for us.

title: Shows and exploring
text: Perfect location for going to shows. The breakfast food is just ok but the breakfast staff is absolutely fabulous. They had gluten-free bread in the kitchen that they toasted special for her. The cleaning staff was also super friendly and helpful. The only complaint is there was no bar. I would totally stay there again.

title: Courteous and Kind Bellman
text:
Big shout out to Joseph, the bellman who helped us in storing our luggage and getting our ride all arranged for our trip back to JFK. He went above and beyond in being so kind to us, helping with the timing of our departure and hooking us up with a great driver back to the airport. Thanks Joseph!
Hotel was around the corner from Aladdin, easy walking distance to lots of sights and  having breakfast there made for a smooth start to our day.

title: Habitaciones Pequeñas gran servicio.
text:
Lamento no recordar nombres, a la llegada un señor rubio blanco con cara seria nos  recibió con prontitud y nos facilitó el carrito para las maletas.
Las niñas del counter increíblemente atentas y siempre dispuestas a ayudar.
Los desayunos, estuvieron marcados por la atención increible de Lourdes?, una morena delgada siempre sonriente (asi llevara tapabocas), un 10 en la atención y apoyo con mi bebé de un años (gracias)
Las habitaciones muyyy pequeñas para 3 personas y bebé, pero obtienes lo que pagas por la ubicación.

title: Great location; A big & quiet room
text:
We stayed four nights at this hotel, which was a very good choice for NYC. The location is great, just next to Times Square and the stores, and there's a subway stop very-very close. Just up front there is Dunkin DD, Taco Bell etc.
The hotel was very clean and the room much larger than we expected in the city. We had two quin beds, and there was enough space. The room was quiet, and we had a good night sleep thanks to that. Breakfast was also nice, good for kids.
The staff was friendly.
Two little downsides: 1) There were only a few shampoos/soaps in the bathroom, that clearly won't do for four people, and we had to keep asking for more. Same thing happened to us in a different Hampton Inn hotel, so maybe it is policy. 2) only one elevator worked during our stay at the hotel, so there was a long waiting time each time. That was inconvenient.

title: Excellent, safe, central hotel with amazing breakfast.
text: Great, clean central hotel. Free breakfast (make your own waffles/cereal,toast,bagels,scrambled eggs,ham) Free tea/coffee in lobby. Staff friendly and helpful. Room good size for New York. 2 min walk to Joe’s Pizza. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Super hotel in a fab location
text:
Spent 6 nights here with family, the staff are so fab, super helpful, special mention to young lad at breakfast (Alex?) always friendly whatever time of the morning ! Breakfast is ok, sets you up for the day, always busy, not enough seats so felt awkward hanging around waiting for a table. 
Fab location, close enough to everything but off the main “strip”. Carnegie pizza lovely, took it back to hotel and had a lazy tea as exhausted ! Would deffo recommend

title: Nice Hotel
text: I stayed here with my family.  Booked other hotels just in case but, the only one responding my requests and questions, was this one.  So, from the beginning, everything seemed all right.  I had what I wanted, a low floor due to claustrophobia on elevators, a great breakfast, a secured hotel, a great space for our family of four.  I truly had no regrets, I would easily recommend it.  The staff was so kind and helpful, nice store, gym and laundry.  Nearby there's Carnegie Pizza, you would love this one!!!  Lots of showbills, went to Harry Potter, wonderful!  Nearby stops for sightseeing buses and subway. Will go back here!  Thanks for everything...

title: Would recommend
text:
Clean & very comfortable bed.
Rooms are small - but not surprising - there’s no space for anything in NYC.
Front desk staff are helpful - but no concierge as mentioned in previous reviews.  Not sure why?
Three elevators for 31 floors - waited a bit, but not enough to be a negative.
Feels safe.  
We are on 26th floor - no noise or street odors.
Would recommend.

title: Beware the Night Noise and Jammed Elevators
text: Stayed here on a business trip for 3 nights. Check-in on Tuesday was easy, clean room although they are only cleaning by request during your stay. Room on the 11th floor had some noise in the evenings on Tues/Weds, but Thursday night at 2:45am was woken up with extremely loud club music. I called the front desk and the very apathetic guest services rep said, “oh that is Margaritaville (which I now know is a nearby hotel with a rooftop bar). There is nothing we can do. It should stop by 4am. You know it is technically the weekend. You can come get earplugs.” No apology. And no way earplugs would help with that volume of music. And it was impossible to change rooms because the hotel had no rooms available. The elevators were also extremely slow, packed with people so you often have to wait for 3-4?elevators to get on. On the last days we finally carried our bags down 11 flights of stairs after waiting more than 15 minutes with no available elevator and didn’t want to miss our flight. Would not stay here again and most definitely not for business travel.

title: Thank you Lorna Santos!
text: Our stay at the Hampton Inn was quite pleasant.  Breakfast was phenomenal!  Regarding customer service, Victoria from the front desk was a bit rude to my wife and daughter when it came to selling some chocolates.  As for the room, when I got to the room from the first day an allergy started that I wanted to die!  These allergies are activated by dust!  The next day my wife called to ask for a cleaning in the room but they did not have anyone available.  Then the next day my wife spoke with Lorna Santos from the cleaning team and she explained the situation to her supervisor and she cleaned the room.  I have to tell you that the Hotel needs more employees like her.  Since she cleaned the room I had no more problems with allergies!  Thank you Lorna!  You were definitely the one who made me spend some pleasant last days in the hotel!

title: Great Stay
text: Recently returned from a 6 night stay at this hotel.  Great location, near subway.  All staff very friendly and helpful.  We were allocated a room on the 21st floor which was very quiet with excellent soundproofing.  Room had everything you needed for a short stay and had  a nice bathroom.  Bed was very comfy.  We only had breakfast twice during our stay because we wanted to try other places but we were more than happy with the breakfast provided by the hotel.  Staff at breakfast were excellent. Tea and coffee available in foyer all day.  On our last day we asked reception  if they could arrange a taxi back to the airport for us, they actually provide this service themselves which we were unaware of and we would definately recommend this service to anyone staying here.  Would stay here again and would happily recommend to others.

title: Great hotel, great staff
text: The hotel was great. I can with my family of 4 with 2 kids for a 4 day vacation in the city. The bellman Joseph was great and kept our bags so we could go walk around the city while waiting for our rooms. The room was so clean when we got there. It was a little small but manageable and what we needed for our short stay. The breakfast was great every morning with lots of options for picky eaters. At the end of our stay Joseph offered to hold our bags while we walked around before our train left. It made the vacation even better.

title: Great Location. Great staff.
text:
We've (family) have stayed here on multiple occasions. Great location. Reasonable rates with no add-on $$ surprises when you check-in. This hotel is right in the theater district. Two blocks from Times Square, half block from subway, walking distance to everything.
The rooms are good sized for the location, and clean. Complimentary breakfast is a definite plus, and the breakfast room staff is fantastic. Note: Get to the breakfast room early, as it is a challenge after 9am - particularly on the weekend.
The front desk staff are very friendly, and accommodating. 
The Bellman (Joseph) is outstanding, and ready to help in any way. I have a special appreciation for Joseph and his habit of greeting and assisting the guests - and his knowledge of the area.

title: Great location near Times Square and major subway station
text: Bottom line is the location is great. We’d stay here again, despite starting and ending on bad notes. Was notified by the Hilton app that our room was ready before we arrived at 10 AM. Checkin is 3 pm so we didn’t expect to check in as early as 10 am, but the “ready” notification got our hopes up that we would have a place to crash after a 6 am flight. Joseph the bellman was helpful storing our luggage and we left for lunch with the understanding our room would be available shortly after others checked out at 11 am. After lunch we ended up sitting around the lobby until 2 pm, when our room was finally available. Again, I know early check in isn’t guaranteed, but I just wish they wouldn’t have given multiple signals that the room would be ready early  so we would have stayed out exploring the city. Last time in NYC we stayed at the Hampton Times Square South, a much less desirable location, and found ourselves walking by this Hampton over and over, prompting me to start saying “next time we’re staying there”. And so we did. The location is fantastic, especially if you’re using the subway to get around the city. $33 for unlimited rides for 7-days is a steal and a major subway station is literally across the street from this hotel, with connections to virtually any subway train in the city. There is no better location if you’re using the subway. Breakfast was very busy, food just ok, but the breakfast staff was incredible, very upbeat and helpful. Carnegie pizza next door has some of the best pizza in town. It’s sad that pot is being openly sold and smoked all over, unfortunately also in the hotel on our floor. Wi-Fi was ok when you finally could connect, but we had to renew our connection EVERY TIME WE USED IT, not once a day which is more typical (something is obviously wrong). Finally, the most frustrating experience of all — all week I heard the bellmen arranging car service to LaGuardia for a flat $65, “including taxes and tolls”. This price wasn’t out of line with Uber and Lyft surge pricing when we were leaving so we used the car service. The driver took us on an around the world route WHICH AVOIDED TOLLS, but took an hour to get to LGA. I was furious and asked why he was taking the long way (“are you in a hurry?”  — too late to ask this after we were stuck in traffic on the long route). I asked if he took that route to avoid tolls — no comment. From the airport, I called Joseph the bellman and complained, and he took the drivers name and promised to investigate.

title: Great Place! Great Location! Great Service!
text: This was a REALLY AWESOME location, just blocks from the excitement of Times Square but not close enough to be disturbed by the crowds.  Check-in was a breeze with the Front Desk giving a warm welcome, and a nice room location when we asked.  Breakfast consisted of a FULL BREAKFAST with Waffles, Bagels, Eggs, Potatoes, Sausages, the works...really nice considering the limited breakfast selections of most hotels since the pandemic. (Also BIG KUDOS to the breakfast staff who stood by attentively, with a smile, in case anything else was needed.)  Even the Police Officer out front had a friendly conversation for us, with directions to local places. And this location is a comfortable walk to Central Park (with good walking shoes).  The theatres were also nearby (See MJ the Musical on Broadway!).  Overall, a great place to stay!

title: Bellman
text: Joseph was as professional as could possibly be.. we were very impressed with his demeanor and professionalism and accountability. He was very friendly and we felt secure and safe with his arrangement for transportation to the airport.

title: Memorable Trip - Thank you
text: Great hotel, great location, friendly staff, basic rooms with simple functionality - what more do you want. Comfortable bed with air conditioning - free tea and coffee all week from the foyer. Wi-Fi is intermittent but there is a computer area by reception. Breakfast is basic but enough to keep you going for the morning. Tube station just up the street on the main west line and most amenities within perfect walking distance. Room is cleaned on a request basis, so you will need to ask for toilet rolls and fresh towels, pillows and linen. That said all provided without issue. There is a little shop in the hotel and a laundry room which was excellent $2 dollar wash and $2 dollar dry. Would highly recommend this place, our trip to NYC was comfortable and memorable - enjoy.

title: Great service
text: Great service, quiet, clean, excellent location, great places near by to eat.  Good central for vacation activities.  Highly recommend.  Since I have to write more the fewer the words the mire concise.  Great great great great.

title: Great location, nice stay for families
text:
This hotel has a great location for famlies. Good proximity to Broadway shows, food, shopping and the subway. Hotel entrance is on a quieter street a few steps away from the action. Rooms are fairly tight in space but probably on par with most hotels in the area in this price point. Rooms were clean, simple and we had all we needed for our stay. Housekeeping was available upon request and they were prompt and friendly in delivering extra towels, blankets and toiletries. We did not request room cleaning--  with adjoining rooms and 3 teens we just managed our own space. Check-in was easy and since we arrived early, the hotel was able to securely store our bags while we explored the area. Breakfast was provided and there were ample tasty choices. While a bit crowded at breakfast, there was plenty of food and it was well staffed. From the front desk, to the people staffing breakfast, to the housekeepers, all staff during our stay were friendly and helpful throughout the hotel.

A special thank you to Joseph who helped us secure a car to the airport for our family of 5. It was less expensive than 2 Ubers, which we would have needed. The morning of our departure there was a half marathon causing the street in front of the hotel to be closed to cars. He was in frequent communication with the transportation company and even walked us to the street corner to help us locate our ride. Joseph went above and beyond. I would stay here again and recommend this place for families, especially if you want to be near the action but have a quieter exit onto the streets of NY.

title: Amazing stay
text: Ideal location! Rooms were very clean and the staff was exceptional. We were treated with such kindness by the front desk staff- Fernando and Ilana. Fatima always treated us with a smile at breakfast!

title: Great base...
text:
First time in NYC and what a great base this hotel was. Wonderful friendliness and hospitality from the moment we arrived from all the staff , reception - breakfast hosts and a really helpful bell man Joseph. Great location for navigating your way around the big apple. Room was more than adequate for our needs. Hope to stay again soon..
Thanks.

title: Great location and extremely friendly and attentive staff
text: We couldn't have found a hotel with friendlier staff and the perfect location for such a reasonable price. From the moment we walked in, the receptionist Chantelle was there to help with all our needs and she continued to go above and beyond for our whole stay. I can't thank her enough! The location is absolutely perfect, about a 30 second walk to Times Square, with Central Park also extremely close. 99% of attractions are within close proximity which was perfect. Breakfast was an added bonus which we made use of for some of the mornings, staff again extremely friendly and food always topped up & fresh. Upon departure, Joseph was a star. He arranged a cab for our return to the airport, and stored our luggage for the duration of the day so we could take full advantage of our last day. The staff at this hotel couldn't do anymore for you, and the location is perfect. Would recommend to anyone visiting Manhattan and we can't wait to come back!

title: Excelente localização, ótima opção!
text:
Já estive em NYC outras vezes, mas foi a primeira que fiquei neste hotel.
Pretendo voltar! Não tem porque procurar outro hotel.
Localização impecável! Há poucos metros do port authority bus terminal, da Times Square e com diversos restaurantes em um raio de 100 metros.
Equipe solícita e muito educada. Destaque para o bellmen Joseph, que estava sempre de prontidão para ajudar no que fosse preciso.
Merece a ótima nota que tem aqui no site!

title: Comfortable, clean and surprisingly quiet
text: Visited NYC and stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with 2 under 5 kids and 3 teenagers.  We booked 2 rooms side by side.  Although the rooms are small, they are comfortable and surprisingly quiet considering the location. Breakfast team had an amazing energy and very welcoming.  Special mention to Fatima and Alex for their excellent breakfast service. Joseph at the concierge was also great. Definitely will stay here again next time we are in New York.

title: Great Hotel, excellent service and hospitality
text: Clean rooms, great city view, spacious lobby with plenty of seating, nearby parking available, and it’s in the heart of Times Square close to everything.  Joseph, the bellman, was especially kind and helpful.  He was a wealth of information, extremely polite and patient, helped us store luggage before check in and after check out while we explored the city.

title: Awesome
text:
We had an incredible stay here, bed was super comfy, staff were very friendly and accommodating to help us. Special Thank you to Joseph who helped us with our bags, he was very professional and as a woman I felt his amazing masculine presence, which is a rare quality that comes with respect, love , care, willingness to protect and provide🦋♥️🙏🏼🙏🏼🙏🏼
They had strict rules/procedures in place on who enters the building, which made me feel even more safe🦋

title: Great Convenient Place to Stay in the Theater District
text: We took the Acela from Washington, DC for dinner at Gallaghers and to see the Lion King. The Hampton Inn at Times Square was convenient, friendly and well appointed. The room rate was great considering where it is located. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Disappointed
text:
Coming to New York is a holiday of a lifetime for us 4 friends, booked 10 months in advance! Staying at the Hampton inn we are very central.

We arrived after a long flight and a long wait through customs. We checked in to he told that we needed to leave a deposit of $50 per night per room, for us a total of $250 in advance, refundable when we check out! We didn’t want to use our spending money for this as what was the point of having this back on the day you leave! Fortunately 1 of us had a credit card and 1 of us had a debit card otherwise we would have been stuffed! Be warned as we were not told this prior to coming!

I had also emailed the hotel in advance to tell them that 3 of our ladies were celebrating birthdays and could we possibly have some great views. Firstly they wanted to put us on separate floors, we asked them if we could be on same floor, on the 3rd floor with the mist grottiest and depressing view out of our window. This is a hotel with 31 floors and this was the best they could give us!
Be warned as well, as we were not, that when you using the lift you have to scan your door key first before you press what floor you want otherwise you just go up and down! 

The room is clean, but very small and pokey, it has tv, tea facilities which we haven’t tried yet. Also a hairdryer and A few toiletries. There are no housekeeping facilities but you can ask at reception for clean towels etc, although I haven’t tried this.

Breakfast is served between 7-10 but again haven’t tried this.

Just so disappointed with view and the large amount of money we have had to leave as a deposit!

title: Gran Atención
text:
Estuvimos en familia durante cinco días y todo el personal del hotel es muy amable y pendiente de cualquier requerimiento o solicitud hecha. Por ejemplo, Joseph nos consiguió un transporte muy bueno para seis adultos, de forma muy ágil.

Ubicación del hotel Excelente.

title: I've never rated a hotel poor because of their elevators
text: I'm a Hilton Diamond member so spend 60+ nights a year in all types of Hilton properties all over the world. This hotel is in line with the Hampton Inn brand.
