No frills property for people on a budget.  It is a very tall building though.  I made the mistake of asking for a high floor, thinking I would get a better view.  The elevators in this building are not designed for the number of guests.  It would sometimes take 10 minutes just to get to the lobby or back to my room.  Everyone complained about how hard it was to get on an elevator.  And when you did, it would stop at every floor but there was never room for others to get on.  I would never stay here again just because of the elevators.  They could fix this by designating certain elevators for certain floors.  For example, the 1st elevator only goes to floors 2-20, the 2nd elevator only goes to floors 21-40, etc.

title: Our stay at the Hampton inn
text:
We stayed at the Hampton Inn for 7 nights in February. We arrived at the hotel around 18:00 and went inside where we were greeted by a lady on reception. She kind of just looked at us and assumed we knew what she needed off us. She eventually explained what she needed to see etc and we were given a room on the 23rd floor.

 We noticed as soon as we got in the lift that it stunk of pot. We got out of the lift and went to our room which wasn’t clean and also stunk of pot like someone had just vacated. The bed had hairs on it and there was white stuff all over the floor. We went down to reception and spoke with a gentleman on reception and he showed us two room and gave us the choice, we just took the first room as it was suitable and adequately cleaned. Due to covid the hotel aren’t servicing the rooms during your stay unless you go and ask at reception which was fine for us. If you need additional toilet paper or fresh towels you just ask at reception. Personally we prefer this. 

Breakfast wasn’t the best and we didn’t go down many mornings for it but the staff greeted you every time with a smile and would explain what was on offer etc. most days we just grabbed a slice of pizza on our way out a few doors down. 

The hotel is in close proximity to the subway and also walking distance to a lot of things. We spent three evenings at the theatre (about a 15minute walk) watching the Book of Mormon (try to go see it when Stephen Ashfield is performing) and one watching Harry Potter and the cursed child (I wouldn’t recommend Harry Potter, it’s mind numbing, the story is horrendous and the acting wasn’t the best). We took the subway to the 911 memorial/museum. On a Monday you can get free admission from 3pm if you book tickets online. We found that 2 hours wasn’t enough time to get around and see everything in the museum.

The hotel is quite quiet but we did find that even on the non smoking floors people were smoking pot which is unpleasant. Times Square also stinks of pot and obviously the legalisation of it hasn’t helped along with people constantly pestering you to buy edibles as you walk and if it’s not edibles it’s CDs… If you don’t wish to purchase the CD or shake hands with the seller due to Covid you’re racist… I saw many people who would say no to the CD but then would be called racist and quickly change and buy the CD. I don’t have a means to play a CD in 2022 so if they really wanted their music to be heard a link to a streaming service that can be shared would be more beneficial. 

Having stayed in New York previous we probably wouldn’t stay in Times Square again as we just found it extremely unpleasant this time. We had previously stayed at the Wellington hotel but we decided on the Hampton due to the central location the fact that breakfast was included and because they had no resort tax. We had a bumpyish start at the hotel, it was sorted quickly and didn’t have any issues afterwards but we just don’t like the location for walking around in the evening it’s unpleasant. Also you have to use your key card to access the hotel in the evening which is something we’ve never experienced before.

We also did late checkout as our flight was late evening and this was extremely reasonable in price and easy to arrange at reception.

title: Broadway Getaway
text: We had a lovely weekend at this Hampton Inn. Ilana, who checked us in, was professional and courteous. The breakfast crew went out of their way to accommodate special dietary needs. Joseph, the bellman, was a shining star— customer focused, courteous, caring, professional, accommodating. We could not have asked for better service. So nice to be back in NUC!

title: Decent, not the best nor worst
text: Stayed in central Manhattan, great location but had a lot of minor problems that could've made the stay much better. There's not much help for parking, and that is a massive burden on travelers who are staying for more than the weekend. The late night staff are also quite rude and not courteous to the staff, suggest you try to checkin before 9pm to have a smooth experience. The rooms are OK and sufficient for a city stay. We paid roughly $150 per night weekday and $200 for weekend. At those prices, I would suggest staying at another hotel. Definitely would avoid staying at this Hampton inn for anything more than $100 per night.

title: Excellent Stay
text: Our stay was wonderful from beginning to end!  Everyone we encountered there surpassed our expectations. So polite. So helpful.  I personally felt pampered just from my "standard" visit.   Joseph was so helpful with getting us to and from the hotel and airport.  Will always choose to stay here when we visit NYC!!  We scheduled an impromptu trip and this hotel made everything work for us!  It is centrally located to MANY attractions and 1/2 block walk to the subway.   The breakfast was delicious and plentiful every morning.  Early check-in available. Baggage hold available. Black car service available.  LOVE. THIS. PLACE.

title: Great location, clean, free breakfast.
text: The location was fantastic but still quiet. Had an amazing view! Free really good breakfast! Security and cleanliness were on point. I'd come back again and again. The front desk was always available with several employees and it has 3 elevators so one is always open.

title: Great location, fabulous staff
text: Stayed here with my daughter for 3 nights in February 2022. Clean accommodations, decent breakfast included, and absolutely wonderful staff - especially Lise at the front desk and Joseph the bellman were exceptional. Thank you for making our stay warm, hospitable, and extra nice.

title: Great location for Broadway shows and other Mid-Town Activities
text: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in mid-February 2022.  The hotel is ideally located mid-block on 41st between 7th and 8th Avenue just off of Times Square.  If you are coming to town on the train, it is an easy walk from Penn Station, even with suitcases and crowds.  It's also easy walking from the hotel to many Broadway theaters and great restaurants which gave us the chance to experience midtown's hub-bub without being overwhelmed by it.  Download the Hilton app so you can use the digital key from your phone to access the front door, elevator keypad, and your room door.  Everything worked consistently and we had very limited interaction with any staff - which we expected given pandemic protocols.  We opted for breakfast in local restaurants but the hotel does provide the standard Hampton Inn fare in a room behind the elevator bank.  Room rate was great - February is an economical time to visit NYC!  It was snowing the morning we left and we enjoyed a magical walk through Central Park with plenty of time to get back to the room and cleaned up before checking out at 12:00 pm.

title: Great location, quality and amenities
text:
When you think of Times Square hotels, you immediately think it’ll be a well rode pony that’s going to be looking shabby, worn and just a place to lay your head for the night. This hotel was not one of them! 

The hotel was clean, welcoming, well kept and great location. 

We had a standard king room, it was a great size, nice bathroom with shower and the usual beverage amenities. 

The hotel has a little gem which is their rooftop balcony, great to get a view from night or day however note it’s only open 8am to 8pm. 

The included breakfast was also good, it consisted of continental and some hot breakfast items with drinks etc. 

The lobby has a business centre, seating , free coffee & hot water as well as a in house shop you can buy items from. 

Luggage storage for the day of your flight if required was also available. 

I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Relaxing couples trip
text: The location was easy to get to by public transportation, good food and entertainment in the area. The hotel staff was very helpful and the room was cozy and clean. Check in and out was smooth. Will be returning soon.

title: Nice hotel in NYC.
text: A very good nice hotel in the heart of NYC. Very good for the money and stay . Customer service is superb. Courteous and attentive. Room ready upon check in. Clean Room. Been my second stay and is always awesome.

title: Excellent location/staff
text: I would highly recommend staying here if visiting NYC to attend Broadway productions. Accommodations and location are great! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The bellman, Joseph, was especially helpful with recommendations for restaurants, securing transportation, and anything at all that we asked him about. He is truly outstanding!

title: Location, Location, Location!
text: Best Bang For Your Buck. What More Can You Ask For? A Clean, Safe, Friendly Hotel That's Within Walking Distance Of Just About Everything In Time's Square. I Would Recommend This Hotel To Everyone Hands Down!

title: Excelente atención
text: Viajamos del 26 diciembre 2020 al 2 de enero 2021, hotel a pocos metros del Times Square, excelente servicio por parte todo el personal, sobre todo de las chicas de recepción (Camille y Leslie), la habitación es amplia (3006), pero el mobiliario hace que se vea pequeña, la vista es agradable pero muy limitada, hicieron el aseo con frecuencia para el tiempo que estuvimos, el desayuno es abundante, perooooo la proteína es la misma, un día es salchicha, otro hamburguesa y otro Hot Dog, no pasa de ahí, ahhhh y el típico revoltillo o tortilla. Repetiría nuevamente este hotel sin dudarlo.

title: Very Helpful and Pleasant Staff
text: I stayed at this Hampton Inn in January of 2022. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. I was grateful for their assistance. Their advice on where to order food turned out to be excellent and their assistance with scheduling transportation to the airport was invaluable.

title: Amazing property
text: Welcoming front desk staff, awesome service, few mins from Time Square, nice city view room, was there with my family and they all enjoyed it, highly recommend this property, overall great experience.

title: Close to Broadway & Time square!
text: Easy to get to our shows, Time Square, Junior’s, and shopping! Safe & friendly! We came early and we’re able to drop our bags off and go back out to sight see. Fun roof top balcony for my 16 yr old to take pics!

title: Great Staff and excellent location
text:
We stayed here five nights last week and really enjoyed the stay. The rooms are nice sized for Manhattan, and comfortable. The staff was universally helpful, and I especially want to command everyone who was working in the breakfast area. The breakfast folks kept everything well stocked, but also had a friendly greeting for me every morning when I went down to eat.

The bellman Joseph was also particularly helpful. We left our bags at the hotel our final day to do some last minute touring and when we returned, Joseph was helping a group of about 30 people get loaded onto the bus, but promptly gathered our bags the moment they were out of the door.

The location is excellent--if you exit the hotel and turn left in 3 minutes you are at the A-C-E line. If you turn right out of the hotel you are at the red, yellow, and 7 in about 3 minutes also. This was great as it was really cold last weekend and it was nice to be quickly out of the wind.

title: Hampton Inn ! Wonderful Experience
text: Fantastic place! Very clean ! Staff were welcoming! Restaurant staff just so friendly and food fantastic! I would definitely recommend it! It is central too so there are so many things to see and do! Washing facilities also available!

title: Excellent stay here!
text:
My 2 sisters and I stayed 7 nights here and had a great experience.
The staff were amazing, especially the breakfast staff who made our start to the day a great one!
Nothing was too much trouble and the actual breakfast was great.
The rooms were good and beds and pillows were very comfy.
The hotel is ideally situated for all the central sites. 
We will definitely be coming back to the Hampton on our next visit.
Thank you all 🤗

title: 2 night stay
text: Excellent location. Friendly staff. Fun and colorful lobby. Room was way bigger than expected (2601) for NYC, updated and clean. We had no problems with the elevators as long as you know you may wait a few minutes especially during busy times. Breakfast wasn’t great and very crowded regardless of time.

title: Value for Money Budget accommodation in Mid Town Manhattan
text: Decent Well located hotel at the heart of Times Square. Better than average courtesy breakfast and confortable rooms. No daily housekeeping cleaning and change of towels unless requested. We requested cleaning after three days and they only gave us new towels and forgot the housekeeping. Staff friendly but a bit unprofessional. Good value for money after all. Uneventful for the good and the bad

title: Well located, clean, small room, good price
text:
We were tree: me, my wife and our daughter 13 years old.
Easy check in and check out. It is well located, close to theaters, restaurants, subway. 
Rooms are small, but it is ok, because we don't stay inside the room much.
Complain: no automatic housecleaning anymore. You have to ask. We asked, but they forgot to do it.
Breakfast: good american breakfast with eggs, sausage, waffles, cereal, milk, coffee, bread, yogurt, fruits (orange and apple only), orange/apple/cranberry juice.
BE CAREFUL: if you get a transportation with the hotel people, make sure to CONFIRM the price with the driver. Hotel people told me US$90 from hotel to Newark airport with tax included, cash or credit card. As Uber was US$89, I decided to get the hotel one. At the time to pay the driver was charging me US$95. When I told him it was US$ 90 with credit card, he tried to charged me US$ 99 because of the "taxes". I paid US$ 90 cash !!!!

title: Comfortable rooms
text: Rooms were comfortable, nothing fancy, they were a little outdated. Location and breakfast were awesome. You could walk everywhere, subway right outside of hotel. Plenty of restaurants/bars around hotel. Hot complimentary breakfast was awesome!

title: Perfect for a quick trip
text: We were in NYC for a quick 24 hours and wanted a clean, quiet place that was centrally located for a Broadway play and this fit the bill perfectly.  Could walk to all locations (play, Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center, restaurants, time square, 5th avenue shopping, etc) Metro close for connections back to airport,  Breakfast was adequate too and made the price better than other locations and chains.

title: A hidden gem
text: Our third time staying here and we always love it. Very clean rooms, perfect location and the best staff. The free breakfast includes eggs, potatoes, turkey or sausage, cold and hot cereals, yogurt, fruits, coffee and more. Fatima and Engels were so kind and helpful there! They love their job and they always greet us with a big smile. This is very important to me when choosing a hotel. The lady in the check -in was great too.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: We stayed at this Gem of an Hotel for 5 nights December 24--29th. We can not fault anything about it. Every member off staff where friendly and helpfull. Very clean & good housekeeping when asked for. Good location. Breakfast is a bit of a let down as no bacon or beans or tomatoes during our stay but we still managed to fuel up on other things.  When we return to NYC  this will be our 1st choice to stay at again. Well done to all of the staff and thankyou for a great stay. Mr Knowles room 1603

title: Hotel location and bellman are the best features
text:
Location to theatre district, Bryant Park, and subways is great.  The hotel bellman, Joseph, was fantastic.  He has exceptional customer service skills!  Out interactions with him were the best out of all hotel staff.  We tipped him well because of it. 
 
Hotel rooms were satisfactory but towels were limited to one per guest.  You had to ask for extra.  My reservation  for two rooms became mixed up with another guest in our party who had her own room.  The guest services rep who was helping me (Shayrelle?) was not helpful and would not listen to me about the mix-up being their fault.  Even when her coworker tried to explain it to her, Shayrelle just walked off.  When she returned, she asked me to step aside so she could help the next guest.  I did not budge and asked for a manger. They had to reenter my reservation but by that point, they rooms were not on the same floor as requested.  Shayrelle needs more training.

title: Location is ok but you sacrifice service and cleanliness
text:
I would not recommend this hotel. Especially with all the options available in the same area. The hotel is not very clean and most of the staff is not helpful or friendly. With the exception of maybe three employees the rest of the employees need better training. 

This hotel is not doing enough to ensure a safe, clean, and disinfected environment.  The hallways are dirty and there is trash and dirty towels in the halls due to no room cleaning during your stay. Our room had trash left in it and the room was not cleaned properly.

The hotel has a few great employees, Chantal and Jenny at the reception desk who were the only ones that were able to provide any assistance. 

Engles and Fatima at the breakfast bar are your star employees. They are very helpful and extremely nice. They both make you enjoy your stay.

title: A great place to stay in a fantastic location
text: Location of hotel was perfect. Very near to Times Square and Subway station, and within easy walking distance to many famous landmarks. Our room was comfortable with a city view which was great. Everyone was so friendly and helpful, special thanks to the Reception staff and Bellman Joseph. Breakfast was plentiful and the breakfast team were always so cheerful which gives you a great start to the day. Would definitely recommend and we would certainly stay here again.

title: Perfect for us!!
text: My daughter and I came to New York City to enjoy the lights and experiences in December. The location was perfect in easy safe walk to Broadway. The subway was just down the street on the corner. Great pizza place a few doors down!!  The hotel itself was welcoming, great service at front desk and at breakfast, and the room was clean, comfortable and was perfect size for the two of us.

title: Convenient location with great staff
text:
The Hampton Inn on 42nd/ Times Square Central was a great place to stay. The location is conveniently located to Times Square and the subway. Each morning breakfast is served from 7-10. The standout staff member is Fatima. She is so wonderfully pleasant and friendly. She interacts personably with the guests and handles early morning breakfast chaos with grace. 

The facilities are clean and the room is spacious enough for NY. 

Would recommend

title: NYC Vacay
text: We had the absolute best service and our bellhop was awesome! My granddaughter left her EarPods in the shuttle on the way to the airport.  I called and spoke with Joseph, left our contact info thinking they were gone forever.  Joseph called me 2 days later and they had found them and are shipping them to us!!! Clean rooms and awesome breakfast! We will definitely stay again

title: Excellent hotel and great location
text:
This was my 8th trip to New York and this is the best hotel I’ve stayed in.

Location is excellent, sandwiched in between Times Square and Port authority and several subway lines at the end of the block. Excellent central location with many things walkable (Macy’s, MSG, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central)

Free breakfast was really good and much more than we expected. Lots of choice and the staff were exceptional, especially Fatima who went above and beyond and made our stay very memorable. She is a credit to the hotel.

All staff in general were great, very accommodating. When we checked in they gave our girls a gift pack with some small toys, bracelets which they loved and was a nice touch.

We had a great trip and the excellent hotel played a big part in that!

title: Excellent midtown hotel
text: The location was ideal, just off Times Square and the theater district. Rooms were clean and quiet. Complimentary breakfast was adequate. Service personnel was friendly. The dining area when crowded was a little cramped. The attendent was a real trooper.

title: Adequate
text: Small rooms are adequate for 2 people. There is not enough room for 3 suitcases to fit in the room. The double beds seem smaller than a double- may be acceptable for a small child and adult but would be really small for two adult sized people. Bathroom is also small. I would guess it was updated 5-7 years ago. Elevators were slow at times. Unable to check in early despite request and diamond status. Staff was nice. Breakfast was decent/typical for a hotel of this level. Location was very good.

title: Super location, safe and clean
text: Super clean and housekeeping and staff are friendly (breakfast staff was amazing). Extremely convenient locations next to subway and walking distance to shows and Times Square and many other locations. Security downstairs is a great safe feature. Just a really super hotel, will definitely stay here again.

title: Room With a View/Great Location
text: Hotel is perfectly placed to walk to favorite spots like Times Square, Bryant Park, Radio City Music Hall, and Rockefeller Center. Super close to lots of shopping too. Room was tiny but served it’s purpose, which was to sleep and shower, and super clean. Loved the city view from the 27th floor, as well.

title: Zentrales Hotel mit Mängel im Detail
text:
Zentral in NYC gelegenes Hotel mit kleinem ausreichendem Frühstücksangebot. Das Hotel scheint schon in die Jahre gekommen zu sein was sich in Ausstattung und Ambiente weiterspielt.
Grösstes Manko ist die Versorgung der 31 Stockwerke nur 3 Aufzüge. Dabei ergeben sich regelmäßig lange Wartezeiten und überfüllte Aufzugkabinen. Coronaregelungen werden dabei nicht beachtet.

title: Fuyez
text:
Troisième et dernière fois dans cet hôtel . Je suis revenue dans cet hôtel car les fois précédentes tout s’était très bien passé . Quelle désillusion lors de notre séjour du 16 décembre . 
Accueil à la réception par Vanessa très froid et avec aucune explications . 
Les mesures de distanciation et le port du masque dans cet hôtel n’existent pas. Le personnel de la réception portent leur masque sous le nez . Certains clients n’en portent pas dans les parties communes de l’hôtel 
Exemple : hall d’accueil , ascenseurs et buffet du petit déjeuner .
Concernant les ascenseurs deux sur trois fonctionnaient et il fallait attendre plusieurs minutes pour pouvoir accéder à notre chambre . Quand l’ascenseur arrivait il y avait un nombre incroyable de personnes qui en sortait la plupart sans masques et nous étions parfois obligées d’attendre le suivant pour entrer avec des gens masqués 
Concernant les chambres , nous étions à la chambre 803 . De cette chambre nous pouvions entendre la musique de la rue . Le ménage n’a pas été fait et nous devions mettre nos poubelles dans une grande poubelle dans le couloir . La deuxième nuit nos lits n’ont pas été faits . Nous sommes descendues à la réception afin de comprendre pourquoi le ménage de la chambre n’était pas fait alors que nous sommes en période de pandémie . Ils n’ont pas le personnel . Alors c’est à nous de faire nos lits et si nous avons besoin de serviettes de toilettes il faut en demander à la réception. C’est inadmissible pour un hôtel . Évidemment aucun mail ne nous a été envoyé concernant ces mesures .
Ce mail aurait été le bienvenu 
Personnel de la réception très hautain  et se fichait bien de notre ressenti 
Concernant le petit déjeuner il est sous forme de buffet. Certains clients se servent au buffet mais ne portent pas de masques . Nous avons aussi vu des clients nettoyer eux même leur table afin de pouvoir prendre leur petit déjeuner !!! Et nous payons pour des services qui n’existent pas 
Nous avons vu beaucoup de clients remonter dans leur chambre avec leur petit déjeuner car les conditions sanitaires n’étaient pas respectées 
Nous avions des amis dans un autre hôtel et ils n’ont pas eu ce genre de problème 
Enfin il reste à noter un point important : depuis la légalisation du canabis à New York vous trouvez beaucoup des dizaines de vendeurs à 200 mètres de l’hôtel ce qui n’est as très rassurant non plus 
Voilà notre expérience dans cet hôtel 
Nous avons demandé le remboursement de notre séjour qui nous a été refusé 
Je m’attends à un commentaire négatif suite à ma publication mais je relate la vérité 
En tant que clients nous nous attendons à beaucoup plus de mesures pour notre sécurité

title: Excellently managed hotel in the center of the theaterdistric
text: Great staff, friendly and competent, responsive to our needs. The rooms while small were very clean and well maintained. All the staff  were extremely supportive in providing a comfortable stay in New York City.

title: Good location, get a room on the lower floors
text: This would be a great hotel if all of their elevators worked, but during our 3 night stay, there was always one out of order. So get a room on the lower floors and plan to use the stairs. Rooms are clean and quiet and well appointed.

title: Hotel strategically located
text: Very nice hotel with great breakfast buffet. Location was central to everything. Particularly nice that they could hold my luggage after my 11AM check out because of my late departure elite afternoon.

title: Positive experience!
text:
Thanks to all hotel personnel, very nice and friendly, they have made us feel at ease! Great location, subway down the hotel street, shops, very close to Times Square. Very good and various American/continental breakfast, you can eat till to explode :) 
Clean and quiet. Been with my family and another family our friends. All happy would stay at Hampton Inn again! Thanks

title: Really Nice Hotel
text:
This is really a nice hotel in a perfect location.  We were here for December 5th through the 9th.  While the rooms are small, they are nice and very adequate for our busy schedule. The breakfast was better than expected and made even better by Fatima and her wonderful attitude.  One of the strong suites of the hotel was Joseph the bellman.  He was a pleasure to be around and did whatever he needed to do to be accommodating.  Can't say enough about those two...just makes a stay much more pleasant!
Would have given the hotel a 5 star rating if not for the elevators. It was nearly impossible to get up and down from the 12th floor during the breakfast hours and check out time.   Hampton Inn really does need to fix this problem.

title: Soggiorno a NYC al 27' piano
text:
Ottimo hotel in una posizione veramente speciale, solo a 2 minuti da Times Square e dalla fermata della metro sulla 42.
Colazione con ottima varietà e con la possibilità di farsi al momento i waffles.
Camere non grandissime ma molto funzionali e pulite.
Staff gentilissimo e sempre pronto ad aiutare. Un grazie particolare oltre alle ragazze/i della reception anche al personale dela sala colazioni... sempre gentilissimi e col sorriso sulle labbra.
Ci torneremo sicuramente.

title: Bucket List Trip
text: Our stay started with meeting Joseph (the bellman), He checked our luggage safely hours before our check in time so we were able to start touring the city early.  We then were checked in by a friendly team of people behind the desk.  Our rooms were clean and comfortable.  We asked to have 2 extra pillows delivered to the room and they were there by the time we returned. Camille Gonzalez was always friendly, helpful and knew our name and room number each time without asking. We were greeted each time we left or arrived back.  Joseph was also very helpful in planning and arranging our Big Bus trip.  Finally, we want to mention the lady that set up and assisted each morning with breakfast.  She was very friendly and funny.  What a great way to start each day.  We are sorry that we didn't re-call her name, but she should be recognized for her customer service.  Thank you again.

title: Super convenient hotel to time square!
text: The staff could use a little more positivity and friendliness but, it was a lovely hotel - super clean and beautiful! The views from the 30th floor was everything! For first timers in NYC I’ll def stay here again!! Food locations are everywhere! Please try carnige pizza 🍕 next door! Amazing pizza I still dream about!

title: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
text:
Last week was my second time staying at this Hampton Inn location in NYC and it absolutely won't be my last! The staff is so friendly and kind here! Joseph and Fatima are teo familiar faces I was so happy to see again after my first stay at the end of October, unfortunately I didn't get the names of the rest of the wonderful staff that I came across during this stay, but they were so fantastic!
•This location is pretty much walking distance to everything!
•Their free breakfast is absolutely amazing! Especially the omelets.
• I always love to visit the rooftop as well! Another reason I decided to stay at this location.

Overall, I can't recommend this Hampton Inn location enough. The staff always makes my stay so pleasant!

title: Disappointing
text:
I am a diamond HHMember. On my profile, it says that I hav severe allergies and need non feather pillows. Regardless, I always make a note on the reservation informing staff of my allergies. I had 3 rooms, but only 1 king bed suite that was noted as needing the non feathers pillows.
Having checked in digitally, I called the hotel and informed them to add names to the other 2 rooms so that they can refresh when they arrived. The customer service agent I spoke with said everything is noted and there should not be a problem.
Upon arriving at the hotel, my family was told that they had to wait in the lobby for me in order to check in.
I explained that their names should be noted by an agent. The desk attendant said that there were no notes. I asked about the pillows, and was told that the note was there.
We went to dinner, and when we got back, there were still feather pillows in the room . When I called down, I was informed that the housekeeping department had gone. 
The next morning, I called down and was gone for the day, but upon return there were no extra pillows to access.
That morning, I asked for the pillows to be swapped while we were out. 
Housekeeping made the bed, leaving the feather pillows. When I got back to the room and realized, I was told that the pillows were changed. 
When I told them they had not, the agent sighed loudly. The guest attendants at the front desk then rolled eyes and looked to one another. At no point did I feel acknowledged, never a smile from any attendant at the desk.
The one saving grace was your breakfast attendant Fatima. She alone presented a positive, energetic and friendly demeanor. If not for her, the entire stay would have been ruined.
I did finally get hypoallergenic pillows on my last night after 9 PM. Being a Diamond Member obviously means nothing 
Also, I have 15 pending charges from the hotel in varied amounts, $1, $10/ $40, and $50 charged at least 3 times each. The only charge should be $4 for eye drops

title: Pleasant stay
text:
The staff was fabulous, the rooms were clean and beds are  very comfortable. Joseph helped us with our luggage on two different occasions. He also set up our transportation to the airport.  He was very helpful and pleasant. 
I can’t wait to book there again.

title: Great location
text: Great location. Get a room high up for great city views! Walked to all the theater district shows and got discount tickets at TKS in Times Square. Joseph was especially helpful in getting bags, giving directions, and rides to airport. And the lady that ran the breakfast area was incredibly helpful & personable.

title: Not up to Hilton Standards
text: The room was tight; not a typical Hilton room. The service was frustrating. We were unable to obtain extra pillows and blankets and a fridge cost another $30 per night however, we could not not obtain that our first night. We stayed one night and checked out 3 nights early to check into better accommodations for the same price!

title: Terrific staff, good location and price.
text: The staff are terrific. Especially Fatima at breakfast who is exceptionally friendly, helpful and patient, Joseph is also friendly and helpful with the bags and transport. The cleaning staff was really helpful too. Great location for Broadway, Penn Station, Grand Central  and pizza next door.

title: Location OK but all the rest......
text:
As a diamond Hilton member, this is by far the worst Hilton Group hotel I ever stayed in. 
The positive point is the location and the kindness of the front personnel and the congierce. (a very big appreciation from my side for their kindness) 

Our (bath)room was full of dust (in stead of brown, the furniture was gray). 
The breakfast (included in the stay) is a real joke. 
Cardboard plates, plastic drinking cups, plastic cutlery etc...(very sustainable). A school refectory has more charm than then this crowded  breakfast room. Eggs of bad quality, black burned sausages, bread not edible, coffee of an inferior quality. (and that was about the choice. Oh, I forget three oranges and some apples, wrapped in plastic and some bad yogurt. Cereals no choice. 
Furthermore the rooms were not cleaned or beds made up. (not to disturb as a sticker on the bathroom mirror stated). I wonder how the rooms are cleaned after people check out. That we could see on the bathroom furniture. 
So, do not include this "breakfast" in the price. Calculate an extra cost for breakfast and give your guests a decent breakfast. (there are enough places in the neighbourhood were you can have breakfast if people do not want to pay extra) 
I do not expect that the room is toroughly cleaned for a 4 days stay, but at least make up the beds and give the bathroom a quick clean. 
Furthermore the rooms are somewhat outdated.

title: location location location
text: this hotel offers the best location to visit Times Square, broadway and Bryant Park, there is a theater just up the street; complimentary breakfast offers variety and a hot meal; this location helps to find car service and taxis

title: Ok
text: Not terrible not glamorous.  Elevator not sufficient. Bathroom shower did not drain wallpaper pealing. We had to walk down 26 flights.  Noisy in the am.  Quiet and dark while sleeping.  Small room as to be expected.

title: You get what you pay for…
text: A location 100 yards from Times Square.  If you want location and will sacrifice quality, this is the hotel for you.  The rooms are small and old but appeared to be clean.  The breakfast is perfect for kids.  The hotel was not bad; just what you would expect for inexpensive.  If you want a bed and TV then this hotel is perfect.  Great for families who are on a budget.  You can walk to everything.  It is a safe location as well.

title: Great Customer Service!
text: This hotel is in a great location - close to Times Square and the theaters.  The staff at this hotel were so welcoming and helpful.  Joseph the bellman was friendly and efficient.  He checked bags for us so we could explore the city and had a car waiting for us to go to the airport.  It was busy and he handled everything with grace and style.  They offer a hot breakfast and the person who runs that kept things moving and was great about helping me with my dietary needs.  Also, even though our room was near the elevators, it was surprisingly quiet for a city hotel.  Great experience!

title: Great Customer Service
text: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  The rooms are small, but nice.  The staff was amazing.  The bellman Joseph was so kind and helpful.  He was truly a highlight in our weekend.  He was always calm, polite, and willing to help us with whatever we needed.  We left our bags with him before and after check-in.  He also offered to order us a car to take us to the airport. The car was ready early and waited for us until we were ready.  Our bags were placed in the car for us ahead of time.  I cannot say enough about Joseph.  He was fantastic!   We also really enjoyed the breakfast.  The lady who ran the kitchen was organized and helpful.  The food options were excellent.

title: Localização privilegiada
text: A localização é excelente (a passos da Times Square e da estação de metrô). O atendimento é muito bom, em especial do Joseph (bell boy) e do Fernando (recepção). Receberam compras da Amazon e imprimiram documentos gratuitamente. Café da manhã bom com ovos mexidos, hambúrguer ou linguiça e batata, waffle, etc. Não tem mais o chocolate quente que ficava de cortesia na recepção.

title: Great location with a good value on weekdays.
text: This property is a great value during the week, but note that the prices rise during the weekend. The room could have been a little cleaner but overall was fine. Breakfast was excellent with friendly staff. Location is excellent within walking distance to many theaters and subway. I would stay here again.

title: Great Hotel Visit
text: This hotel has a great location-close to everything in Times Square. Close to the subway, etc. The rooms were small but very clean. But more importantly-the hotel was very accommodating-Joseph the Bellman was so wonderful-he held our bags before check-in and after check-out since our flight didn't leave until several hours after check-out (so we did not have to drag our luggage all over NYC until it was time to leave). Joseph even arranged to have a car drive us to the airport later in the day!! And the morning breakfast was very good-actually had real warm food-eggs, potatoes, meat, etc. ! Fatima who worked in the breakfast area was the nicest sweetest person! Made everyone feel welcome and took good care of everyone. I will definitely come back to this hotel for my next trip to NYC!

title: Execlente servicio
text: Estuve esta semana de noviembre 15 hasta noviembre 19 y todo estuvo muy bien.Quiero agradecer a el bellman joseph por su excelente servicio tanto con el equipaje como las alternativas que me ofrecio y me oriento para la transportacion. A hose el chofer que nos llevo hasta newark nos dio un servicio excelente.

title: Great location!
text: Walk to Broadway shows, enjoy all the fun of Bryant Park, Rockefeller Center, Times Square. We really enjoyed our stay. Breakfast included isn’t fancy but nicely laid out with a variety of selections for everyone. A nice start to the day.

title: Girls trip
text:
My cousins and I had planned a girls trip to NYC. The Hampton Inn Manhattan was such a convenient location. Right around the corner from Subway station you could get anywhere within minutes. Room was clean and spacious. Complementary breakfast.  On the last day when we checked out, Joseph the bellman was so helpful! He held out luggage until it was time for us to leave to the airport and offered the black car service. Not only he had the car ready for us but he had also loaded our bags. I will definitely stay there again and I hope Joseph is there as well.

Thank you.

title: Great location
text: Location is great, beds are hard and Ia am a side sleeper so I was happy to leave after two nights…but rooms were clean.  We loved being able to walk everywhere from the hotel.  The view wasn’t fabulous from the 24th floor but we saw a slice of Time Square.

title: Quick Birthday Getaway!
text: Just wanted to give a shout out to Fatima!!! She was over breakfast each morning during our stay. Fatima was so friendly, helpful and upbeat! She was the highlight of our morning before heading out for our day. On our last day, she asked if she'd be seeing us the next day and when she learned we were heading home, she wished us a safe and blessed journey. She's a keeper!

title: Great location, friendly helpful staff
text: Great location, friendly helpful staff, good breakfast layout. We stayed here for two nights in order to see you downtown times square in all sides and there’s so much to do right around the hotel that we walked everywhere we needed to go. Joseph, the bellman is outstanding and a great help!

title: Excellent location, staff, room, breakfast
text:
Just a block from Times Square with good views from upper floors.  Rooms are standard Hampton Inn, clean & neat, walk in showers.

Comfortable and safe.  Half a block from subway entrance, easy to get around fast.

Breakfast was the best we have seen since Covid began.  Great selection and the friendliest service we experienced in NY!

Hotels are pricey in NY, but this one provided some value with the cost!

Thank you for a wonderful stay.  We will stay here next time in NY.

title: Very Friendly and efficient
text:
We had a great experience at Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square Central!
As soon as our car service pulled up to front entrance,  the bellman, Joseph was there to help with our luggage;  he was a huge help for the entire stay!  Also, he helped us with our luggage when our driver returned to pick us up and gave us sight seeing advice through out our stay, just so pleasant and helpful.   The breakfast, included with your stay, at the Hampton was delicious and hot, huge variety and the lady that worked the breakfast buffet was soooo friendly and efficient; she just made everyone feel special!    The only thing they could improve on was check-in, the guy that checked us in was not that friendly and complained that he had a million different things going.   The hotel is very convenient and within walking distance to most sites.   Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel!

title: Not worth the $
text: Great location although the front desk team member (Jen A ) was the absolute worst. While the rooms were very clean, they are tiny. The breakfast was typical HI quality, the breakfast staff member Fatima was incredible with all the guests.

title: Best Of The Best Bellman
text: Joseph is geniune, inteligent and goes above and beyond! I don't usually take the time to write positive or negative comments but he deserves it. He was attentive to us and to others that were impatiently waiting to leave their bags at the front desk. He never lost his cool with anyone and offered us water when we left our bags and when we returned.

title: Sisters  seeing Broadway Musical
text:
My sister's and I came to New York from three different  states  NC, GA and FL to see the Tina Musical.  I have been a Hilton Honors member for over 12 years and I  have  enjoyed staying in all Hilton hotels. This weekend we stayed at the Hampton Inn in Time Square on 41st Street. A gentleman by the name of Joseph ( Bellman) showed superb customer service skills to all 3 of us. 
 When we needed directions, he was very polite and told us how to get to certain destinations around Manhattan.  He also told us the cost of an Uber,  car or Taxi so we could get to the airport on time. I just want to highlight Mr. Joseph  for such wonderful hospitality. Especially during this never ending Pandemic.  

With Sincere Thanks & Gratitude, 
Juanita T Smith

title: Bellman Joseph was the best of this hotel
text: We rented 2 rooms for a week in October, 2021.  I loved the breakfast: tasty, plenty and comfortable.  The Bellman, Joseph, was the best part of this hotel.  He was pleasant and eager to please. He helped us out tremendously with our luggage, storage and calling a cab.  The rooms were a little smaller than I thought.  Our room 1403 had a rusty wastebasket and an old worn out hair dryer. But it was convenient to all of Times Square and Manhattan.

title: Girls trip to New York
text: Can’t say enough about the friendliness of the staff. Even though our rooms were not ready in time they held on to our luggage so we could get started with our day. The rooms were clean and had a great city view. Definitely will stay again.

title: Great Staff
text: The staff have been friendly and helpful. Covid has changed the hotel experience but we have to give them credit for doing what they can. They offer a full hot breakfast with eggs, waffles, oatmeal, etc. The rooms are adequate, not fancy but clean.  Great shower. Our only criticism is that they don’t have smart TVs so we couldn’t stream shows we like. We had trouble finding anything g interesting to watch on the channels they offer.

title: Broadway Show Trip
text: Perfect location for seeing Broadway shows, walking to Central Park and enjoying Times Square! And convenient to catch the subway to other locations. The front desk staff was helpful in answering all of our questions. Would definitely stay at this Hampton Inn again!

title: Quick overnight stay.
text: This was just a quick overnight stay for my wife and I. Great location near time square. Hotel staff were friendly, room was clean and breakfast was great.  We had no complaints considering most hotels still have staffing issues.

title: Great location and service!
text: This is a clean, comfortable hotel with stellar service. The staff was super accommodating with our tour group and paid attention to details. The breakfast staff was also fabulous and kept everything well stocked. Bellman Joseph was also super helpful helping us store our luggage after checkout before our flight. The entire staff was super friendly!

title: Great location
text: We were close to Times Square and the Broadway shows. The breakfast was great to have each day before we started sight seeing. I would definitely stay here on my next trip to NYC. All of the employees was friendly and helpful.

title: Weekend Getaway
text:
I came with some friends to see a few plays and some city sites...we originally picked this hotel because of the location.  So glad we did!  Walked every where. What prompted me to write this review though, is the lovely breakfast staff.  So breakfast was absolutely more than we expected, but FATIMA, is absolutely lovely.  Friendly, kind and courteous a morning person for sure.  She is absolutely an asset to the team and her.
Thank you for making the weekend really nice!

title: A wonderful choice
text: Incredible location. I wasn't sure which Hilton to choose in Times Square and I would definitely stay here again. Just slightly off of Times Square and so close to everything. Breakfast is typical Hilton complimentary breakfast (waffles, oatmeal, eggs, proteins, breads, yogurt, juice, breads). Yes - the elevators are a little slow but it's not a huge inconvenience. I was on the 25th floor. Even number rooms face Times Square; odd face the Empire State Building. Very quiet. Decent bed. Hot shower. Excellent price. Would stay here again.

title: Convenient and clean
text: This hotel is nothing fancy, but the rooms are clean and comfortable.  The only complaint is that there was no fridge in the room.  They provided a hot breakfast, which in covid times is unusual.  The staff at the front desk were helpful and friendly.  Great location for all New York attractions.  Reasonable prices.  I would recommend it as a convenient place to stay.

title: OK hotel but had issues
text: Great location, easy to walk to Times Square and Empire State Building. Hotel was very clean as was the rooms. Free internet worked fine. There aren't any vending machines but there is a little pantry in the lobby that you can grab things and charge to your room. There aren't many rooms on each floor so its fairly quiet inside (though you still hear the noises on the road). Rooms are a bit small, but probably normal for Manhattan. The bed wasn't the most comfortable and there wasn't much shower pressure. The biggest annoyance is you have to ask at the front desk every single day for housekeeping and several times they didn't even do it. They also often didn't answer the phone (probably short staffed). Also for a building this tall, they only have 3 elevators, and when we were there it appeared the third elevator was broken. This resulted in long waits and crowded elevators. The breakfast was OK but there wasn't any variety day-to-day other than changing between sausage and bacon. No fault of the hotel, but this area of town now seems to have a lot of homeless, drug users, and mentally ill people walking around, all the way from here to Times Square and Broadway. Overall, it was fine but it could have been much better.

title: Clean, Comfortable, roomy and perfect location!
text: Clean accommodations, comfortable bed, working air conditioning, free hot breakfast, views from some rooms, and friendly staff! And the location is AMAZING! You are around the corner from Time Square, and multiple subway stations. Close enough to scoot downstairs to Tome Square, but somehow not noisy at all. I am very impressed with the hotel and location, and we will definitely stay here again.

title: Great location
text: Perfect location on 7th and 41st. Walking distance to everything. Best price for this area. Hot complimentary breakfast is always a plus. Some wear and tear noticeable in room but not a game-changer. Overall great experience

title: Construction all night long…
text: I stayed here for two nights. In general, the staff was nice. The check in process was easy and fast. I’m giving a one star review because there was construction outside my room from 12 am to the early morning. They were drilling up the pavement. I got 3 hours of sleep… When I called the front desk for ear plugs and asked to change rooms the next day, no one apologised or gave any sort of explanation. Although I was able to change my room, this was incredibly unprofessional and uncaring. They charged me the full price for the room without any compensation. I’ve never experienced anything like this. Also, the room was also not cleaned very well, such as sticky handles and stained sink area. I really doubt the rooms were properly sanitised. I will be looking for other hotels in the future.

title: Hampton Inn
text:
Located very close (walking distance) to all theaters and Times Square. Location felt very secure. Room was clean and comfortable. We paid for a city view and had a fantastic view of the city. We also enjoyed the observation deck on the top floor. 
Elevators and breakfast were a tad crowded but it was Comic-Con weekend (so we expected that).

title: Great location, competitive price, nice sized room.
text: Location- great for Times Square and Broadway shows. Easy walk from Penn Station. The Hilton Honors app worked flawlessly for contactless check-in and check-out along with choosing your room and a digital key. Key is needed for access to lobby and for elevator. Housekeeping is provided only on request (which is just fine by me). Request for fresh towels and more shampoo was handled promptly and courteously. King STD room was clean and a nice size....no mini fridge. Updated bathroom was also a nice size with large shower (no tub). WiFi- fast and free. Low floor (my request) had little street noise. Complimentary breakfast was very good. I was very happy during my 2 night stay and will definitely return. My only suggestion is a couple of complimentary bottles of water on arrival would be great! Charge $5 more for the room if you have to, but how nice it would be to have a cold drink of water after a day of traveling.

title: Worst Hampton experience
text: The service could not have been worse. Need new staff. The manager there was very unprofessional and my gf & I weren’t satisfied. They messed up our rooms and charged our card after we left with many fees that didn’t add up. When we called they had no explanation and were very rude. We also never received our deposit back. Legal action will be taken

title: Very bad
text:
No hot water at the shower
Bad service
Not cleaning the rooms
The crew didn’t reply for the reception calls,
As a gold honor member I rcv no special treatment at all,
Not should be part from Horton branch

title: Clean, comfortable, great location
text: Perfect location! Affordable, clean and comfortable. There was a wonderful woman working breakfast, and efficiently cleared us a spot, but I didn’t catch her name. And Joseph the bellman was very helpful taking care of our luggage after checkout and arranging airport transportation. Everyone we interacted with at the front desk was terrific, but I didn’t catch their names either.

title: Excellent Service, Great Location
text: Hotel was perfectly located. Central to all great sites and what you would expect from a Hilton Hampton which I always like (clean rooms, easy snack access etc.). But the reason I am taking the time to leave a longer than normal review is to let everyone know that Joseph is the BEST bellman in the USA. We hit some hiccups on our way out of the hotel with timing and some family issues, had to store bags, switch bags, add things to stored bags, try to leave and then not leave due to car issues. Finally got the car out of the garage and called my wife while sitting in NYC traffic to have the bags taken out to get us on our way quickly as we had a family emergency. At first she was told by someone else that she needed the tickets (which I totally respect and understand) but I said put Joseph on the line he knew right away who I was and started to get everything ready and verified who he was speaking with on the fly over the phone and greeted me when I pulled up with bags in hand ready to load. All in all, I probably single-handedly gave him 10 requests that late afternoon, which is way over the helpful limit and into superman territory. He handled every request as though it was the first, super good natured great smile even though we saw he was very busy with so many requests from many others as it got busy on a Friday afternoon. Whoever manages this property should consider bringing him onto the management team. Anything he manages will turn to gold. I guarantee it, his character and customer focus will help you build your clientele and make the hotel successful. Right as we were finally about to get out of his hair and drive off, I needed to take a quick trip to the men's room as nature called. He let me keep the car running, personally unlocked the door to the closest hall and showed me to the RR, and when I came out he handed two waters to me for myself and my wife and told us to have a safe trip. Thank you Joseph! You made the trip end on a great note for us. If I was a rich man with a business, you would be a senior partner by now. God bless you and the whole team. -Shane and Diana

title: Impressed
text: For the price we paid.. I was completely impressed with how nice this hotel was! I would definitely stay here again!! The staff was so kind and accommodating! Location was INCREDIBLE! Rooms were somewhat updated. All great!

title: I love it
text: love it, we are thinking to go back to the same hotel the only problem was the parking was too much but the hotel was perfect and the location was great. Breakfast really good and the staff very nice.

title: Great hotel wish breakfast was allergen friendly…
text: Wonderful stay. Room was clean. I used the Hilton honors app and I was able to digitally check in and out and had a digital key which was wonderful! Only thing about the room was the curtains didn’t seem long enough to cover all of the light coming in and those gaps were at eye height when laying on bed. So maybe new curtains that block that out would be nice. I also was hoping there would be something gluten and or dairy free at the breakfast but there wasn’t… so I went home hungry.

title: Will be back soon!!
text: Enjoyed our stay, the staff made our trip easy to settle in and were super friendly and accommodating!! The room was perfect and clean! The location was perfect in Times Square, close to the best bagel place and pizzerias!! Amazing stay!!

title: Great for NYC!
text: The price is consistent with NYC.  The entire hotel was very clean from breakfast room to lobby to elevators to guest room.  I did not expect daily cleaning, that’s a thing of the past.  But if asked, they brought what I needed.  Location very good.  Subway across street.  Staff was excellent!!!!  Took time to answer any questions and help with directions.  I would recommend!

title: Very Satisfied.
text: Friendly, courteous and very accommodating staff. Clean room with comfortable beds. Great breakfast selection. Very satisfied with the cleanliness of the hotel as well as the security - required key card to get in the lobby as well as the elevator to go to your room. Would definitely stay again.

title: Nice stay in Times Square area
text: We had a very nice stay in this hotel.  It is a few blocks from Times Square - close enough to get there quickly but without all of the noise.  Included was breakfast and it was not gormet but very nice.  Hats off to Angel and Will, the two people that staffed the breakfast.  They worked so hard and always with a smile.  Never to busy to answer a question or speak kindly to the guests.  Thank you for a lovely hotel stay and SPECIAL THANKS to Angel and Will.  Your hotel has two most excellent employees in Angel and Will.

title: Great location in Times Square
text: Right near all the action of Times Square, close to Bryant Park, nice walk to Central Park. Family friendly, decent size rooms for New York, clean rooms, friendly, helpful staff. Decent security measures in place for hotel access as well. Superb location. We enjoyed our trip and would stay again.

title: Kind Staff, Cozy Bed, Great Shower
text: We flew in late from Detroit. Arrived around midnight and the staff was incredibly accommodating. Nobody was irritated at our late arrival and they were funny and kind. Due to our Diamond Status, they provided us with a room on the 24th floor, complimentary bottles of water, and snacks. Did not partake in the free breakfast. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Comfortable and cozy accommodations, excellent water pressure. Body wash is always a good thing, but the bar soap was Dove so it’s cool. Highly recommend.

title: Review
text: Clean the service room more often and pay attention to the cleaning crew as they tend to use the elevator for a long period of time. I noticed they also play around in the hallways  instead of focusing on their duties.

title: Great Location / Great Accommodation
text:
Second time staying at that location. Great central location. 
Kudus to a pleasant and quick early check-in. About 25 floors but only about 10 rooms per floor. Hence Elevator waiting time during peak hours can be a few minutes. The rooms are a bit smaller than usual due to real estate limitations. Best to get room with single bed. Shower very nice. Breakfast area can be a bit crowded during peak times. Cost per night below average for comparable hotels. Special thanks to Joseph during check-in/out. Most helpful!!
Parking easiest a block down the street at Port Authority. Easy in and out directly from tunnel for about $60/day.

title: Hotel staff need their own elevator. Long wait
text: Long wait for the elevator feels longer since staff use the same elevator during prime time. There’s 26 floors and lots of rooms with only 3 elevators. Breakfast and dinner times are 30 minute wait. Plan around that

title: Two night stay with my mom.
text: The staff was very helpful, polite, and friendly. The lobby was very nice and welcoming. We arrived early, but were able to check in with out an issue. Room was smaller then expected, but worked fine. Bed was comfy. Hot breakfast is included, with a wide array of options. Breakfast hours are 7am-10am. Food was very good, and the staff kept up great with cleaning and refilling. There was no major issues for our stay. The only complaint was the cleanliness of our room, see included pictures. I would more then likely still stay here again though. The picture with the headboard, there's finger and hand prints and oily residue on it. The towel picture has a blood stain. The blanket has a hole cut into it.

title: Could have been better
text:
We are avid Hampton Inn customers.  This was a great location, close to Times Square. The doorman - so friendly and knowledgeable about area gems.  Beds and pillows- not the best.  We have had better and worse.  Rooms need a little updating. Great views from our 30th floor.  Fatima in the breakfast area - what a wonderful, helpful and caring person. I enjoyed her spunk every morning. 

The one miss- coffee.  No coffee available 24 hours as in other hotels. Coffee is only available 7-10 am.  That is rough for early mornings.  Uber Eats does deliver Dunkin’ thankfully!

title: GREAT LOCATION PLUS GREAT VALUE EQUALS GREAT STAY!
text:
Terrific 3-night stay at Times Square in NYC featuring decent and free Wifi and breakfast. Friendly and helpful front desk and breakfast staff. 

Housekeeping services were provided by request only which was more than satisfactory given the pandemic.

title: Great location for a stay in the Big Apple
text: Room was clean, warm breakfast included, friendly staff, parking within a couple blocks from the hotel, Subway is up the street so very convenient to get to the hotel. They have a rooftop observatory, but does not offer views from all sides.

title: Summer vacation
text: Great location! Breakfast was great. The breakfast was awesome. Staff was superb: friendly and helpful. The Subway was close by. Rooms were clean and good size and comfy. We would Go back in a heartbeat!!

title: Good
text: Would give 4.5 stars if I could. It's not quite as glamorous as you expect it to be from some of the web photos, but nothing in times square really is to be frank. Free breakfast is a big plus if you're traveling on a budget, but don't expect a gourmet meal. Food was decent and kept us full though, so that's a plus for someone like myself. Overall pleased with cleanliness of the room, although the sink didn't drain very well. Good proximity to times square, but the entrance is on a side street that gets a little weird at night, again that's not the hotels fault. Overall not too expensive and good location if you want to see times square. Just keep somewhat realistic expectations and it meets them. Hilton doesn't disappoint usually

title: Never Again
text: Our room had mold on the ceiling.  The room was very humid. The floor actually felt damp.  The hand sanitizer in the hall was empty.  The breakfast was chaos.  Running out of plates.  We left hungry.  Very understaffed.  The manager at the desk was the only one not wearing a mask.  Then we didn’t know we had to validate parking to safe $30, so we had to walk back 👎🏻😩

title: Great stay
text: Other than the cleanliness in the rooms bathroom the stay was wonderful. I had empty shampoo and conditioner. No trash bags and missing towels. Also shower wasn’t very clean.Other than than that Perfect location. Staff went above and beyond with hospitality. Thanks everyone.

title: Location is the only thing good about this place
text: The Wi-Fi is absolute trash. The staff from noon on is rude. Even if you request housekeeping they don’t show up. Don’t complain about anything unless you want to get yelled at. And don’t check into a certain room on your phone because you won’t get it anyway. They’ll just put you wherever they want.

title: BANG FOR YOUR BUCK .. highly recommend.
text: The best location you could ever find in NYC. Right by Times Square. Great value for your money. The price was very reasonable for a Times Square hotel. Amazing breakfast every morning and we thoroughly enjoyed the stay. Will go back again !!

title: Important aspects of a hotel stay were very poor
text:
The very weak aspect was that the internet would not connect either of our computers in our room for our six-night stay.  No one at the front desk had any idea how to make it work.  There were three computers in the lobby, but when we needed to print off sightseeing information, the one printer did not function.  (We found that places of interest often no longer provide guides or floor plans; they expect the traveler to be able to find that info on-line.)
The room had a KS bed (two people) but only one chair.
The breakfast was complete and well-managed.  
The employees were cordial but technically uninformed.

title: Ideal location
text:
Pros: The location can't be beat just 1 block from Times Square, no noise in room  heard during the night. Breakfast is decent, the slim lady that cleans the tables and helps you find a table is super nice and telling people stay safe and have a good day in the cit. She always made sure there was food while you were inlanders one getting it or updating when it was coming.

Cons: I guess it is expected ted if you are neat Times Square there are lots of homeless around the hotel, the strong smell of marijuana outside of the hotel and especially in Times Square pp trying to sell you the marijauna constantly. The elevator can be very slow even with 3 of them as there are so many guest. They don't clean your room or give you towels unless you ask for it however when you do they revery efficient and timely. Bed is somewhat uncomfortable and made a lot of squeaky noise I felt the bed break with so much noise.

Not sure if I will stay again there just as the neighborhood is not the best and the views from your room is less than desirable.

title: Won't Return and We Returned Here Because Our First Stay Was Wonderful. Run Down, Terrible Service
text:
We traveled to NYC four years ago and stayed at Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times Square Central. We prefer to use Hilton as we use it for work and vacation. We had a wonderful stay four years ago. The rooms were clean, the from desk staff lovely and helpful and the hotel exceeded our expectations so much so that we decided to stay here again for our return trip last week. My guess is there has been a change in management because our stay was awful. I will not return. I doubt I will ever hear from a manager and so I will be writing and calling corporate. Here is a breakdown for anyone considering staying at this location:

1) We reserved this location in advance on our Hilton app and noted that we needed joining rooms because we were traveling with kids

2) I called the hotel location (not the 800 Hilton number, the ACTUAL hotel to confirm in advance that we would have joining rooms where our kids could walk back and forth (not rooms next door to each other  - JOINING ROOMS - and was told yes).

3) When we arrived, we were told our rooms were joining. No problem

4) We get to our rooms, THEY ARE NOT JOINING!

5) Go downstairs to be BELITTLED by a staff member to be told that I could not have possibly called the hotel in advance to inquire about joining rooms because 95% of people call the central reservations line and do not know to call the actual hotel. I said to him that I fell in the 5% and did not appreciate his condescending tone and to also explain to me the staff member who checked me in assuring me we had joining rooms AS WELL AS THE NOTATION IN OUR RESERVATION THAT WE NEEDED JOINING ROOMS. He told me to wait for a manager at 3 pm arriving WHO NEVER CAME OUT TO SPEAK TO ME. He then also said that only King rooms could join. Why did no one tell me this? So we had minor kids in a room by themselves in NYC. 

6) There were no coffee cups in our room. I requested them. Never arrived.

7) I needed to use the business center. I could not because there was a homeless person using it for TWO DAYS!

8) I needed to buy water bottles from the snack area at the hotel, they were sold out.

9) We requested room service because our baby threw up on the sheets. Room service NEVER came and I had to sleep on sheets with VOMIT on them. 

10) I called down to the front desk three different times. No one ever answered.

11) If you need help from the front desk, good luck, the line is always to the front door. Regardless, it doesnt matter, they dont do what they say they will do anyway.

12) If you need a manager, HA! They wont ever come out to talk to you. 

And, I dont expect a manager to ever follow up with me on this thread either so I will call a friend I know at corporate and deal with things that way.

Bottom line...dont sell rooms you cant staff properly. RIDICULOUS. I am still grossed out and unbelievably frustrated that we paid what we paid to stay on a Hilton/Hampton property to be treated so poorly. I have never complained ever to a Hampton or Hilton before. But this hotel is in over their heads with management with their heads in the sand. Unbelievable.

title: Excelente!
text:
Hotel muy bien ubicado (trenes, buses, sitios históricos, restaurantes).
Gran alcance del wi-fi, dado el aislamiento, debes pedir que aseen el cuarto con anticipacion y asi se programan para dejartelo en optimas condiciones!…
Gran desayuno!, recomiendo bajar temprano por el…

title: Hotel in NY, Madison Square Area
text: Noce and quite, good location. The room was clean, but the bathroom too small and quite uncomfortable. I bet there is some better room… On the other hand the receptionist was very kind and allowed us to check in two hours early. Good experience.

title: Great location, otherwise not so great
text:
We had two rooms here the last weekend in July 2021.  The rooms were fine, clean, no bedbugs.  View from 3009 was good, partial view of Empire State Building.  Elevators fast.  Breakfast buffet good.  Location can't be beat: central, close to so much and super close to the subway.  Yes, Times Square area has a lot of homeless, weed smokers, and even people shooting up--no surprise, it's a city.  We never felt unsafe in this area.

Negatives:

- I've complained before and won't stop until Hampton Inn gets rid of the barn-door bathroom doors.  There was a one inch gap, so from the toilet you could actually see out the window.  Barn doors don't belong on bathrooms.  It was basically like having the toilet in the hotel room.

- when leaving I requested a taxi, but a private car service was called instead.  I know this is a game played at a lot of hotels, but if I say 'taxi' I mean a city-regulated taxi service, not some unmarked private car.

- No cups in the room; no plastic bag for the ice bucket; no lid for the ice bucket; no water bottles (per hotel, 'Silver' Honors members no longer get water, but front desk was kind enough to give them to me).

title: Posizione strategica e ottimo Hotel
text:
Hotel situato a pochi metri da Time Square, quindi davvero comodo per girare la City sia che si decida di prendere la metropolitana, che si voglia girare a piedi tutta Manhattan.
Noi abbiamo preso un camera quadrupla, ovviamente ha qualche limitazione di spazio e  un solo bagno, quindi la consiglio solo per una famiglia con bambini per 4 adulti diventa già più problematica da gestire. Buona la pulizia, il personale non parla Italiano, ma sono molto disponibili, la colazione è buona ma per un Hotel come questo non ha i stessi standard Italiani, pochi prodotti dolci. Dopo colazione prima di uscire è possibile prendere alla reception un sacchetto che contiene una piccola merenda e acqua da portarsi in giro, inoltre è sempre disponibile uno spazio per usufruire di caffè e bevande calde a tutte le ore. se vi serve un transfert per l'aeroporto per più persone chiedete pure alla receptions servizio valido ad un prezzo onesto per New York.

title: Great stay!!!
text: Great stay super friendly staff and really clean the hotel  I enjoy my stay I will come back next time and great location everything is in walking distance to time square great view at the hotel !!!!!!

title: Great location in the heart of Times Square
text: Great location right in the heart of Times Square, about 15 mins walk to Empire State Building. The rooms were clean and the buffet breakfast had a good selection of hot and cold foods. The front desk service was very helpful.

title: Great location for family vacation
text: Wonderful staff, friendly and accommodating. Small but clean rooms. Very comfortable beds. Clean and ample linens. Limited options at breakfast and number of guests made access difficult. Street noise requires earplugs to sleep comfortably.

title: Too crowd and low level service
text: Too crowd and low level service. Breakfast was not enough for more than 100 hundred people booked on the hotel. There were no manager helping ti solve issues. Cleanning no happen on 3 nights booking. Thx

title: Buen hotel
text: Hotel en Times Square cerca de tiendas, restaurantes, metro. Nos gusto para viaje familiar. Lo único malo en horas pico desayuno muy saturado de gente y elevadores poco tardados. El personal de recepción muy atentos, en especial la Señorita Muñoz, se merece un bono!

title: Very good experience, I'll book again!
text:
I visited this hotel in June 2021. Given the pandemic restrictions you need to inform to the lobby if you want to have your room cleaned, I did that a couple times during my short stay and it worked all fine. You can always ask for extra bottles of water at the lobby. There is not mini fridge on the room. Rooms are clean and comfortable. The breakfast has a lot of options, good enough to start your day. 

Depending on the hour the elevators may be a little bit delayed, nothing to be worried about.

I would book this hotel on my next trip to New York, the location is priceless!

title: Manhattanhenge trip
text: Traveled July 12-14 to see the sunset but the clouds did not cooperate. Instead we were fortunate enough to get tickets for Springsteen on Broadway! The Hampton Inn was the perfect location for both! The hotel was very clean. The complimentary breakfast buffet was very good - we weren’t sure if it was going to be a buffet or just a grab and go. Highly recommend the Hampton Inn!

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: A quick but very pleasant visit. The location is so very convenient to everything in the Theater district and that is a big plus. I always appreciate that the staff is so friendly. This was a COVID-era visit and I was pleased with the cleanliness of my room and of the general spaces.

title: Clean, convenient, and professional
text: We have a lot of positive experience with the Hampton brand, but had never stayed in this particular property. We found it comfortable, quiet, and clean. Front desk staff was especially helpful. Our room was just right at the price point. Why 4 stars instead of 5: breakfast service, an important part of the Hampton value proposition, was far too cramped to be COVID-aware and food was too processed.

title: Excellent location, nice staff
text: This was my first time visiting NYC and I’m glad I picked this hotel! Although the rooms are on the smaller, less polished end, the location and generally friendly staff made up for it :) as other reviewers have said for the price, the location can’t be beat! Times Square is right around the corner, Central Park and other tourist attractions are within walking distance and if you need to catch the subway there are two stations very close by. There are also several restaurants nearby likely due to the proximity to Times Square so you won’t have to go far to find food.There was hot self serving buffet style breakfast while I was here. Rooms are cleaned upon request and you have to call/ go to the front desk to ask for extra amenities such as soap, towels etc. Overall pleasant stay. Would definitely consider staying here again.

title: things was stolen from my room and they didn't care about that
text:
probably the worst experience I ever had in a hotel in my life!
Specially not something I expected in a HILTON as their Diamond member...
I was downgraded on check in and got a different room then what I booked.
Services was always terrible, they NEVER answer the phone
and last but not least things was stolen from my room and they didn't care about that, a Manager promised me a few times he will contact me and never did!
do yourself a favor and find a different place to stay!!

title: Vacations in Manhattan
text: Visited NY after a long time to explore the city with grown up children.  Hampton Inn is well located in proximity to time square,  the rooms are comparatively small and cramped but given the location and most time was spent out exploring and we came to sleep only, suited us well.   The elevators worked fine, except during rush time at breakfasts.  The staff was very warm and friendly except one character on front desk (7/8/21 around 10:30am) who was rather unfriendly in attitude and adamantly refused to give me drinking water (after checking my room number, name etc) making the excuse that management has decided to give water only to the new check ins".  Interestingly, when we returned the same day in the evening the staff was happy to provide us drinking water.   The hotel did not have any drinking water dispenser, and while the weather was hot in July it would be unbelievable that hotel management would give instructions not to give water to the hotel guest.  I would recommend the hotel management to look into such behavior of a misfit in hospitality and provide him some training before he tarnishes the hotels reputation any further.

title: חופשה בניו יורק
text: התארחנו שלושה מבוגרים למשך 8 ימים, בחדר היו שתי מיטות קטנטנות, לא נוחות , הזוג שישן ביחד במיטה כמעט ולא ישן. השירות בקבלה היה מתחת לכל ביקורת, לא מחייכים, חסרי סבלנות, לגבי חדר האוכל, הוא קטן ולא יכל היה להכיל את כמות האורחים חלק מהאורחים ישבו בלובי לאכול,שלא לדבר על הלכלוך שהיה בו, כנראה שהם חוסכים באנשי צוות בחיים לא ראיתי כזו טנופת. האוכל לא לטעמינו בלשון המעטה. הדבר היחיד שהיה טוב במלון זה המיקום שלו. למלון הזה לא אחזור ולא אמליץ.

title: Great Location & Bang for your buck
text:
Rooms were clean and decently sized.  Breakfast was fine, nothing special, but more than sufficient. Staff was friendly and helpful.  Location was great, very convenient to Times Square.
One warning to families - We were extremely disappointed as Time Square now reeks of pot!  People are smoking joints on the street, even lighting up in front of the police whose response is that there is nothing they can do.  Both of our kids were extremely upset.  My daughter was even offered coke on the street!!
Not sure if will take another family vacation to NYC until this changes - big disappointment.

title: Drop your bags and go see NYC!
text: I give this hotel an average rating. It's in a sketchy area that I would not want young children to see. Be prepared to be 'welcomed' by street beggers. On two occasions I saw addicts injecting drugs on the sidewalk. The smell of urine was a common occurrence. Having said that, it IS close to Times Square and the subway is basically across the street to get you almost anywhere you want to go (I went to a Yankees game, Coney Island, Central Park, One World Trade Center/911 Museum, etc relatively easy). The continental breakfast was a nice perk with the room (For you germ phobes, be prepared to touch serving utensils that many others have also touched!). The staff was friendly.
