They will only clean your room upon request. My room had an awful view of an alleyway and the back sides of dirty brick buildings. "BUT" I was there to enjoy New York City and NOT stay in a hotel room. This is more of a place to stay with friends on the go and not if you're with your family or trying to impress that special someone with a stay in New York City. I would only stay here again "IF" I got a rate less than $100 per night. I usually love Hampton Inn hotels, but not this one so much.

title: Beware of local streets
text: The hotel has been great, no issues. However, I felt compelled to write a review because the amount of  people experiencing homelessness and asking for money on the streets of Times Square is absolutely overwhelming! I’m talking 5-6 people PER BLOCK all around Times Square sleeping on the sidewalks or approaching and asking for cash. It was terrible and I didn’t feel comfortable even walking around the block to shop or eat. News reports said that tourists were being shot or hit. I’ve been to the city twice before and have never seen things like this. We did some research to see what was going on and found out that NYC put their homeless population into hotels to keep them safe during COVID and there are about 8,000 in 60 hotels around the city, one of those being right in Times Square. If you intend to come to the city, do your research and chose a hotel away from those being used as temporary shelters. If we had known how bad it was we would’ve chosen a different location and hotel.

title: Clean and comfortable
text: The hotel room was clean and comfortable.  The staff friendly and helpful.  I would definitely stay there again.  It was a lot smaller than I expected but then I remembered that it’s New York and so small is to be expected.

title: Muy buena ubicación
text: El personal del hotel es muy amable. La ubicación es muy buena, está a unas cuadras de Times Square y del Bryant Park. Hay una estación del metro en la esquina. Lo único que no es excelente es el desayuno, pero de ahí en fuera, muy recomendable

title: Great stay!
text: Great hotel and the location for my business meeting was great! Outstanding hotel! Thank you for great service! Will definitely stay here again! Everything was so nice front desk staff was very informative as well! I’m huge in customer service and everyone here was so helpful. A huge kuddos go to your house cleaning department! Their work shouldn’t go unnoticed considering they play a huge part!

title: Good location, awesome service
text:
We enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn Manhattan , good location, nice breakfast and a special shout out to Dovid and his crew Jerry and Reggie for their wonderful service. 

The property is close to Central Park in Times Square, and a sprinkling of nice restaurants in the vicinity

title: Keep coming back
text: Every time I come to NYC I stay at this hotel. It’s centrally located to time square, subway etc. Carnegie Pizza is maybe 100 feet from the hotel THEY HAVE THE BEST PIZZA IN NYC. Hotel Staff amazing!!

title: Awesome location - perfect amenities!
text: First timer- Went for business but took some of the family. Felt safe and walked for hours a day - everything is close and super convenient. Dallas BBQ restaurant is AMAZING!  Uber to Bronx Zoo was easy- hotel arranged a car for our super early departure to the airport- so smooth!!

title: فندق ممتاز
text: اقامتي في هاملتون سكوير كانت رائعة، الفندق نظيف وقريب جدا من التايم سكوير ومع ذلك هادئ. الموظفين مرحبين طوال الوقت. مرافق الفندق مثل غسيل الملابس متوفره وهذه مهمه بالنسبه الي. انصح بالسكن به للجميع افراد او عوائل

title: Such a great location!!!
text: On a quiet street just off of Times Square so literally everything is either a short walk or subway ride away. And let's talk about that subway...it's literally 30 seconds from the hotel! On a rainy day, we didn't even break out the umbrellas to get to the station, that's how close it is. We stayed five nights and the hotel was a great base camp.  Friendly staff, loved the use of the key card to get into the hotel and in the elevator. Lobby was very pretty and kept clean.

title: Maybe understaffed?
text: Bed was clean and comfortable as was shower.  Rug desperately needed a vacuuming and room needed a good dusting.  If I was there longer, I’d have bought and washed the bathroom floor myself - the corners were disgusting.   Breakfast was fine, we did a grab and go.

title: Sucio y caro
text: Hotel sucio. En 5 noches de estadía nunca limpiaron la habitación. Pedí que la limipiaran y me entregaron sábanas y toallas para que yo las cambie. Las sábanas y las toallas son las que desechan otros hoteles. Las toallas son tan delgadas de lo gastadas y viejas q ya no secan. Las sábanas son más pequeñas que el colchón, y se salen terminas durmiendo con tu cara encima de un colchón que no se ve nada agradable. Están aprovechándose del COVID para subir tarifas y bajar calidad. Es una vergüenza.

title: Great location and clean room.
text:
We stayed here for 3 days. 
You’ll be right in the middle of the Time Square area. It is safe to walk around, and definitely more hectic than other areas of Manhattan. The roof top view was great. We stayed on one of the top floors and our view was decent. We faced north and there wasn’t much to see. 
Breakfast was complimentary which was a plus. It’s like a continental with a few more options. It was solid for us. The bed was really comfortable and we had no issues at all. If I ever decide to stay in the city again, I’ll definitely find my way here. Location was great to grab many trains.  You’ll be in a central location.

title: Excellent stay
text: Staff and hotel excellent. Good service and food. Clean and safe. Nearby by discount parking. Close to all attractions. Use of key to enter building and to use the elevators. Front desk knowledgeable and friendly

title: Fantastic Stay, Phenominal Staff, Clean, Family Friendly, Close to subway & everything else
text:
We can not say enough great things about this place! The staff was completely above and beyond and supportive and helpful while traveling with our child on the spectrum! They made it possible for us to stay our whole trip by accomodating foods and directing us to near by grocery and how to get to a Little Caesars Pizza for our son during our stay. They supplied a complimentary fridge for our sons medication storage and responded promptly with a replacement blow dryer that was missing from our room. Took the time to share maps and directions as well as even offered to bring us the pizza our son would eat. Then further offered laundry supplies, cheese and butter to make grilled cheese for our child and access to the dining room after hours if for our needs, waters and just great conversation. I would like to extend a special thank you to the following staff and I just didn't get the names of many others. The ones we won't forget are Geraldine, Joseph, Beverly, Rodney and Mariama. Thank you so much to each one of you and all others that I did not catch their names! New York was such a great trip due to your second mile service going above and beyond for a family who needed it, so may each of you be noticed by your supervisors because you all deserve the recognitions!!!!!!! This place is fantastic, don't listen to any negative reviews because if your stay is like ours you will be writing the next fabulous review for these hard working and deserving staff😁

The Turner Family from Texas❤

title: Worst service ever
text:
My experience started out with them giving the room that I paid with points to someone else and then couldn't come up with any plausible explanation other than to tell me that I didn't check in but then that person was never moving out of that room.  Front desk personnel had a very I really don't care attitude when we checked in and then when we checked out the next day and went to another hotel.  
They did offer us sodas but when asked for cokes then they didn't have but one available.  It seems that they don't even to try to keep items stocked unless you purchase from them.  As a platinum member of Hilton I was extremely disappointed in the service and accommodations at this hotel.

title: Very noisy
text: We didn’t get to sleep till 230am with all loud music and loud talk and running around. The room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast provided no hot food. Through no fault of the hotel, the block it’s on is very sketchy. Dirty, smelly and numerous homeless people wondering the block.

title: Perfect spot for our vacation
text: This hotel was perfect for me, my husband, and our 8 year old daughter to stay at. It is close proximity to everything that is Times Square, right by a subway station, near restaurants, by the port authority bus terminal, and shopping. Even though it is in Times Square you cannot hear the noise from outside so sleeping is great. We were on the 25th floor and the view of the city was incredible, I couldn’t get enough of it. There’s also a quaint rooftop terrace and it is one of the only hotels in Times Square that offered complimentary breakfast in the morning. The room was clean and had a small refrigerator, which was very helpful. The hotel adhered to Covid guidelines, the staff was friendly and helpful, and I had no complaints at all.

title: Immaculate rooms, perfect location!
text:
The rooms were immaculate! Very well centrally located, all attractions within walking distances and right across from a subway station. They do alert you of reasonable accommodations they've made due to COVID, such as housekeeping being upon request only, and bagged breakfast. 

RACHELLE welcomed us when we arrived very early in the morning to try to check in, and although she didn’t have to check us is, in her own very quiet and shy way, she moved heaven and earth to accommodate us then and the next day. When we asked her for directions and attractions, she was simple, frank and very helpful! She is definitely a RAY OF SUNSHINE for this property!

Although, watch out for unpleasant staff!!  On my C/O day, there was another guest @ the counter in front of the clerk, Kris. I thought he was typing and helping that guest, when I came to realize he was just ignoring her. That person turned to me, shrugged and walked away. Then I stepped up; at no given moment did Kris acknowledge me, gave any signal of “please wait” or anything. I said “Hi” and he didn’t respond back, so I kept waiting. Finally, when I realized that the same thing that happened to the previous guest was happening to me (being completely ignored), I interrupted him and asked what time the breakfast was ending. He just responded “10am”, without raising his eyes to look at me or anything. Since it was 9:50am, I was not going to wait any longer to keep being ignored and miss the little breakfast I could arrange.

title: Very nice place to stay.
text: Hampton Inn Manhattan / Times Square Central is a very nice place to stay. Room are very clean, protocols are followed. We felt very safe at this property. We would highly recommend this property. Great value.

title: Awesome staff
text: We were given a room with a great view staff was very helpful and got us into our room quickly. You had to have a key card to get in or up to your room so just anyone couldn’t walk in that didn’t belong

title: It’s ok
text: Run down with bad coffee and revolting breakfast. Come on Hilton get your act together. Staff looked miserable. Elevators took forever. Windows were filthy. No water pressure in shower. Toilet seat broken. TV disconnected.

title: A good stay but breakfast was eh
text: Was here for 1 night April 28th to the 29th of 2021. Came from Boston because my team the Boston Red Sox was playing the Mets at Citi Field and I wanted to stay in Times Square. This hotel is behind the Aladdin Broadway theater, I enjoyed my stay however, I was kinda disappointed in a couple of things. 1. I requested a city view room and my view was mostly some random looking buildings that looked like apartments and I barely saw the city and 2. The breakfast was boring all they had was bagels, bread, boiled eggs, juices, coffee and yogurt with brown paper bags to take breakfast with you, I didn't take any and just went to a nearby diner with actual breakfast in it. When I thought the breakfast was to go I thought they would at least have little bowl containers with scrambled eggs, sausages or bacon and some toast but nope it's just a weak continental breakfast because of Covid. The location was great and the subway was closeby. I would have given it 5 circles but my room did not look like a city view room and the breakfast was weak. Would definitely stay here again because of the location but that's about it.

title: Mükemmel konum
text: Harika bir konumda güzel kahvaltı güler yüzlü personel geniş temiz oda metro istsayonu yürüme mesafesi timesın yakında olması çevresibde bir çok restorant market cafe tatil için bütün beklentilerimizi karşıladı

title: Excelentw
text: Excelente ubicacion muy cerquita de time square , limpieza 100% , pedimos vista en la habitacion y fue hermosa, desayuno super bien a nuestro gusto, amabilidad del personal , habitaciones limpias, definitivamente volveriamos a elegirlo

title: Perfection!
text:
This hotel was amazing from the staff to the room to the price to the cleanliness to the location!!!!
We will definitely stay here again. 
A couple blocks from Times Square. 
Very clean, free breakfast, great security measures, friendly staff, nice sized updated rooms. 
A quick subway ride from grand central on the Times Square shuttle. (The S train)
Also very walkable if you’d prefer to walk.

title: Excelente servicio y empatía hacia el huésped
text: Es un Ambiente acogedor, accesible a trenes y Guagua , muchos lugares preciosos que visitar, las tiendas y comidas , una zona céntrica de New York, así que lo recomiendo Mil x Mil y la Vista de Mi Habitación espectacular, Gracias

title: Good for the price
text: For the price hotel was great . Room was clean which is usually my biggest concern . Small . Room was just ok far from luxury . But like I said clean . Time square is like one st over . Beds are very comfortable this hotel is only like a year old . I don’t really have any complaints but probably wouldn’t stay here again .

title: Best hotel for the money
text: From the beginning of our weekend stay, all aspects of our stay was excellent.  The front desk people were so kind and wonderful, even though they had to deal with some shady people.  The rooms are nice and clean, remember you are not paying 5 star prices so don't expect a 5 star room.  For the money you are not getting a better room art a better price.  The hotel is perfectly located, safe and close to subway and really good restaurant.

title: Friendly, Great Value, Safe
text: What more do want?  Much less all this on a quiet street at the edge of all that Times Square and Manhattan offers!  The staff were all busy but also very cordial.  Even the elevators (notoriously a SLOW issue in NYC hotels!) worked well.

title: Room are kinda small
text: The bed was hard felt like sleeping on box spring but over all prime location each floor has only 10-12 rooms on each floor rooms where kind of tight for a family of 3 but worked you can also park infront of the hotel after midnight it’s free

title: Overall pleasant experience
text: When we arrived we immediately felt safe when we observed a Security officer standing there in the main lobby. The place appeared clean and well kept. We found the front desk staff very welcoming offering bottled water to each of our family members. We found the room clean as well. About a half hour after we checked out two days later we realized we left a bag with some items we purchased back in the room. We returned and explained the situation to the front desk staff. They sent another employee up to the room to retrieve the item and brought it to us in the lobby. We were very satisfied with our accommodations and wouldn’t hesitate to stay there again in the future.

title: No recomiendo
text: Un desastre, empleados mal predispuestos, servicios de limpieza cuando a ellos se le ocurría te limpiaban, sin palabras, nada que ver al mismo hotel pero en orlando, ese hotel si es para aplaudir, mismas características, pero otra cosa el servicio, la predisposición,la empatía de los empleados

title: Stay
text: Room was good don’t know if it was the location or the building but all of our phone service didn’t work or work slow then out the building worked perfect they could use a microwave .and the WiFi wasn’t so good either wouldn’t stay connected to my devices

title: Very nice stay
text: I had a very nice stay with my bf. We only stayed one night on the 21rst floor. Although our view was the back of the hotel it was still a nice view. I’ll recommend to family and friends! Super close to Time Square about a 5 minute walk. Breakfast was packaged bagels and muffins. But other than that good stay!

title: Could have been better
text: Was not aware of an additional $60 per night for parking. As a diamond member, they did not welcome me and did not offer any water bottle. Not sure if it’s a New York location thing or not. Location was good

title: Perfect location, excellent service
text: We stayed here for a quick family visit, and this hotel made it perfect. The desk and housekeeping staff were very accommodating, and we were very close to the subway station. The room was clean and had a great city view. We’d definitely book here again.

title: Agradable y puedes pagar en cash
text: Se permitía pagar en efectivo la estancia y el depósito, el desayuno poco variado y olor a marihuana en las instalaciones, sin embargo el personal era atento y en la esquina tenias una estación de metro, podías ir caminando al times square

title: THINK TWICE BEFORE BOOKING
text:
I am a diamond member with Hilton properties. I travel a great deal and primarily only reside at Hilton properties. Especially, since Covid-19, I really love the fact that all Hilton properties has partnered with Lysol.
This particular hotel has dropped the ball! Broke the Lysol seal... entered the room.Toilet seat wide open with hair inside the toilet, sink & countertop were filthy. I was in shock & took a video. At check in I was informed that I would NOT receive any service for my entire 5 day stay. Now, I'm not a nasty person, so I don't require housekeeping to make my bed or take my trash everyday but I do expect a CLEAN ROOM AT UPON ARRIVAL!! 
The room was slightly small but most rooms in the city are fairly small.These rooms are also not equipped with a refrigerator or a microwave. I was on the 26th floor, so every time I needed to heat anything up I had to go all the way to the lobby to heat my food...ridiculous!!! The staff wasn't the nicest but I understood to a certain degree only because I am a native NewYorker...it is what it is ,but some take it too far! 
So, one afternoon my husband & I were laying in bed relaxing & watching tv. I was naked and my husband only had his underwear on. One of the hotel staff entered our room UNANNOUNCED. When my husband popped up & said excuse me.... the staff quickly left the room. My husband ran to the door & asked him why he entered our room. He quickly said sorry, didn't explain anything & left as fast as possible! This in it self is UNACCEPTABLE!!!!! I feel like I should've started my review with this....but cleanliness is absolutely important too!!! This is a non-smoking property that you can get high off of the contact from all the tenants smoking weed in there rooms!!
I definitely will rethink ever staying at a another Hampton Inn! 
Definitely disappointed in this property period.

title: City Stay
text: I would strongly recommend a stay at the Hampton Inn Manhattan/Times square. The staff was courteous, the hotel clean and well situated to points of interest. I felt comfortable and safe! The rooms were quiet and I was able to sleep soundly!

title: Ojo Viajeros
text:
No hacen limpieza en la habitación ni un día con el el argumento del COVIT.
Pero lo curioso es que el hotel no tiene la
Más mínima medida de sanidad al entrar.

title: Wonderful Stay in Times Square
text: Wonderful stay in Times Square we’re comfortable room and beautiful view.  Had a cold breakfast with excellent service and front counter receptionist in lobby were very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this hotel and it was very reasonable. Good for family.!

title: Perfect location! Nice stay
text: Perfect location in Times Square and with a subway station very close. Would definitely consider this hotel again for our next visit. Breakfast is ok considering Covid situation. Staff is very nice and welcoming. If something to improve is the strong smoke odor in hallways that can even get inside the room. Overall very good experience.

title: Served its purpose....room near times square
text:
yes Rooms were smaller but its NYC.... location was close to Times Sq and all the sites etc that you want to check out,,, Food options were limited for breakfast bagels, oatmeal, fruit and coffee.. but was better then nothing.

Main issue is the Elevators.... getting up and down at peak times is tough... we waited 15-20 mins each time to go up and down which is tougher with COVID....

title: Very tiny rooms for double beds.
text: Very small room for double beds.  Both beds were essentially up against walls with narrow walkways between and in front.  Everyone on top of each other.  No space to put away luggage.  Desk is in front of bathroom-so no real privacy.  Not worth it-even for location.

title: Excelente ubicacion
text:
Lo mejor de este hotel es la ubicación estaba a solo unos metros de time square. De la estación de auto buses que te lleva a New jersey, todo está muy cerca.
Sin embargo el aseo del hotel y lo que ofrecían en el desayuno no fue para nada variado diría que bastante deficiente.
El personal del hotel algunos muy colaboradores y dispuestos  ayudarte otros bastante indiferentes. Nadie hablaba español.

title: She
text: Great job!! Keep it up. My family was super happy n the kids loved the breakfast and our view the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone who looking for quick n afford stay with family

title: Hotel con buena relación calidad - precio - ubicación
text:
Este hotel esta muy bien ubicado, muy cerca del Times Square y la Quinta Avenida.
Buenas y modernas instalaciones, camas y baño muy cómodos.
El desayuno incluido muy básico y solo para llevar por situación del COVID, pero suficiente para iniciar el día.
Por la misma situación solo hay servicio de limpieza si usted lo solicita, pero al check in te explican las limitaciones que tienen en los servicios del hotel.
El personal muy amable y servicial.
Ningún problema durante la estancia.

title: the reviews are untrue, this is a mediocre hotel, advice never set foot there you will regret it
text: we stayed at the hotel hampton inn in time square from January 18 to 20 and chose this hotel following the wonderful opinions on orbitz, especially do not be fooled not to these comments, it is not at all the reality, not only is this hotel really low-end, the rooms are dirty, the furniture old and damaged, but in addition we stole my daughter's shoes in the room , Yeezys who are very expensive, we complained to the hotel and do not want to hear anything, I advise you to flee this thief hotel and ignore his sayings good advice, it is however easy to do an investigation, see the cameras and ask the housekeeper, to avoid absolutely, Orbitz is accomplice of all this, I contacted them because I find that they are partly responsible because I reserved on their application, it does not want to hear nothing, it's shameful!

title: Brilliant location and lovely staff!
text:
I booked to stay in this hotel as a surprise for my other half’s 30th birthday. The hotel is in a great location and just a short stroll to Times Square. The room we had was a decent size for the 2 of us, and we didn’t notice any noise at night. The hotel is clean and the staff were really helpful. We arrived early so our room wasn’t ready, but we were able to safely store our bags and use the toilets to change in as we wanted to freshen up after our flight, which meant we could start exploring and check in later. 

After booking online I got in touch with the hotel to let them know it was a birthday surprise, and they kindly offered suggestions of where I could order a cake and balloons to be put in the room. I didn’t end up organising anything but the hotel staff put a card and some snacks in the room which was a lovely surprise! Would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again!

title: Best value for your money
text: From the moment you enter the the hotel just a step or two from Times Square you’re greeted with a wonderful smile and a welcome. The lobby, not fancy is clean and inviting. My room , a standard NYC size was clean and bright. Bed is no a soft, bathroom and shower a little small - but understandable for the price I paid.   I really enjoy my stay at this Hampton Inn.

title: Great Hotel & Location
text: Anytime I’m traveling with my kids, I always try to find best and cleanest Hampton Inn Hotel around. And when visiting New York City, this was it. The location placed us in the middle of Times Square which was walking distance from the main stores and restaurants and/or perhaps a short UBer drive away. More importantly, the manager Hicham was awesome in his professionalism and accommodations as we needed an additional room once we checked-in. We are forever grateful for his assistance. Therefore, I highly recommend Hampton Inn/Manhattan Times Square.

title: Exceptional Service And Great Location
text: We stayed at this property for our son's wedding in NYC. The location of the hotel is great, however the exceptional service of the Front Desk agents Kris and Rachelle made our stay absolutely comfortable and made us feel home away from home. We would definitely stay there again the next time we are in NYC.

title: Great Location
text:
Stayed here for a week with my parents. The hotel is in a perfect location, and right by 42nd Street Subway Station. We walked to many attractions from the hotel and also used the subway a lot. 

The hotel was clean, staff very friendly and helpful. The breakfast that was included was of a good standard and helpful not to have to worry about eating out every morning. There was a lovely lady that worked most mornings, who would always go out of her way to get me gluten free toast or bagels. Breakfast gets really busy and we most often went down for 6am to avoid the masses. 

I would stay at the Hampton again and recommend.

title: Health and safety concerns
text: Stayed at this hotel a couple times most recently I’ve noticed the bed sheets have not been fresh and cleaned nor the remotes, a/c etc. in the current situation to COVID19 I’m even more concerned. I’d suggest you also check a recent Inside Edition expose on the property - definitely will not be returning here

title: A great relaxing spot amidst the chaos
text: I found this place to be relaxing, quiet, and in a great location by Time Square. The rooms were clean and the service was great. The amenities were a bit limited but that’s to be expected in the area.  I will stay here again.

title: Perfect Location
text:
We spent a week at the Hampton Inn in a family room. 

Room was clean, beds were comfortable and the room size was good for NYC. Breakfast was ok with a good selection of options, however be sure to avoid between 8-10 as it does get busy. When it is busy, it is painful and we did a couple of times go out and buy breakfast, which is a little bit of false economy as we had paid for it in the hotel price, but the area was too small to be comfortable eating.

All of the staff were friendly and helpful. Free coffee and hot chocolate in the room and hotel lobby. The location is right in the middle of midtown so really handy for first time visitors to NYC. We picked this hotel because it's close to major subways and Port Authority. Would definitely visit again.

Recommended. I wanted to give it a full 5 stars, but for 2 of the days we were there, one lift was out of service and when you are on the 8th floor, that is a little grinding on how long it takes to get a lift fixed....

title: Good Location
text: Great location ! Easy to get around ! Rooms are very small so not good for family of 4 with luggage. Ended up getting 2 rooms since we were staying for a week ! Felt safe during the virus ! Breakfast was great each morning and whole staff very friendly! Self serve laundry service ! And great having a concierge and bell man !

title: Great Stay
text: Rooms were clean, concierge was extremely helpful in booking tours and shuttle to airport.  Great location, was in easy walking distance to the subways and lots of restaurants.  Pretty quiet considering it is located right off Times Square.  Will stay here again!

title: Great location
text: Hotel is in a great location.  Close to Times Square. Close to the metro and the bus station. Rooms are a decent size. Updated bathroom and good quality amenities. Comfortable beds and good pillows for the bed.

title: A lovely hotel
text:
Stayed here for 4 night and had a lovely time.
It was nice to find a New York hotel that included breakfast,  the breakfast staff were always friendly and helpful.
The reception staff were very helpful, especially when I had a problem and needed to use the courtesy phone in reception a couple of times.
The hotel is in an ideal location just minutes walk from Times Square and many other attractions.
A couple of days the hotel was very busy with groups, this never detracted from our stay

title: Sehr gute Lage
text:
Das Hotel ist recht einfach zu finden. Von der Lage her top. Sehr schnell bei den öV zu Fuss.
Frühstück ausreichend. Für jeden etwas dabei. 
Personal freundlich und hilfsbereit.
Stadtlärm ist hörbar, was durch die sehr zentrale Lage jedoch dazu gehört.

title: Great Location
text: We spent a week at the Hampton Inn. Room was clean, bed was comfortable and the room size (king) was good for NYC. We had a room on 4th floor facing the back so not much of a view, however this didn't bother us as it wasn't our first visit to NYC and it was good to have peace and quiet to sleep. Breakfast was ok with a good selection of options, however be sure to avoid between 8-10 as it does get busy. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. Laundry facilities were good and everything was clean. Free coffee and hot chocolate in the room and hotel lobby. The location is right in the middle of midtown so really handy for first time visitors to NYC. We picked this hotel because it's close to major subways and Port Authority. Would definitely visit again.

title: Great choice!
text: There are hundreds to choose from but I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to NYC.  This hotel is convenient to Times Square and across the street from the 42nd street subway station.  Our room was larger than other hotels we've stayed at in the vicinity and everything seemed new and was clean.  The staff was friendly, polite and helpful (even pulled a band-aid out of a drawer when I asked where to buy some).  Will highly recommend this to anyone I know headed to NYC.

title: Good choice for convenience
text: Very convenient to both the Port Authority Terminal and the theater district. Room was fine — not big but perfectly adequate — well laid out and clean. Reasonably priced by NY standards. Breakfast included, which is also a nice convenience, but don’t expect a gourmet experience. Staff at the front desk were friendly and there was no wait to get to them even though the hotel seemed pretty busy. All in all, a good choice in the Times Square area, especially if arriving at the Port Authority with luggage and a desire for a short walk to your hotel.

title: Always great value
text: The HAMPTON Inn Manhattan always has great value in terms of room rate, service, location and amenities . The breakfast is good , the service is excellent the the location is excellent for theater goers .

title: Birthday Celebration
text: We stayed at this hotel for a friends birthday celebration and it was great. Steps away from Times Square and all the fun. It was cold so we used rideshare or subway when going further out. It’s all steps away from the Path station. Wonderful staff! Only thing is the elevators can get a little backed up during check in time, but you don’t have a long wait. Can’t wait to go back!

title: small room a little off times square and great value
text: stayed for 3 nights in February and was pleasantly surprised.  A great breakfast that is free but way too crowded so just grab something and take to room.  I appreciated the water, tea and coffee in the lobby.  I would definitely stay again and loved the location just off times square and away from the times square mad house.

title: Best trip EVER!
text: First time to NY from AZ. Always afraid when I book a room especially being so far away. This hotel/room/breakfast/staff/LOCATION couldn’t have been better!! Will stay again! Oh and don’t be afraid to take the subway! Best way of commute invented.

title: Great hotel
text: We just came home from a 3 night stay.  We are a family of four.  Location is excellent. Breakfast is a huge bonus. We stayed at the Hilton across the street last year.  Hilton was a little fancier if that is what you are looking for.  Hampton Inn was smaller, but had everything we needed.  We loved the breakfast and valet parking was easy.  All of the staff were great!  Elevator as others posted was a little slow but not too bad. Oh and there is a rooftop terrace, make sure to check that out.

title: Great Value and location!
text: We were especially happy to not pay typical destination fee other hotels charge for Time Square area -- that made the difference and we were not disappointed.  Breakfast was great, rooms were spacious.  We were able to check in when we arrived at noon and hotel held our luggage day of check out so we could experience the town.  Overall excellent experience!

title: Overall Satisfied
text: Hotel was overall a good experience. Modern, clean, with a good breakfast and amiable staff. Biggest complaint is with long wait for elevator in the morning - two times I walked down 23 flights of stairs! They should come up with a different system for this. Also they need more seating in breakfast dining area for busy time. Overall though the hotel is a good value in the heart of theater district.

title: Great location / nice stay... I'll be back!
text: Great location (close to Time Square and the subway... which is one stop from the Javitz Center), friendly staff and nice clean (and quiet) rooms, and the complimentary breakfast is fresh with a wide variety of tasty offerings (really helps get the day off to a nice start)!

title: Very pleasant stay
text:
The hotel is very comfortable, very clean, amazing location near Times Square, big shops and theaters.
Worth price and a nice breakfast . Coffee and fresh water all day in the lobby, mineral water to take out and freshly baked cookies at tea time. Staff very helpful and the most quick checkin and checkout I’ve experienced.

title: Goed hotel
text:
Kamer met kingsize bed was zeker in orde. Ontbijt was voldoende. Personeel was zeer vriendelijk en behulpzaam. De ligging was heel centraal om alle bezienswaardigheden te bezoeken.
Heel de dag gratis koffie en water.

title: Hôtel bien situé et idéal pour visiter NY
text:
Séjour de 5 nuits au Hampton Inn Times Square Central fin février.
Hôtel situé sur la 41è rue tout près de Times Square (4 blocs), et donc du métro qui est un point névralgique où se croisent trois lignes. Cela vous permet donc de partir dans quasiment toutes les directions par le biais des correspondances.
À ce sujet, n'hésitez pas à prendre le métro, on comprend très vite le fonctionnement général et cela épargne les pieds. Si vous ne craignez pas la marche, vous pouvez n'acheter que des tickets à l'unité ou recharger une carte (facturée 1$ une fois) avec un montant défini. C'est la méthode que nous avons choisi, le trajet revient à 2.75$ par personne et est valable (il me semble) 2h ce qui permet largement de faire un grand parcours dans NY (par exemple, aller jusqu'à Howard Beach qui dessert JFK via l'Air Train (7.75$ par personne).
Par contre, si vous sortez du métro, c'est mort, il faut repayer.
À vous de voir si vous préférez acheter une carte illimitée (individuelle) qui correspond au prix de 12 trajets ou n'acheter qu'une carte à recharger que vous passez autant de fois à l'entrée qu'il y a de voyageurs.

Concernant l'hôtel proprement dit, le hall est très beau, moderne, lumineux, très classe.
Accueil professionnel à défaut d'être particulièrement chaleureux, 3 ascenseurs (selon les heures, il faut parfois en attendre un moins plein), le petit-déjeuner inclus est un gros plus (ouvert de 6h à 10h).
Je vous conseille, si vous ne craignez pas de vous lever tôt, d'y descendre dès l'ouverture car la salle étant assez petite, vous pouvez, à l'heure du rush, avoir des difficultés à trouver une table.
Après avoir testé entre 8 et 9h, nous avons pris l'habitude d'y descendre avant 6h30 ce qui assure une salle avec plein de places possibles. Gaufres à faire soi-même (2 parfums différents), céréales, pain de miel, petits gâteaux, jus de fruits frais ou classiques, yaourts lights, des œufs cuisinés de diverses façons et des saucisses/bacon... enfin bref, choix satisfaisant je trouve même si on retrouve +/- toujours la même chose.
À noter que de l'eau fraîche et des boissons chaudes type infusion, thé... sont disponibles en permanence à coté de la réception.
Chambre calme (nous n'étions qu'au 10è étage sur 31), sauf quand les cops jouent de la sirène (celles ci sont si particulières), et spacieuse, produits de toilette en quantité, nous avons laissé un petit tip chaque jour (3-4$) pour le service.
Le jour du départ, possibilité de laisser vos bagages dans une pièce dédiée jusqu'à votre heure de départ.
Voilà, je pense vous avoir dit le plus gros. Bon séjour dans la ville!

title: Séjour au top 👌
text:
Deuxième séjour à NYC. Je gardais un souvenir moyen d’un autre hôtel pas très loin et j’avais un peu peur. 
Je conseille celui-ci sans crainte. 
Hôtel idéalement situé à 2 pas de tout, accueil sympathique et répond aux questions, chambre propre, jolie et spacieuse. 
Le petit dej dont tout le monde parle. Alors oui effectivement ça bouchonne le matin mais c’est déjà bien de l’avoir. Le système des gaufres j’ai beaucoup aimé (les omelettes toutes la semaine moins).
Vous pouvez y aller en famille, en couple ou solo sans soucis.

title: Great Location
text:
Great location one block from Times Square and in the heart of the Theatre District.  Hotel room was a nice size with walk-in shower.  No fridge but we didn’t need one.  Most staff were very helpful. The lady at the concierges desk was not particularly friendly and unable to give us directions to the E train because she said she never takes it.  

Hotel elevators very busy in the morning, we had to wait about fifteen minutes for one that wasn’t full.  

Don’t plan to eat at the hotel.  There was no room in the eating area or the lobby by 8 a.m.  Plenty of ways to eat on the cheap in the area, just not in Times Square.

Overall, this hotel met our needs well and I would totally stay there again.

title: Perfect for an overnight when seeing a Broadway show
text:
Thanks to all the positive reivews on TA for steering me to book a room at this location a few nights ago. I had tickets to an evening show and wanted to stay over. Based on the reviews I read I decided to try this property although I didn't know anyone personally who had stayed here.

Found the hotel to be perfect for what I wanted: comfortable room, adequate free breakfast, easy walk to the theatre district, and  a quieter street despite its proximty to Times Square. The staff was friendly and the room, although small, was nicely appointed and in very good condition. Comfortable mattress, good pillows, nice shower, adequate lighting.
Breakfast was a nice addition and the food itself was good. The breakfast room , however, as others have stated could use an overhaul. It's  very small, in need of a some cosmetic work and the tables need to be cleaned off by staff when vacated.
Otherwise was quite pleased with my stay, will absolutely return here and have already recommended it to  friends.

title: Uitstekend gelegen efficiënt, schoon en behulpzaam
text: Prima hotel, voorzien van alle essentiële zaken, keurige kamers, ontbijtruimte is wat klein voor de gasten,  aar ja, ontbijt is inclusief. De sfeer is zakelijk, de ligging is perfect, vlakbij metro, bus en Times Square, Penn station is walkable, MSgarden ook.

title: Sisters 60th Birthday
text: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this lovely friendly comfortable Hotel!Staff are all amazing and go the extra mile to make your stay as good as it can be! The Jewel in their crown has to be mentioned! She's the Breakfast Supervisor Geraldine!and a treasure to meet!..her own words were..I just want to see everyone having a nice breakfast and a good start to their busy day!.....Hampton? Hold on to this shining star! She had all the dining room staff sing Happy Birthday to my sister and myself!..Amazing!...Thankyou to all the Staff!..X

title: Quartos Pequenos mas adequados
text: Os quartos do Hampton Inn são pequenos quando tem 2 camas, então fica pouco espaço para circulação. Mas o hotel compensa em outras coisas. O banheiro tem uma ótima disposição,  os amenities são da Neutrogena, o quarto é muito silencioso, o serviço de quarto sempre deixa o quarto muito bem arrumado, a área do café da manhã é muito boa e o café servido é variado, apesar de ser voltado para o paladar americano (café americano quente e leite gelado). O hotel também concede garrafas de água mineral na recepção (só pedir) e há sempre café e chocolate em pó disponível para os hóspedes se servirem na área dos fundos. Há business center, academia e fica na mesma rua da saída da Grand Central Station pelo lado do Mercado, então está muito bem localizado, a poucos passos, também, da ONU. Vale a pena quando se consegue um preço razoável na diária. Definitivamente voltaria a me hospedar no hotel.

title: Absolutely did the job
text: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a great stay. Room was as expected we were on the 22ns floor with a view of the Empire State Building. Breakfast was lovely, really enjoyed the different waffle batters especially the cinnamon one! But lots to choose from. Eggs, bacon, sausage patties, Omelettes, smoothies, juices, pastries and yogurts. But what we really liked was the free hot chocolate and coffee in reception. Loved the got chocolate here! And the cookies in the evening were a lovely touch. It was only the last day we realised our tv didn’t work but we were to busy. The hotel is a fab location and would def stay again.

title: Ótima estadia!
text: O hotel fica em uma ótima localização, com fácil acesso a qualquer ponto da cidade, a meia quadra da rodoviária. Recepção, limpeza dos quartos, tamanho do quarto... tudo mto bom! Gostamos e recomendaria este hotel. Cafezinho sempre disponível na recepção.

title: Overall, a nice stay
text:
I got a double room with 2 full sized beds

Pros:
-Room is a decent size for NYC, bathroom is a little cramped but shower is a decent size
-They allowed us to check out an hour after checkout, granted we are HH members
-Close to times square
-Bed is comfortable, just didn't like the sheets, bring your own blanket if you can
-They have water and coffee at the front desk and water bottles and a little shop
-The room had AC/heat
-Curtains keep a decent amount of light from coming in but aren't completely blackout in the top and bottom openings
-Wifi was decent speed

Cons: 
-The sheets you cover yourself with are thin and the top one is heavy so I kept waking up with the top sheet off and being freezing cold.
-Water smells heavily of chlorine so it was hard to rinse my mouth when brushing my teeth
-I was on one of the higher floors and heard sirens throughout the night
-They charge for a mini fridge, our room also didn't have a microwave, maybe it's an electric grid issue to provide that
-Found a hair in my bed that wasn't mine, maybe it was someone's from housekeeping but kinda grossed me out

title: Business Trip
text: This is not a business person's hotel, it's really more of a staging group for international travelers to visit the sites of NY.  Which is completely fine and OK, but just an expectation needed to be reset.

title: Disappointing
text:
While the location is great, my experience was not. The lobby looks new and beautiful, while the rooms are old and tired-- The toilet paper holders hang down broken, the bedside phone was DISGUSTING and looked like someone spilt coffee on it and never cleaned it up.

When I walked into the room, the TV was broken so I called down to the desk. I ultimately got the TV to work, went to call down to tell the front desk and the phone wouldn't work. About half of the time, the phone worked, which from a safety perspective, is very worrisome. 

The night before departure, I confirmed a 1 PM check out with the front desk. The morning of check out, I was woken up at 8:30 AM by housekeeping knocking on my door. This shows me that either the departments at the hotel do not communicate, or they don't care. In a half-asleep rush to get up to tell the housekeeper about my late check out, I stubbed my toe. This was not the sendoff I was expecting from any Hilton property. 

Very disappointing overall.

title: Very good hotel for the price
text:
My husband and I just stayed at this hotel for the second time.
Location is phantastic, allowing us to get to main attractions by food or subway.
Complimentary breakfast is very good, and the hotel offers free bottles of water as well as coffee and tea to all guests.
I have only one important complaint: the breakfast room is too small for the size of the hotel; so, it is usually crowded with no tables available. It is pretty annoying. 
Besides, bedrooms should be a little larger.

title: Good location, nice staff
text:
Good location, nice and friendly staff always available. The only "minus" was to crowded breakfast where we often had to wait for a table or in the lines.
Good rooms, good cleaning and free coffee ;-)

title: Great hotel!
text:
I went with family for a holiday around a week ago for 3 nights in the Hampton inn. It’s an amazing place to stay at with its own breakfast, viewing gallery, business center and shop. We went for breakfast on Tuesday and Thursday and loved it. A highlight was definitely the fresh smoothies and fresh waffles (different flavour choices). However, there are many other things available like cereals, muffins, pastries, omelettes, bacon, fruit and yogurts. The breakfast at Hampton inn is also one of the only in New York you get free. There was a lot more to offer then I was expecting! Throughout the day, the hotel has tea, coffee and ice water machines. There is also “chocolate milk” sachets with something that looks, and tastes, like hot chocolate. At mid-afternoon cookies are put on the reception desk warm and free to take. I would definitely recommend them! Finally, the hotel actually has its own viewing gallery on the roof/ top floor of the building. Unfortunately it was quite foggy when we went up but I’m sure it would look much better on a clearer night. Our room was perfectly sized and had a bath/shower in the bathroom included. Overall, Hampton inn is a lovely place to stay and so close to all the famous landmarks, with some, just less then ten minutes away.
We would definitely stay again if we ever come back to New York!

title: Great location
text: Hotel is located just steps from Times Square.  Hotel staff was very accommodating. Was able to leave our bags day of checkout so we didn’t have to carry them around. Breakfast was adequate but extremely busy. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again

title: Amazing girls holiday!
text:
Where to start...from the moment we checked in here, we were made so welcome. Got a lovely room high up and my niece who had just turned 18 was greeted with a hamper and balloon which we thought was a lovely touch! Our room was always lovely and clean when we came back at the end of the days.
Reception staff can't do enough for you and just so friendly to chat too! 
Breakfast - this was lovely and had lots of choice, the restaurant could be bigger as this was sometimes a problem getting a table.
I have to shout out to Geraldine who was an absolute pleasure !! She helped us out so much with where to go and how to get there, she really is a breathe of fresh air ❤ 
I would like to also add that this isn't advertised but they have free tea, coffee & hot chocolate in the lobby 24hrs and between 5pm - 8pm free cookies that are unreal - we couldn't wait to come by and take advantage of these before heading up to soak our feet. This also saved us alot of money !
We had an awesome time here - me, my mum, sister & niece thank you all so much for the most amazing stay - we will be back one day hopefully!

title: Times Square Hotel
text: What a find, smack bang in the middle of Times Square and Hells Kitchen.  Clean rooms and great service.  Free tea/coffee/snack served daily downstairs.  Organised transport to Airport upgraded to a stretch limousine, great ending to a NYC stay

title: Good location, good staff, poor elevators
text: Good location near Times Sq but away from craziness.  Staff polite and helpful.  Reasonable rates.  Only 3 elevators, not all in service at all times.  Breakfast room too small to accommodate the number of guests.

title: Lovely hotel, excellent location
text: We have just stayed at the Hampton Inn, Times Square for three nights and had a wonderful time. The staff were all very helpful and the room was clean and very comfortable. The location of the hotel is perfect for getting to uptown and downtown New York with sight seeing bus stops on the door step. Only a few steps away is the heart of Times Square, Broadway and Fifth Avenue. The breakfast is fantastic with a good variety on offer to cater for all tastes and the free coffee/tea/hot chocolate in reception is very welcome. We will definitely be booking to stay here again.

title: Pulizia, cordialita' del personale
text: Non fatevi ingannare dalle sole tre stelle e dal costo tutto sommato abbastanza economico per NYC. Ho soggiornato parecchie volte a NYC in hotel a 4 o 5 stelle e ben poche volte ho riscontrato una pulizia, sia nei locali comuni che in camera, pari a quella di questo hotel. Non so indicare un punto negativo, occorre solo un po' di pazienza al mattino per trovare un tavolo per la colazione. Colazione piu' che soddisfacente e varia soprattutto sul dolce, continuamente implementata dagli addetti mentre altro personale, il piu' velocemente possibile, si dedica a pulire i tavoli lasciati liberi.  Oltre al caffe'/tè che ci si puo' preparare in camera, lo troverete  sempre pronto nella hall. Location ottima : stazione metropolitana a due passi, Times Square dietro l'angolo, Bryant Park a due minuti. Un' ultima positivita' : la silenziosita' in camera.

title: 地點是一大優勢
text: 距離時代廣場很近，步行可達，附近機能也相當方便，餐廳、CVS、紀念品店一應俱全，覺得早餐雖不算豪華，但也能滿足簡易所需，房間相當舒適。

title: Central to everything - great breakfast and staff
text:
Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hampton inn times square central.
We had two rooms and would stay again.
Fantastic location - about 30 metres from the Times Square metro/tube station where you can get the 1 train to Central Park or south ferry for the Statue of Liberty or Staten Island ferry. On the 1 line is also canal street area, the 9/11 memorial and upper west side - all very interesting to visit. 
The hotel is also right by Times Square of course for a vast variety of restaurants and fun places like Carlos bakery, Ellen’s diner, juniors and Disney store. It’s a 5 min walk max to port authority bus station and also if you walk down 8th Avenue towards Macy’s it’s a very quick walk and way of getting about downtown. 
The hotel has a great breakfast system in the morning when everyone can just go in and eat. There’s cereals and fruit salad, bagels and smoothies and juice along with toaster, plus the very popular waffle iron. 
The room was quite small to be honest but would stay there again.
The hotel was quite quiet and the lifts quick and reliable. Hate those hotels where the loft takes ages!
The hotel has a roof terrace with good views and it’s a fun addition to the hotel. 
The staff were lovely especially Geraldine who helps with the breakfasts.
The hotel provides free lovely cookies in the reception around 5-7pm.
If you’re visiting NYC for the first time I would recommend the Staten Island ferry - at night or daytime, the top of the rock, walk through Central Park from west side and start around 92 street, the museum of natural history is also great and take a stroll around Grenwich or the east village.
We enjoy food at Ellen’s diner and tick tock diner. The portions are huge so buy a couple and share them.

title: Awesome Experience
text: The location and proximity of the hotel to Time Square, Grand Central Station, and the Theaters made this location a great fit for our trip.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful during all aspects of the stay.  Each morning the complimentary breakfast provided a broad selection to fit our families eclectic tastes.

title: Great all round
text: Just got back from a 3 night stay at this hotel. It is a great location, friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, amazing breakfast and breakfast staff. I would definitely go back here. Rooms were plenty big enough for family of 4 and quiet considering the location. Always managed to get in the lift and always got a table at breakfast but we did tend to go early about 7/7:30am, so much choice even for the pickiest of eaters. They also provide a takeaway breakfast which was bottle of water,apple,muffin and a cereal bar. Free hot drinks available 24/7 in reception and cookies at 5pm. Free WiFi and access to computer and printer. A selection of food/drink items to buy near reception. And not forgetting the amazing view from the small roof terrace. Would highly recommend!

title: PERFECT LOCATION
text:
This hotel was in the perfect location for everything we wanted to do while on vacation. It was walking distance to the theaters we were going to, and we could get any kind of food within a 3-block radius. 

The room was very clean, and the bed comfortable. The shower water pressure was excellent! Breakfasts were the usual fare, with pre-made omelets, waffles, oatmeal, fruit, yogurt, and more. 

I would definitely recommend this spot to anyone who wants to be close to the theater district!

title: Fantastic NYC Hotel
text:
After getting totally confused when booking our hotel for NYC because of the massive amount of hotels available, i picked here due to price and location and boy was i happy i did. Great location, really central to everything, spacious rooms with storage, large shower, we got a room on the 23rd floor so we had a good view of the skyline, fantastic staff who all were so helpful and happy and very clean everywhere. 
I would recommend this hotel to everyone visiting nyc. 
The concierge was really helpful sorting our transfer back to the airport and all other queries we had.
the breakfast is a bit chaotic but thats the guests, not the hotel. good selection of breakfast items available and they have a coffee station thats available 24/7 in the lobby.
i would stay here again next time im back in the city for sure.
the only slight negative are the lifts as they take a while but again thats the volume of guests not the hotels fault.
i forgot a pair of shoes in the bedroom when checking out and when i asked the staff brought them down to me no problems.
great hotel and staff are a credit to the hotel

title: HOME AWAY FROM HOME
text:
Went to NYC for a long weekend for my step-daughters 13yr birthday...  WHAT A BLAST... PERFECT LOCATION... FRIENDLY SERVICE.. TASTY.. HUGE BREAKFAST.. 

Front desk attendants are so helpful.  They have waters and soda's for guests.. along with coffee, tea and water in the lobby.  Cookies (hot from the oven) come out at 5pm-8pm!.  SHOUT OUT TO BENISON at the breakfast Buffett. 

Location was amazing.. we walked everywhere and the subway was across the street. PERFECT for going anywhere on Manhattan. 

ONLY DOWNFALL- ELEVATORS TOOK FOREVERRRRRR!!!!

title: Fantastic hidden gem in the middle of the city!
text: Everything about this hotel was fantastic, from the location to the staff and more. Just around the corner from Times Square and the next street is 42nd street so very handy if going to one of the Broadway shows. The subway entrances are at the end of the street connecting to most lines, and the Empire State, Rockerfeller Centre, 5th Avenue are all within easy walking distance. Complimentary hot drinks and iced water are available at all times in the lobby, along with cookies from 5pm. I didn't expect much from the included breakfast, but it was very good. Juices, smoothies, pastries, fruit, cereals, yoghurts, toast, two hot choices each day (omelet + bacon / scrambled eggs + sausage), and the highlight of our stay - make your own waffles!! This set us up for the day and this plus the lobby drinks saved us a lot of $$. The room was clean, warm and comfortable with a huge bed and we slept well each night, our door was opposite the lift on floor 26 but we didn't hear anyone and the outside road noise was minimal over night. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Great NYC hotel
text: Sat in the lobby now, waiting to go to the airport. This hotel is excellent, on a reasonably quiet street compared to most that are this close to Times Square. The best thing about this hotel is the staff, they do everything with a smile, nothing is too much trouble. We booked via Virgin and had no extra fees to pay. Breakfast included, which is a real bonus here. If 4 of us had to pay for breakfast nearby for 5 days, I reckon it would be 3/400 dollars minimum. Free WiFi too that is pretty decent. A special mention to Geraldine at breakfast, always happy to chat and offer advice.

title: Mrs Evans
text:
Highly recommend this hotel!! Comfy beds, free excellent breakfast lots to choose from. The wonderful Geraldine (breakfast supervisor) made our stay!! She was such a lovely helpful lady with a huge smile for us every morning. We would ask her recommendations for how to get about places in NYC and she was always happy to help. The free warm cookies from 5-8pm and hot drinks were a great touch and brilliant service all round. (I probably ate far too many!) 
Would definitely stay again. 
Thanks Hayley

title: Zimmer-, Flur- Treppen Türen knallen von alleine zu. Das ist sehr störend. Ein Zimmer Wechsel hätte mir nichts gebracht.
text:
Zimmer-, Flur- Treppen Türen knallen von alleine zu. Das ist sehr störend. Ein Zimmer Wechsel hätte mir nichts gebracht, da jede Tür so zu knallt. 
Am frühstücksbuffet wären mir persönlich statt den Waffel Maschinen 1-2 frische Salate lieber. Das einstige was selbst gemacht war, war das Rührei Gekochte Eier und das Obst Salat, falls ich nichts vergessen habe. Überall nur Plastik Geschirr. Insgesamt den Eindruck gehabt, dass das Küchen Personal zeit und Arbeit sparen möchte. Bei so einen teuren Hotel hat mich das sehr geschockt und das erste mal erlebt. 
Am ersten Tag hat die asiatische Mitarbeitern an der Rezeption uns nicht über den rooftop und über den Fitnessstudio informiert. Ihr Text hat sie so schnell vorgesprochen als hätte sie es auswendig gelernt, sogar die Frühstücks Zeit hab ich nicht verstanden. 
Sonst sehr sauberes Hotel, bequeme Betten, sehr freundlich und aufmerksames Personal, genau Deswg hab ich auch so viel Geld bezahlt. Ich entschuldige mich für die negativen Punkten, mit dieser Bewertung möchte ich Gästen helfen und informieren

title: Super recomendo!!!
text: Hotel muito bem localizado; metrô e terminal de trem e ônibus bem próximo. No hall do hotel, chás, chocolate quente, e cookies quentinhos para os hóspedes. Café da manhã bem diversificado (ao contrário do que li nas avaliações, os quentes variam diariamente; o que não troca são os pães - os doces todo dia são diferentes, mas os salgados não.) Sucos, waffles, iogurtes... não tenho o que falar. Além disso, caso você não tenha tempo de tomar café, eles deixam no balcão uma "marmitinha" com um mini café. Quartos confortáveis. Super recomendo!!!

title: Un hôtel à 2 pas de Times Square
text: J’ai réservé cet hôtel pour 1 nuit. Personnel accueillant, sympathique et très disponible. Une chambre à la propreté irréprochable. Et surtout un petit déjeuner au top! Je recommande vivement cet hôtel pour un séjour en famille. Merci!

title: Agréable séjour au Hampton
text: Hôtel très propre, chambre spacieuse pour New York. Nous avons appréciés le petit déjeuner et l'amabilité du personnel. L'emplacement était idéal proche des métros principaux et du terminal de bus ! L'hôtel met à disposition des bouteilles d'eau à demander à la réception et café/ chocolat à disposition à tout moment. La connexion wifi était très bonne et contrairement aux commentaires que nous avons pu voir nous avons jamais du attendre pour le petit déjeuner ou les ascenseurs.

title: Emplacement idéal,très bon hotel
text:
Nous avons séjourné 3 nuits dans cet hôtel.
Il est super bien situé,a 5mn a pied de times square.le personnel est vraiment très accueillant.
Il vous donne des bouteilles d eau a l' accueil.vous disposez tout le long de la journée de café et du thé gratuitement près de l accueil.
Le petit déjeuner est international et il est vraiment bien achalandé.juste petit bémol la salle du petit déjeuner est assez petite mais nous y avons tjrs trouvé de la place pour nous 3.
Le check in s est effectué très rapidement et pareil pour le check out.
Le ménage est fait tjrs les jours dans la chambre.je recommandé vivement cet hôtel pour ceux qui veulent passer un bon moment a New York

title: Best Experience
text: Service was good, rooms were clean and spacious.  Breakfast was excellent. Internet was complimentary but very good. Location was Best. Evening cookies and 24 hours coffee were toppings on the cake. I will surely stay next trip at Hampton Inn.

title: good hotel  beside Time Square
text: We stayed on the 26 floor near that elevator but were not disturbed by noise . We had a lovely room with 2 double beds quiet big room by New York standards with nice view. The bathroom had a bath /shower very clean and lots of fresh towels. The staff in the hotel from housekeeping to reception were all very friendly and efficient. The breakfast in the hotel was excellent with a good selection of food but be early as it tends to fill up quickly . There is coffee iced water tea  facilities  24 hours beside the reception nice touch . It is in a great location close enough to walk to the tourist locations and shopping also just  one block from the port authority bus terminal and subway  stations are nearby.  We had traveled from Ireland for a special significant  birthday celebration for my daughter when the hotel staff discovered this they put a balloon and goodies in the room with a birthday card signed by some of the staff a lovely personal touch and was much appreciated . I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel   will be staying there on my next visit to New York

title: GREAT STAY AND HOTEL
text: Very nice hotel, very clean, staff was great. Excellent location right in Times Square. Continental Breakfast was amazing. Staff offered extra water bottles without hesitation. Food was fresh, eating area was clean. Overall a great one night stay and would recommend for anyone on business travel or family.

title: very good
text: The hotel is in the top spot of central Manhattan, one block from the Times square. We stayed at the 15th floor but we have no front view.The hotel was very clean and the people on the front desk are very polite.The breakfast was satisfying but the period that we were there (Christmas) there were too many people that you had no room to sit and of course only 3 elevators to serve all these people...and of course the price it too high but that's the way it is in Manhattan!!

title: Save yourself a stressful star
text:
I was there two weeks ago with my 4 year old daughter to see a play. I asked the lady at the counter to please not to give me a room by the elevators, that is exactly the room we were given. My poor child barely slept all night from people coming in and out of the elevator. The next day I left my belongings so we could go out and do stuff in the city and when I came back they had lost one of my bags. It took me almost 10 minutes to get someone who could help get y stuff while there were three staff members staring at the computers and talking to each other. I was told by one of them that I had to wait. Then it took another 25 minutes to locate my lost bag. I contacted Hilton and the manager was "NO WHERE TO BE FOUND TO DEAL WITH THIS SITUATION" 
THERE ARE MANY HOTELS  that are the same price in the same location that have outstanding costumer service. SAVE YOURSELF THE AGGRAVATION AND LOOK AND STAY ELSEWHERE. SOMEWHERE WHERE THEY ACTUALLY CARE ABOUT THEIR COSTUMERS.

title: Great stay
text: Great price , location and staff. Room clean and comfy. The front door man John was awesome. He assisted us with all our needs. Transportation from the airport and transportation back to the airport. Will definitely be back!

title: Great hotel, amazing location
text:
Stayed in this hotel at the start of February for 5 nights. I accidentally booked a king assessable room rather than just a king room. I messaged the hotel to let them know but I didn’t hear back. Upon arrival I again told them again (in case anyone required this room) but they confirmed it was ok. Despite this been a mistake it actually worked in our favour, we had one of the biggest rooms in the hotel. 
The hotel offers hot beverages and water 24/7. The hotel charges you around $130 dollar deposit upon arrival and this is refunded on exit (or you can use this to purchase items from the hotel shop). Fresh cookies are left in reception in the evening which was a nice touch. I can’t comment on the breakfast as we didn’t go but I heard other guests say it was good. The hotel is 5 minute walk away from Times Square which was perfect for us, although things are a lot more pricey around this area.

With it been winter we used the subway rather than the open top buses and after a few confusing days, we soon got the hang of it. 

Wolfgang’s steakhouse which is on the same block as the hotel, was amazing!

title: Central to everything
text: Great hotel in the heart of everything. We loved staying here. Before we booked our room here we read a lot of the reviews and how the elevators were slow, I can tell you we did not experience any slow elevators, they have three elevators that are constantly running and were always there within seconds of pushing the button.

title: Great Stay!
text:
We stayed two nights, and were happy with our experience.  The hotel is very conveniently located, and we felt very safe.  The staff is friendly, and you can have cookies each evening.  Our room was small, but clean and quiet, and the bed was comfortable.   We didn't plan to be in the room much anyway. 

As other people have mentioned, the elevators as slow.  Luckily, we were on the 3rd floor so we took the steps when possible.  

The reason I gave 4 stars is the breakfast situation.  It is overwhelming.  There were so many people in that breakfast area.  There were not enough tables.  Some people were standing, and some people (like me) went out and sat at a table in the hotel lobby.  I actually liked it better out there because I was away from the activity of the breakfast room.  The gentleman working the breakfast area was wonderful!  I can't remember his name, but he was very friendly and he worked hard to keep the area clean so that guests could have a place to sit as soon as someone else left.  

FYI, there is a McDonalds just across the street. 

Overall it was a good experience, and I would definitely stay again.

title: Perfect location
text: Wonderful place to stay. Clean and comfortable. The rooms are not large, but this is NYC. Hotel is in the heart of the theater district with many places to dine. Staff was friendly and helpful and the housekeeping was wonderful, as well.

title: Nice hotel
text: It was only a 1 night stay for us. But the hotel was quiet, clean, and well located in times square. One block from the port authority bus terminal which is how we arrived into the city. So it was a short walk to the hotel.  We will stay there again on our next trip to the city.

title: An Amazing Stay! Thank you.
text: "Great Hotel, Great staff, Great location. The staff were very friendly and made me feel very welcome. Our room had an amazing view on Emipre State Building. Breakfast was very good with a good variety. Unlimited Coffee was fab, so tasty! It was a just a few meters to Time Square. It was nice and clean and the lady who cleaned was so friendly. I had such a lovely time I would go back there any time and look forward to."

title: Great Location
text: Great location--nice hotel experience. The room was small but clean. Had coffee maker and safe. Just off Times Square. Do not get an accessible room unless you really need it-- shower was quite confusing. Staff extremely friendly and helpful!

title: Great Hotel!
text:
We picked this hotel because we were meeting friends for dinner in the Broadway Theatre district.  The location is excellent, plenty to see and do right in the neighborhood.  Also the subway is just down the street and I was able to get a train right to SoHo. 
People who work at the hotel are very friendly, the room was nice, very clean and the bed was comfortable.  Excellent shower!

title: Great location with friendly service
text: This surpassed our expectations. The room/bathroom were sparkling clean and although the room was small with two queen beds, we still had room for a suitcase stand, two chairs, desk, etc. I especially appreciated the friendliness and genuine helpfulness of all the staff. We found the breakfast a bit crowded at times, but the buffet included both hot and cold foods, eggs, fresh waffles, bacon, etc.  Better than your usual free breakfast buffet, and there was always a place to sit. We were there in "off" season, so no idea what it might be like in busier times.

title: Great location, staff, accommodations, and price
text: This hotel had everything we could possibly ask for.  We were a birthday girl from Brooklyn, her mother from Vermont, and her grandmother from South Carolina, all converging at this hotel to celebrate this family birthday.

title: Great Value
text: Comfortable and clean. Could have used a few more towels but not a big deal. No bathtub in my room- but some may have- not sure. Great breakfast! Fantastic location if you want to be near the theatres.

title: A good time sampling food, the breakfast each morning. The friendly spirit,  assistance, support and help.
text: Looking back on this four day experience what an adventure. Staff friend.y, front desk patience, breakfast on time and plenty gor all. The location of the hotel is excellent for plays and tours.  It is an experience that Cafol and I sillneverforget

title: Very pleasant, friendly, clean
text: The stay at your hotel was spectacular.  I especially enjoyed interacting with the very friendly staff.. there were several instances (I can recall at least three) where the staff was very polite, respectful and compassionate.  In general, I would give your staff a solid A+.  The facilities were well maintained as well.. very comfortable room.  Breakfast was off the charts.  Definitely a fantastic value and I will return!

title: Es un hotel muy cercano a Central Park, un desayuno buenísimo y unas habitaciones espectaculares
text:
El hotel es una maravilla, el trato excelente y las vistas una pasada. Además tienen un destino de cortesía buenísimo y las habitaciones son grandes.
La limpieza es constante y tienes canales de pago así como salas comunes para conocer a gente

title: Great value
text:
Great location.  Most subway lines within a few steps.  Elevators very busy from 9am.  Stayed on the 6th floor and had to walk down during busy morning hours.
Complimentary breakfast is good with eggs and breakfast meat.  
Overall great value for money.

title: Value for $$
text: Clean, comfortable rooms in a five-star location.  Close to subways, theater, and the Port Authority terminal, this reasonably-priced hotel offers an alternative to more expensive places.  Free hot breakfast includes waffles and a range of foods...They also offer a bag breakfast snack.

title: Excellent location and very clean hotel
text:
Just come back from a fantastic 5-night stay at the Hampton Inn, Times Sq Central. We were given a room on the 26th floor (think the hotel has 30/31 floors) room big enough, big comfy bed, the view was ok, could see Empire state building from the room (south side), very clean hotel and really friendly staff. 

Only downsides were breakfast, it could get really busy. Plenty of options to choose from but you need to get down before 7 am / 7.30 am to enjoy as it gets way to busy after 8 am/8.30 am and you'd be lucky to find a table. There was often nowhere to sit and people would overspill to the lobby, the other thing that spoilt it a little was that plastic cutlery, paper plates and cups were supplied.....I think the hotel is better than this. 

The second downside was in our room - the toilet door (not sure if this was just our room though as we were based by the fire exit and it could have been to save space), it was a sliding door and didn't offer much privacy as there was a gap of about an inch around the door. No one mentioned where to find ice (which can be found on the 11th floor). This would have been useful information during check-in or when purchasing drinks from the lobby shop (which is only small but good enough). Deposit of a $100 was requested but there are no resort fees. Free wifi which is always great. Hairdryer supplied which was excellent for a hotel one, there's no need to bring your own. Neutrogena products supplied daily i.e. shampoo/conditioner/soap etc. Room cleaned daily. Free cakes/cookies, tea/coffee and water at the reception area. 

Overall I would highly recommend the Hampton Inn. Concierge service downstairs who can help with subway links if needed or reservations, theatre tickets etc. Hotel location is excellent. Times Square subway is at the end of the street and Times Square is only a block away which is about 3 min walk. Would definitely stay again.

title: Fijn, ruim en perfecte locatie
text:
Vriendelijk personeel, ruime kamers voor New York doende en een perfecte locatie. 
Ontbijt (07:00 - 10:00) was goed te doen, kon je hierbij niet aanwezig zijn stond er bij de bali een zakje met water en wat te eten om mee te nemen.

title: CP值超高
text: 非常棒！大廳提供24小時的冷熱飲和開水，免費早餐很豐盛，酒店位置超好，步行可至許多著名景點，即使夜晚也很熱鬧，下次有機會一定會再入住。

title: Excellent in every respect
text: I selected the Times Square Central based on location, ratings, and rate.  Everything about the stay was excellent - and that's not an easy rating to get from me.  To a person, everyone was friendly and helpful.  Room size was plenty big - king bed, desk, chair, closet.  Location a couple blocks from Times Square, across the street from the Times Square subway station.

title: Weekend Family Get Away
text: We had a great time at the Hampton Inn.  It was in the perfect location for taking in a play and dinner.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  I had purchased a bottle of wine and asked the front desk for glassware .  Drinking wine from a paper cup was not desirable.  It was late at night and one reception at the front desk over heard me talking with another receptionist who didn’t think that they had glassware.  A few minutes after I got back to my room.  They brought up glasses to my room.  It was much appreciated.

title: Nice property, customer service could improve.
text:
We chose this hotel to be near the theatre where we were seeing a show.  The property is clean and updated.  The rooms are small, but we expected that in the city.  

There was a bit of a wait to check in.  I observed many people ahead of me while waiting.  I noticed that, unlike other couples, we did not receive two bottles of water though we are Hilton Honors members for years.   The staff was not particularly friendly.  They explained nothing, did not invite questions, etc.  I had to ask about the key cards and breakfast.  We did not realize that the room card was required for the elevator but quickly figured it out.  Fortunately, we knew where we were going in the city.
  
The breakfast area, though large, was packed with people.  There was a good variety of items.  I was looking for an empty table.  When I found one, I had to wipe it off myself.  

There was coffee and tea in the lobby as well as the breakfast room.  

Generally, this is a nice, modern property and a good location.   I think a little more effort on the part of desk staff would go a long way in making this an even better location.

title: Excellent Service in a Great Location
text: Couldn't have been more pleased when staying at this hotel with a large group. Staff was very accommodating of our early arrival and offered friendly, timely service during our stay. Located in the Times Square area, this hotel is on a quieter side street. Very convenient without all the lights. Highly recommend.

title: Really great hotel in NYC.
text:
This is my second trip to New York, and we were offered this hotel as part of our package, or the same we stayed at last time.  We choose this hotel, and I’m glad we did.  The rooms are nice and modern, the bathroom is huge.  They have an observation deck on the roof which offers great views of the city, and it’s in a great location, close enough to walk to the tourist locations and shopping.  Free WiFi was included with our room.  You also get a complimentary breakfast everyday.  The breakfast is a very good value, with either scrambled eggs or omelettes, sausage or bacon as hot food, plus make your own waffles.  Also oatmeal and cereal, smoothies, juice, fruit, toast.  The coffee is also quite good.  I am going to nitpick and say that breakfast is REALLY crowded, and sometimes a wait for a table, plus it’s all paper plates, cups, plastic cutlery, so I’m really hoping the hotel is actively recycling this because the bins were full each and every day.  Also every day they have a coffee bar in the lobby which you can help yourself to.  
My only other complaint is the elevators, which were incredibly busy, always full, and we ended up taking the stairs quite regularly, which is fine on the 6th floor but I’m certain someone on the 31rst floor might disagree.  Overall this is a really great location and a really great value.

title: Great Place
text: The staff is personable and professional. The rooms are very clean and the breakfast is great. If your looking for large rooms don’t come to NYC but our room was fine for two people. Will stay here again.

title: Clean, great location
