text: Great location in the theater district. Not far from the heart of Times Square. Hotel lobby is clean, attractive, nicely decorated. The double room we stayed in was also clean, nice decor, comfortable beds but the pillows....oh my they were FANTASTIC! Most staff were friendly and welcoming, others made it obvious they would rather not be there. The free breakfast was standard but the dining area is very small and crowded given the size of the hotel. If they offer a lower floor vs a higher, I’d recommend lower as the elevators are rather busy at times. The price is great given it’s NYC. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location!
text: We booked here for 4 nights as it was our first time visit to NYC and the states we wanted to be somewhere central to get around and see the main sights. The hotel staff were very welcoming, we were on the 22nd floor. Rooms are small but they have everything you need in them. The reception area has water, tea and coffee which you can help yourself to anytime. Breakfast is busy theres a good selection of foods waffles, cereal, hot food etc. We weren't fussed about breakfast and most days we ate elsewhere. It does get busy during peak times 8-10am where there are people waiting to find a table to breakfast area isnt big enough for the amount of people at the hotel! The location is brilliant within walking distance of Times Square and Broadway.

title: Sehr gutes Hotel zu angemessenem Preis
text:
Die Ausstattung und Lage sind wirklich gut und bieten ein gutes Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis. Ich traf auf sehr freundliche und hilfsbereite Mitarbeiter.
Einziger Nachteil ist das Einweggeschirr beim Frühstück.

title: Great Location
text:
Stayed three nights and thoroughly enjoyed the location with all the hustle and bustle of Times Square.This hotel is quite modern and updated.  The positives - the staff are all friendly and very helpful.  The room was very clean, modern and comfortable.  The breakfast was more than adequate.
Now for a few negatives - the room was very small (not unusual for a NYC hotel) but the king size bed was too big for the space making it very difficult to walk around the bed.  There was a coffee maker in the room but the one and only outlet available was in the bathroom (ugh!). The wifi was sporadic. 
The negatives aside, it still was an enjoyable stay.

title: Great hotel in the heart of times square with easy access to Subway station
text: Great hotel with comfy beds. Staff were great. Easy access to shows, Subway, and all Times Square has to offer. Parking was cheapest we found with any hotel. We will.definitely book here again. Breakfast was the only neutral thing but it was complimentary and served it's it's purpose.

title: Excellent choice in theater district
text: I stayed here with my 12-year-old son when we came to NYC to see Harry Potter and the Cursed Child.  I selected this hotel due to the location, the price plus my history in staying at other Hampton Inns, and we were very pleased with our choice.  The room was nice; the breakfast was good; and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  There was a nice lobby area to hang out and charge phones when we arrived too early to check into our room and had some time to kill.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: ロケーションは最高です
text: タイムズスクエア駅から歩いてすぐの好立地です。周辺にはブロードウェイの劇場やタイムズスクエアなどの観光地もあり、食事や買い物にも困りません。ホテルで提供する朝食も無料なのにかなり充実ていまし、朝6時から料金出来るので早めの予定があっても便利です。ロビーに置いてあるコーヒーはいつでも飲めます。部屋は広くはありませんが寝るには充分です。ただ、バスルームの配水がなかなかされなかったのでそれだけが欠点でした。

title: Excelente Servicio
text: Excelente ubicación y muy buen precio para la calidad del servicio. El personal es amable y tiene muy buen trato con los huéspedes. Cerca de Times Square, Bryan Park, la estación del metro y de Port Authority

title: First Trip to New York and Hampton Inn Didn’t Disappoint
text: This was our first New York experience and Hampton Inn was just as we expected...clean, friendly, helpful and a great location. Benson who worked in the breakfast area was the most courteous person we encountered on the trip.

title: Really liked this hotel!
text: We spent a long weekend at this Hampton Inn and enjoyed it immensely. All of the staff are super friendly and greeted us with big smiles from front desk to breakfast staff. Room for four with two double beds was adequate. Elevators are a bit slow during peak periods. Breakfast selections are plentiful. Hotel lobby was cozy and a great place to crash. We had pizza dinner with my family and daughter’s friend. This is our new “to go” place in NYC. Very clean and highly recommended. Location is in the middle of all of the action half a block away. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Great Location
text: We stayed for 4 nights in December...………… we had 3 adults in a room which could take 4 - however, it felt very small but I was assured by the manager that this was typical of all New York rooms.  The beds are doubles (rather than king) pushed to the side so access to both beds is through a narrow channel (the width of the bedside cabinet) between the two beds.  We found this to be very close for 3 adults (although we are all family!) and it did impair our stay at this hotel.  I asked if we could move but was told all rooms are the same sleeping area size (some entrance halls a little larger when placed next to a lift).  Anyway, just so you are aware if you are regular sized adults, it's tight for sharing!!!  We booked a Hampton as the breakfast is included - and it was breakfast and the breakfast service that we all enjoyed!  Geraldine, the Irish breakfast manager, was amazing.  And as much as she ran a tight ship in the restaurant (ie all foods were available, plentiful and the serving areas and tables were very clean and swiftly cleared), her natural warmth and enthusiasm for New York really helped us get the most from our stay.  We so enjoyed meeting her - and found her to be the friendliest and most helpful person in the whole of New York City - she is an absolute asset to this hotel.  New York itself was a great experience - highlights included a visit to Intrepid aircraft carrier and the Ground Zero museum - both 3 hour visits which flew by!

title: Recent stay
text:
We arrived after a quick check in at JFK.  Check in was quick and easy.  The room was plenty big enough for 3 people any more and it would be a squeeze.  Beds were very comfy and the air conditioning was very useful.  It was 18 degrees whilst we were there so needed it to cool the room down.  Geraldine in the breakfast room was fantastic going over and above.  She brought us cold water as soon as she saw us.  She was fantastic.  

Loved the location and would definitely stay again.

title: Shows and museums
text: Stayed at the Hampton Inn in Manhattan-Times Square North. We enjoyed our stay with a nice start to our day with a nice complimentary continental breakfast. The location was close to Broadway and one street away to a Subway station. The room was approximately $155 a night for 4 nights. The room was clean with a comfy bed, but the bathroom is on the small size. We plan on taking a return trip in two months for some more excitement and most likely will stay at the same location.

title: Great location
text: Excellent location and the hotel is clean and comfortable. Would stay here again.  Breakfast is the standard Hampton Inn breakfast, but with helpful staff and well supplied.  Area was clean and not overly crowded

title: great place
text: The location was perfect, cleanliness,  the price has not competition and great attention.  This hotel is Highly recommended. Also the Place looks great, and  free breakfast was really good, plenty food and space

title: Great Location
text: This is a fairly average New York hotel room, but the location is amazing,  the staff was very helpful and the free breakfast and wifi are a definite bonus.  We were very comfortable and enjoyed our 4 night stay.

title: Great hotel in fab location
text: We have just returned from 5 nights in New York 2 adults and our 2 sons 11 and 13. We picked this hotel becsuse of its location which did not disappoint. Check in was quick and easy, 24 hour coffee and hot chocolate was great. Free WIFI which is a must with children. Breakfast was great, good choice and all fresh with 2 hot options everyday our eldest son loved the waffles. Breakfast can get busy at peaks time but we never had a problem.Geraldine the breakfast superviser is a gem, and looked after us every morning. Our room was great 2 double beds very comfortable, TV, coffee maker and hairdryer.Bathroom was good, shower and bath, plenty of towels for family of 4. Also safe in room. Penn station was just a few blocks away and was great to catch Airtrain back to JFK and alot cheaper than Taxi. Madison Square Gardens also few blocks away from Hotel and if you can catch a Knicks game I recommend it, be warned a beer is 16 dollars!!. We had alot planned for our time In New York and the location of the hotel was ideal , it would of been nice if the hotel had a Bar and a Fridge in the room.

title: NYC
text:
Staff friendly and helpful
Breakfast supervisor wonderful.....my granddaughter has a milk allergy and the staff was very helpful in providing us with substitutions.
Conceire John wonderful suggestions of where to dine
Location Amazing
Super close to Times Square
You MUST see the Lion King.  go directly to the ticket office at the theater close to show time to get a good deal on the tickets

title: il miglior hotel provato sin ora a NYC
text:
Nonostante le 3 stelle questo è il miglior hotel provato sin ora a NYC.
Posizione eccellente, staff cortese, camere ottime.
Un solo piccolo appunto: la colazione, quella salata, dovrebbe essere un po più varia, del resto tutto perfetto.
Acqua, tea, caffè, cioccolata calda e biscotti sempre a disposizione dei clienti e questa ' una vera chicca!

title: Great location but...
text: Rooms are very small and don't provide a mini fridge for drinks or medication.  Heating system in our room was broken.  One of the days we were gone from 10:30 am to 9:30 pm and did not receive housekeeping service.

title: Very nice
text:
Super nice stay, very good emplacement, clean room, beautiful view. We really enjoyed our stay it was only for night, which we could’ve stay longer. 
Couldn’t enjoy the breakfast, maybe it would be better if it lasted longer

title: NYC at Christmas
text: We were in NYC for the Christmas season and to see the Pittsburgh Steelers play the New York Jets.  This hotel was a fantastic place to stay.  Front Desk staff and the Breakfast employees were helpful and friendly.  Clean and bright hotel.  The location is great.  Subway a few steps out the door.  Walking distance to many attractions.  We will be back the next time we are in NYC.  Thank you!!!

title: Great location and service
text: My family stayed at this hotel for a quick 2 nights gateway to New York City. This hotel was very conveniently located near Times Square, so we could come back any time we wanted a quick rest or change clothes before/after the Broadway show. Elevators were slow to come and the breakfast area was very busy, but that was just a minor inconvenience comparing to the great location.

title: Outstanding location, excellent value
text:
Our family of five stayed in two connecting rooms. 

The unbeatable feature of this property is its location: on the edge of Times Square, half a block from the subway stop. You can walk into the Square any time day or night and it's active (there's a Walgreens a block away that never closes). The hotel isn't cheap, but given the location it's a great value.

Others have complained about the elevators. This could be a concern: There are only three elevators serving 30+ floors. But the elevators are VERY fast, and we never found ourselves waiting for more than a few minutes.

Breakfast is adequate---not Club Med, but everyone can find something. (Geraldine was particularly helpful to us.) There's coffee/water available 24/7 and this was a real plus.

It was also great to have a laundry facility on-property. Easy to use with soap available for purchase.

We were worried about noise but it wasn't really a factor on the 20th floor.

title: Great location to everything!!!
text: The hotel was in the perfect location, right in Times Square. It was close to the subway, restaurants and shopping. We easily got around to the sights we wanted to visit. The staff was very friendly even with all the rush of New Year's Eve.

title: Great Service
text: Yeah, they made a few mistakes (gave us a room that housekeeping was finishing, forgot to give us hand towels) but the staff were fabulous! Everyone we encountered from front desk personnel to housekeeping to food services made us feel like our comfort was important to them. We’ll be back. Thank you all.

title: Fab hotel
text: Stayed for 3 nights beginning of December. Couldn’t fault the hotel at all. Clean room with comfy beds, fabulous breakfast and in a great position. I’d stay here again in a heartbeat. Well done to all the staff

title: Great for the price
text: My husband, our two 20-something daughters and I stayed here December 25th-29th. We had a great experience. Having stayed at another hotel in June, we were expecting a small room. The room was not much different from a typical Hampton Inn anywhere, We were on the 10th floor directly beside an elevator and pleasantly surprised at how quiet our room was. The location is perfect. We went everywhere from The MET to The statue of Liberty. Easy walking distance to Broadway shows, restaurants and subway. The breakfast was exactly what you find at other Hamptons:  waffles, a few hot breakfast items, fruit and cereal. I was very impressed with the breakfast staff, particularly Benson and David. They greeted us with a smile each morning and hustled to make sure everything was replenished. The only disappointments we had were that a refrigerator is not standard (seems to be a NYC thing) and that the comforters slid off the beds easily during the night. Small things. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Great location/Complimentary Food and Drink
text:
You can't beat this location for the typical tourist activities.  Right across from the subway and so many places within walking distance.  Walked to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, 5th Ave, Bryant Park, Central Park, Macy's, and so many restaurants.  

Room Location - Since I was bringing my family of 4 there for 5 day over Christmas, I did a lot of research on room location.  I had called and asked several questions as well.  So I was ready to pick my room the day before through online checkin.  I picked a room and called to make sure it met my needs.  After being told by 2 different workers that the layout of the "03" rooms is the best I felt great about my choice.  I got a confirmation that we were checked in to this room.  However, when we physically arrived, they had us in a different room.  When I questioned the lady, she made up a lie and said that since we requested a refrigerator, we can't have that room because a refrigerator cannot go in that room.  This seemed crazy since the lady that helped me pick that room said that it would be great for a refrigerator.  After pressing this a bit she got a manager and he said that the person never checked out of that room, so we couldn't have it.  Strange since it usually only lets you do online checkin after there person had checked out.  I assume they just gave it to someone else and were making up excuses.  This started our stay off on a bad note.
We ended up in 2212 (which of course they assured was a superb room.  It was facing 41st street, which is not what I wanted for street noise.  The good news is that the street noise was not as bad as I expected.  We are night-owls so the noise seemed to calm down when we were asleep.  You could hear things, but we ran the fan on constant and used a white noise machine.  

Elevators - As noted on many reviews, you can wait 10-15 minutes at times.  I would say either stay super low so you can use stairs, or super high.  For getting a down elevator, the elevator always goes to the highest floor first and then stops at every floor requested on the way down.  So the poor folks on floors lower than 20 got passed up all of the time because the elevator was always full.  I felt really bad for those with full luggage carts who could not take the stairs.  We only had issues a few times since we were usually leaving the building after busy checkout time.  

Breakfast - As noted on many reviews it is a zoo.  It is a great perk that they offer this, but you need to have an incredible amount of patience to get your food.  People are going in all directions and cut in front of you and bump you.  The should re-design this room to have one long buffet bar going down he middle with access from both sides.  The pinch points in the corners is awful.  The last few days I just grabbed a "To-Go" bag and ate in my room.  These bags are a great perk as well (small water bottle, apple, Nutri-grain bar, muffin).  The staff that works this are great though.  Always there to help.  They will get you a banana if you ask for one!

Lobby - Busiest lobby I have ever seen.  It is small and so many people getting the free water/tea/coffee and waiting for rides or to check in.

Front Desk - As mentioned above, we did not have a good checkin experience.  Also, they assured us at check in that the refrigerator we requested for medical reasons was already in the room.  It was not and never came.  We had to call concierge to get it delivered.  A few other times during our stay we asked the front desk for extra towels.  They never came either, so we had to call concierge.  

Activities Planner/Helper - They have someone to answer questions and help with planning for a part of the day.  They were very helpful!  A nice perk!

Rooms - Very clean and look to be recently updated.  They are NYC small, but clean is so important and I have no complaints with that.

title: First time visit to NYC
text: Treated my family to a 4 day trip to see Christmas in New York. The only good thing about the hotel is right in Times Square. Otherwise everything else was not worth the exorbitant price! Very disappointed

title: FANTASTIC 3RD TRIP TO NEW YORK
text:
My wife and I spent our third trip to New York at this fantastic hotel for six nights..
Friendly helpful staff with breakfast included in your price, along with freshly baked cookies, hot tea & coffee in reception. There is also a complimentary newspaper, if your quick enough.
Our room was spacious enough for the two of us. There was also complimentary toiletries which were replaced everyday once used as well as fresh towels.

The breakfast seating area we found was always busy but people were coming and going all the time so we hardly had to wait to sit down.The breakfast itself was varied with different cooked options everyday.

Some of the earlier revues mentioned delays with the three elevators but we didnt have a problem.

All in all a very nice stay which we fully recommend

title: great location with friendly staff
text: Stayed here over Christmas.  The location was excellent- next to Times Square, Broadway and Bryant Park yet on a quiet street. Most other tourist attractions are within a 15 minute walk but with the option of the subway close by. Free breakfast was available and enough to start the day off.  Staff were friendly upon arrival and throughout our stay. On our last day they even helped us with getting transportation to the airport. The hotel was overall clean and inviting.  The only glitch is the slow elevators during peak time but because we weren't too high up, we took the stairs.  Would stay here again.

title: Great location and hotel
text: We’ve stayed in New York many times and due to a last-minute getaway this was one of the options available on Christmas then also looked close to the tourist activities.    The rooms were great nice size free coffee and hot chocolate at all hours in the lobby as well as a coffee pot in the room. The breakfast was perfect and I will say the location was amazing. Right next to a theaters and there’s a walk through McDonald’s or the Hilton across the street to 42nd St. where more of the action is as well as the red bus. It was literally 3 1/2 blocks straight down to Bryant Park which was incredible and a quick walk to the Macy’s area.  Great job from a diamond member

title: Great location!
text: Great hotel for our first visit to NYC! We love Hampton Inn’s, this hotel is in a great location, staff was friendly, clean rooms. Breakfast was wonderful, nice seating areas in the lobby to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the city with a complimentary cup of coffee,hot chocolate, tea or water (& warm cookies at certain times!)

title: Celebrating my 70th birthday
text: I stay in hotels around the world. I definitely recommend this Hampton as my very favorite in New York Times Square. Just a couple of blocks from the heart of Times Square. Walking distance to Radio City, Rockefeller, Empire State Bldg, Macy's, shopping, etc. The service is spectacular. Front desk Rachelle would satisfy your every need. I received the highest possible floor, with a very nice view. The front desk provides the clients with complimentary water, snacks and sodas at all times. The breakfast was superb, hot and you could even take food to your room. Geraldine and Benson were on top of all your eating desires. You can tell they love their clients. The doormen were also fabulous, always making sure that if you were in a tour, they would come and get you in the lobby right away. Joseph was checking on us all the time. They made my birthday stay very special. Thanks Rachelle and staff.

title: Excellent hotel.
text: The hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly! I would recommend this particular Hampton Inn over some other ones I have stayed at in NYC. We even had trouble with one of the heaters and they sent someone immediately and it was fixed in 5-10 minutes! Incredible service

title: POOR FRONT DESK SERVICE
text: The Checking In Person kept asking for my ID.I said please look my room up while i get it , .she kept asking for it. .finally she said would you like someone else to help you?I said yep,im a diamond for life at hilton and know what to expect at Hilton ,Hampton inns,Not that!Then breakfast on Sataurday which was only till 10AM.the hotel was sold out that night so went I went to breakfast at 9:30am There Were 20 People On Line With No Seats! I went to the front desk and the rep said you can  sit in the lobby and eat like the others.I said no thank you!It was 20 degrees outside and the and the outside doors kept opening ,also people had to hold their plates on their laps to eat also.So I went to Mcdonalds across the street! Rude staff!

title: Great hotel in Times Square!
text: The Hampton Inn in Times Square was perfect!  Hotel staff were kind and accommodating and made a misunderstanding between booking site and actuality ok.  Stored something I needed which was why I booked the hotel to begin with.  Complimentary breakfast was amazing.  Would definitely go back.

title: The name says it all. Great "central" location. Excellent service without the sticker shock.
text:
I stayed here with my daughter for 3 nights on a business trip and was very pleased with the property and the customer service. The lobby is welcoming and the staff is attentive. The full breakfast buffet was good. Plenty of options and open 6-10am. They even make my daughter scrambled eggs at her request (the bar had omelettes and hard boiled). 

Benson and David were excellent: friendly and on top of cleaning/turning over tables in the very busy dining area. Our first room developed a smell once we turned on the heat, so they graciously moved us to another one. The rooms were clean and comfortable. It's close to everything - walk right out ton Times Square around the block. This is a hotel we will definitely return to for an affordable stay in NYC. Not a luxury property, but the service makes it feel like one.

title: Great location and staff
text: We arrived in Newark airport and were able to catch the Express Bus for $17 each to the Port Authority Bus Station, one and half block from hotel! Check in was fast and easy even though there were so many people. Kris, at the front desk was so welcoming, was the whole four nights we were there. Great recommendation on where to eat--Tony's on 43rd. Everything is so close to walk or catch subway across the street or halfway down the block. Morning breakfast buffet was great and had variety of everything. Benson was so nice even though he was working the whole place to clean up by himself, great smile! Patrick's just one street over had great food also. Even our housekeeper on the 20th floor was amazing, always a smile and hello plus have a great day. Staff was just so helpful with only one exception and that was the female conceirge with long gray hair---we asked about places to eat and she said "I wouldn't recommend any of the local places, couldn't think of anything around us to go to....????? we caught subway and bus back to LaGardia airport---again so worth the metrocard ticket. Subway took us to 9/11/ Museum of Art and was so quick. Room was good size for NYC and bathroom was great. Everything was VERY clean.Will stay there when we return!!! Best experience.

title: Nice room, friendly staff, great location
text: Free warm cookies! The room was modern, updated and very clean. I would recommend this hotel to travelers staying in the Times Square / theater district of New York City. You can control the heat or cooling with a digital thermostat.

title: Great hotel in Times Square
text:
Clean rooms and friendly staff. Good variety of breakfast items to choose from.  
I would stay again. Location is great and subway to Chelsea on 41st is 4 mins. There is no view of Times Square at this location.

title: Extremely satisfied
text: Excellent best kept secret. We were very happy from the get go with this property from check in, valet, breakfast and check out. We will continue to use this property for future visits. Easy access to so many places.

title: An oasis in the midst of the overcrowded holiday streets of NYC
text: Hampton Inn rarely disappoints, and this was no exception.  From the moment of our arrival we were completely relieved from the stress and bustle of the streets of NY in the holiday season.  Our car was quickly whisked away by a friendly valet, and we our reserved room was ready for check-in earlier than normal.  We had a King on a lower floor and the room was exactly as expected, plus it was very quiet.  Breakfast was incredible: considering they serve some 700 people each morning this time of year, we had no trouble finding a seat and the buffet was well-managed and clean.  We would definitely return to this hotel.

title: New York Visit
text: Great hotel and it is in the best location to see everything.  Highly recommend this property. it is near lots of places to eat and very near the subway if you don't want to walk.  Loved that it is near the theater section of town.  Great place to stay.

title: Yes, really . . . all categories 5 stars !
text: Amazingly courteous, friendly and professional staff. Hotel is clean and efficient. Very well run. Room was quiet and well appointed. For the price and great location you just can't do any better. We'll be back. Thanks !

title: Great place to stay!
text: I totally recommend this hotel! Everything was top notch! So easy to get around the city from this location. Everyone was kind and courteous! Food good! Service great! Location perfect! Could not have asked for anything more!

title: review
text: Not the best value for the money.  Rooms are small, price was high. extremely crowded at breakfast and wait times for elevators were long.  Rooms and bathroom were clean. Staff was friendly but easily confused.

title: Girl Family Vacation to New York
text: Loved your employees and care we received.  Breakfast was delicious but crowded.  Beds small for us as we had seven adults and teenagers.  Location a little far for Grandma but ok for everyone else.  Overall, we love New York

title: Great Base for First Visit to NYC
text: Very close walk to all midtown locations, subway one block away that gets you just about anywhere in the city in 15 minutes or less. Lobby is small but functional, elevators were faster than expected for only 3 servicing 32 floors. Coffee/hot chocolate at all times, cookies in the afternoon/evening. Breakfast was plentiful and good, area does get crowded. Entire staff was great!! Room was small, but no issues. Shower pressure lacks.

title: Great location!
text:
Location was great!  Walkable
To Bryant Park, Times Square, and many other sights and restaurants.   Rooms are sort of small, but are clean and attractive. We ate the breakfast one morning and it was fair.   Large selection though.  Service was great. Everyone was super friendly and helpful!

title: ambiente cordiale con personale preparato
text: camera spaziosa,pulizia giornaliera con cambio biancheria bagno,colazione più che discreta ,ma si consiglia di scendere entro le 8 per trovare tavoli liberi,bevande calde e fredde a disposizione 24ore su 24,personale preparato e molto disponibile.

title: Harry Connick Jr Show
text: The Hampton Inn Times Square Central is a great location to all theaters, and next door to Nederlander!  Very clean and comfortable. The beds are really nice, and great city views from our room.  The staff was very attentive and polite.  All together a great experience and I highly recommend!

title: Super Hotel mit Frühstück inmitten der City!
text:
Ich war eine Woche geschäftlich hier. Schönes sauberes Hotel, die Zimmer sind geräumig und sauber. Kostenloses W-LAN, in der Lobby gibt es den ganzen Tag kostenlos Getränke (Wasser, Kaffee, Tee) und das Hotel bietet Frühstücksbuffet an. Was auch sehr gut war. Die Lage des Hotels ist auch super, man ist mittendrin in der City. 
Auch das Personal ist sehr freundlich. Kurzum, ich würde jederzeit wieder kommen.

title: Great Location, Nice Hotel Stay
text: I stayed at the hotel with my pre-teen daughter for a long weekend to take in the NYC holiday experience. We stayed on the 30th floor (#3004) and had an issue with wind whistling through the room and light coming in due to short curtains, but the manager has assured me that the issues will be resolved. The hotel is clean and is located close to a lot of attractions and subway stations. The morning breakfast buffet offers plenty of options, even for finicky kids, and all of the staff in the breakfast room was outstanding. I wish we would have selected a room with a bathtub in order to soak my feet after walking so much, but that is on me. Having all-day coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby was a great feature given how cold it was outside.

title: Excellent property, exceptional staff
text: Excellent property, exceptional staff.  They really make you feel welcome at this Hampton Inn in Manhattan.  The property is well-kept and spotless.  The staff is so nice and very helpful.  You can't lose staying here while in NY.

title: Great location
text: There is a very warm and welcoming to the hotel and the staff are amazing. Really appreciated complementary cookies, coffee, tea and drinking water that was provided 24/7, Hotel is within walking distance to Macy's, Radio City and Rockefeller centre plus 2min walking distance to Port Authority and all other main city attractions. breakfast was included which offers various options from day to day, Plus Geraldine the breakfast supervisor and all her breakfast team couldn't do enough for you, Only fault was that on the day we were to check out the housekeeping staff kept knocking to early before we had to check-out  at 12.00, Over all exceptional experience and wonderfully stay, Myself and Mam would definitely stay again hopefully Thanksgiving 2020

title: Great location and clean hotel
text: The location of this hotel is great, just 3 mins away from Times Square. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. Free breakfast is provided to all though options are limited for vegetarians. Really appreciated that coffee, tea and drinking water was provided 24/7. A refrigerator in the room would be a nice addition.

title: Outstanding hotel
text: This hotel has everything you want and more. There is a very warm and welcoming feel to this hotel and the staff are amazing. I would like to give Geraldine, the breakfast supervisor a special mention, she went out her way to make sure everyone had everything the needed. The breakfast buffet was amazing, something to suit everyone. The location of this hotel is perfect, everything within walking distance. We have stayed in some of the larger hotels in Times Square but this hotel knocks spots of them. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, you won’t be disappointed.

title: Very accommodating
text: I enjoyed our stay. Staff were extremely helpful. Rooms were clean and breakfast was a great variety. Valet parking mad it extremely easy to park. Guest were able to warm up with hot chocolate coffee.  The fitness center was wonderful.

title: Great time at a great hotel!
text: We decided at the last minute to go to NY to see the parade on Thanksgiving Day so we flew up early on Tuesday morning and left New York on Thursday after the parade.  It was a pretty hectic schedule with my wife wanting to look at the Christmas displays in all of the store windows but the one constant was the hotel.  The room was clean and the staff was very nice throughout our stay.  The front desk stored our bags until our room was ready and then stored them after we checked out (they gave us late checkout, too, so ask if you need it) until our shuttle arrived to go to the airport.  The free breakfast was very popular and I have included photos of when it was busy and when I caught it during a lull on Thursday after many people had left for the parade (Served from 6:00 to 10:00 a..m.).  I generally do not sleep well on my first night in a hotel but the bed was very comfortable and I got a great night's sleep both nights.  Many hotels have pillows that are too thick but the Hampton Inn had 4 pillows on our bed - two were thicker than I prefer but the other two were just right!  Kudos to them for providing two different sizes instead of taking the easy way out and just have one size fits all.  In the shower, there was a nice touch for the ladies -- in the corner there is a bar about 10"-12" off of the floor for you to rest your foot on while you shave your legs.  I must also add that the ladies in the breakfast area were also very nice, working continuously to keep everything replenished.  One also offered to take a photo of my wife and I when she saw us trying to get a good selfie!  Eggs and meat are present every morning but may be different each day -- we had scrambled eggs one morning with sausage patties and the next it was cheese omelets and sliced link sausage.  There are also juices, milk, cereal, various breads and rolls, two (2) toasters, smoothies, coffee, boiled eggs, and waffles!  There is sure to be something for everyone.  It is also convenient, only a short walk to the subway and several restaurants.  The hotel also provides coffee and water in the lobby 24 hours a day, as well as 3 computers for your use and a fitness room. If you want a different view than you have from your room, one of the elevators goes to a viewing area on the roof, which I believe is the 32nd floor.  We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and would not hesitate to stay there again.

title: Nice hotel close to theater district
text: Location was excellent. Room was very clean. Front desk super friendly. Breakfast was included and had some hot items. They offered free coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby. We only stayed one night but thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Talking with some people on the elevator, they said it was a little noisy by them, but it was very quiet by our room. Good value for the money and would definitely stay again if in town.

title: Celebrating a family birthday
text: Loved the location in Times Square, perfect walking distance to plays, Radio city music hall, and good restaurants.  The breakfast had a nice selection  and great coffee. The only complaint was the hallways were extremely warm. Will stay here again.

title: Thanksgivin trip
text: Siamo arrivati in questo dell'hotel scelto dalla Agenzia viaggi che aveva organizzato la nostra settimana di vacanza a NY. L'accoglienza è stata premurosa e veloce, siamo subito stati indirizzati alla nostra camera, non eccessivamente spaziosa ma pulita, confortevole e con un letto King size. Il bagno era molto spazioso con una doccia doppia e un bellissimo lavabo. L'albergo dispone di una palestra e offre caffè  e acqua gratuita.  La colazione è  ben fornita e di tipo americano. Curiosa anche la vista dal 31. Piano.

title: Way better out there
text: Very small common area for when checking in -not an open at all. You feel like the place is closing in on you. Rooms very small and heat wasn’t working right when we were there. Not worth the money in my opinion. Front desk attendant did not greet us nor was she friendly.

title: Perfect Location - Excellent staff
text: A great hotel that is in convenient to walk to most places including Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park and the Fashion District.  Staff was very attentive, and breakfast staff, always had a smile on their face.  We chose an upgrade to a city view and glad we spent the extra money,  We were in 3009 - from bed we could see the empire state building and its light shows.  We also could walk to the empire state building. For Times Square the room as ok in size small by midwest standards and good sized for New York.  The hotel goes up not out so each floor only  has about 8 rooms.  Never heard any of the other guests.  We were their five nights and would return to this  hotel again if we choose to come back to Times Square.

title: So so stay - thanksgiving.
text:
The best thing this hotel has going for it is the location. Convenient and safe. However their customer service is the worst we’ve experienced in NY. Checked in and our room was boiling hot. Turned on the air and left for 5 hours. Came back and it was even hotter. Called the desk and they sent a maintenance guy. He tinkered around and said “it should work now” but it was still blowing warm air (not hot now). Called back down to ask about a new room. Very rude. Had to basically threaten to call the cc company to cancel the payment to get a new room. Breakfast was good but so over crowded you couldn’t get to much of anything and the dining room has so many tables packed in you can barely walk thru. 
We had originally planned to stay wed-sun but there is a winter storm coming in so we decided to check out on Saturday. We go down to the desk to tell them that on Friday and are being told we will be charged $150 anyway. 
I would NEVER recommend this hotel just because of crappy customer service. We have found most service oriented people’s we have dealt with in the city to be exceptionally mice but not here. Haven’t dealt with a nice employee yet at this hotel.

title: Not a good value
text: Long waits for elevators. Crowded lobby. No Wi-Fi  service on the seventh floor. E key not functioning. Expensive room rate. Breakfast was fair. Room smelled like dirty feet. Not a great value. Would not stay again

title: Perfekte Lage im Theater Viertel
text: sehr angenehmer Aufenthalt ( nur 1 Nacht ) , fussläufig das Musical " Frozen" ( sehr schön ) erreichbar , angenehmer Service rundherum , Frühstück inkludiert, ruhiges sauberes Zimmer. wir haben uns sehr wohlgefühlt

title: Excelente hotel
text: Inmejorable ubicacion. Personal ambable. Desayuno correcto. Habitaciones comodas y limpias.  Cafe, te y agua de cortesia las 24 hs en lobby.  Amplio gimnasio y equipado. Personal amable dispuesto a ayudar.

title: A little gem in heart of city
text: Great hotel in an excellent location. Had a room on 5th floor and was really quiet for a good night's sleep. Hot breakfast was a bonus. All staff were friendly and really helpful. Would definitely stay again if ever in the city.

title: Hotel moderno e confortevole al centro di Manhattan
text: Ho soggiornato in questo hotel tra la fine di ottobre e l'inizio di novembre. Camere confortevoli e moderne, letto grande, televisore con centinaia di canali, doccia e bagno molto moderni. Al posto del frigobar c'è uno spazio nella reception con acqua, caffè e the a libero accesso, inoltre la mattina vengono preparati sacchetti con una piccola colazione per chi non può farla nella sala preposta e alla sera biscotti caldi. È possibile prenotare biglietti per spettacoli di Broadway, partite di basket ecc. Bisogna ricordarsi di portare l'adattatore per le prese americane, ma ci sono anche varie prese usb. Consigliato per chi vuole visitare Manhattan e Central Park per la sua ottima posizione.

title: Great location, awesome service
text:
On the morning of our arrival we received a super nice text message from Lilly saying that the hotel was looking forward to our stay, offering to do whatever it takes to make our stay an enjoyable one, and wishing us safe travels. What an impressive way to start the day and to make us feel that our business is valuable to them.
We arrived in the early afternoon and were greeted warmly by none other than Lilly herself. She immediately got us in checked in, made suggestions for where we would like our room (we chose the 25th floor), and got a young man to Valet park our car. She could not have been more gracious and sets the standard by which you would like to be treated upon arriving at a hotel. Well done Lilly!
Our room was spacious, very, very clean, and overall very comfortable. Our room had a city view which in itself was amazing. Breakfast in the morning was excellent and had a number of offerings including omelets, waffles,sausage, Danish, cereals, fruit and other assorted breakfast items. It was well stocked and plentiful. The breakfast room is larger than it looks when first entering and it too was ultra clean.
Service staff and maintenance people were abundant and every single one of them greeted you in a friendly manner and always with a nice smile and kind words.
I have seen other reviews where some people complained about the elevator service. I found the complaints to be completely unfounded as we never, not even once, had any issue with elevator service. We never waited more than a couple of minutes and once in, the elevator was fast. An added feature is that, elevators are not accessible unless you have your room key and swipe it. Once you swipe it, you can then select the floor that your room is located on.
The hotel is convenient to everything in Times Square. We walked to Radio City Music Hall, about a 15 minute walk that seemed shorter and to Rock Center which is across the street from RCMH. Those were the longest walks we had. Great restaurants, theatres, and numerous bars for a cocktail are abundant within a 5 or 10 minute stroll, or shorter, from the hotel.
Check out was smooth and efficient. The valet service does take a little bit of time as cars are parked at an off-site location.
Overall, this was truly an exceptional experience. The front desk service from Lilly, the housekeeping staff, breakfast room attendants, and the valet service combined with a clean, comfortable, and quiet room made for a very, very pleasant experience. 
We look forward to another stay at the Hampton Inn Times Square Central!

title: Breakfast with Benson
text: This hotel is perfect location wise, especially if you are visiting for theater. Breakfast every morning was a delight with variety. Benson was very attentive in the breakfast area and always accommodating making breakfast a pleasure.  We also enjoyed having warm beverages available in the lobby. The rooms were clean and we had a nice view. We recommend Hampton Inn Times Square, Central.

title: Estupenda relación calidad precio situación.
text:
Estupenda relación calidad precio situación. Buenísima  habitación, limpieza, almohadas, cama estupenda... Desayuno incluido que es importante por economía de tiempo y de dinero, ya que es una ciudad muy cara.
Hemos estado cuatro matrimonios, y todos hemos salido con la misma sensación buena del hotel. Lo recomiendo 100x100, volvería al mismo sin dudarlo.

title: Turismo
text: Excelente totalmente recomendable ....ubicación perfecta a tres cuadras de Times Square...habitaciones amplias y cómodas...dan todo lo necesario tanto en el desayuno como botellas de agua a piacere... dejan bolsas para take away para que te lleves una colación en tus paseos....siempre te y café en el lobby como en la habitación...volvería siempre .

title: Muy bien para ser Nueva York
text:
Un gran hotel para ser Nueva York y para verlo.

Recalcar, que es un gran hotel para ver Nueva York, debido a su ubicación que es excelente, al lado de la estación de autobuses, a un minuto escaso de la boca de metro de Times Square, y alrededor de todo tipo de servicios y zonas de interés.  También es un gran hotel para ser Nueva York, dado que dispone de desayuno incluido (muy pocos hoteles lo tienen) algo que te ayuda a coger fuerzas y comer algo bien en el día, y en el que no se te cobran las famosas tasas aparte y por sorpresa al llegar al hotel como también ocurre en la mayoría de hoteles de por allí.

Lo mejor:

- Como hemos comentado su ubicación, próxima al metro (parada de Times Square), a la estación de autobuses, a servicios y lugares de interés...

- No cobra las tasas por sorpresa, entiendo que ya van incluidas en el precio pero no te llevas el susto de aumentar en 500-600€ tu viaje una vez estando allí y pensando que tienes todo ya pagado como ocurre en otros.

- Desayuno incluido; como hemos comentado en NY la mayoría de los hoteles no lo tiene, por lo que prepara para gastar al menos entre 10 y 20 dólares por persona y día para "mal desayunar" por ahí; aquí, a pesar de que no es el típico desayuno de los hoteles españoles, tienes un buffet, que aunque algo repetitivo, cumple de sobras que puedas desayunar correctamente y coger fuerzas.  Hay leche (normal y desnatada), café, zumo (esto algo malo de máquina), nevera de zumo/batidos naturales, nevera de yogures, fruta (dos tipos distintos siempre que además es un detalle que te envuelvan en papel film para que te lo puedas llevar para almolzar a media mañana), 5 tipos distintos de cereales, sobres de tés, infusiones, "chocolate" que podría parecerse a nuestro cacao, varios tipos de panecillos (pan de molde, panecillo redondo, baggel), tostador, todo tipo de mantequilla, mermelada, queso de untar en mini tarrinas, dos bols de "comida caliente" donde suelen poner tortillas, bacon, huevos revueltos... y por último un par de máquinas de líquido para preparar gofres (de varios sabores) y tres gofreras, con los que poder hacerte un super gofre cada mañana, también tienes tarrinas de caramelo y por supuesto nata, y sirope de chocolate, fresa etc.  Como veis algo repetitivo si pasas muchos días allí, dado que el único cambio es la fruta (nosotros vimos naranja, manzana, plátano...) y la comida caliente que pasaba de tortilla, a huevos rotos, a bacon, salchichas, y algún día hamburguesa también; el resto son elementos fijos.
La capacidad de la zona de desayuno es pequeña (capacidad máxima para 100 personas y ten en cuenta que son 30 plantas), deberás bajar pronto si quieres coger mesa, o esperar un poco para poder hacerlo si bajas en horas puntas (también dejan sacar comida y vimos a gente desayunando en la zona de recepción o incluso subiéndolo a la habitación).

- La máquina de bebidas en recepción; a pesar de que lo que encuentres sea sencillamente agua (tanto fría como caliente), y sobres para hacer tés o chocolate, está muy bien para cuando llegas, con sed o con frío, poder beberte tu vaso de agua fresca y posteriormente  subirte con tu chocolate caliente a la habitación.  Es sobre de chocolate, que disuelves en agua, por lo que no es un chocolate propiamente, pero sienta bien, sobre todo si le añades alguna tarrina de leche o crema que también están a disposición.

- La mini tienda que hay en recepción; no es barata, aunque tampoco excesivamente cara comparado con el resto de precios de la ciudad, dispones de varias cosas: galletas, todo tipo de bebidas, una nevera con pizzas congeladas, sopas de fideos de estas tipicas de llegar y preparar con agua, y un microondas; si algún día llegas cansado y sin ganas de comer nada por ahí, sabes que dispones de esto para comer algo.

Lo peor:

- Al ser un hotel tan grande (30 plantas), a pesar de la disponibilidad de 3 ascensores, en algún momento de hora punta, por la mañana, se hacían insuficientes; nosotros alojados en la planta 10 optamos por bajar andando en varias ocasiones, dado que esperabas y cuando llegaban a la planta 10 ya paraban llenos de las plantas superiores; y solo bajamos los días que esperábamos poco rato o para el check out que lógicamente íbamos cargados con las maletas.

- Lo mismo, al ser un hotel con tanta capacidad, la zona de desayuno, con capacidad máxima para 100 personas, también se queda corta; en este sentido nosotros como madrugábamos bastante nunca tuvimos que esperar por una mesa, pero sí veíamos al irnos a hacer turismo gente desayunando de pie, o en zona de recepción o subiéndose la comida a la habitación para no esperar, porque en horas puntas es difícil encontrar sitio (el desayuno es de 6 a 10 de la mañana) y a partir de 8-8:30 es cuando empezaba a ponerse imposible, nosotros a las 7-7:30 nunca tuvimos problema.  Mejor bajar, desayunar y prepararte en la habitación después para salir.

En realidad no hubo nada suficientemente malo, y las cosas buenas, creemos que son muy buenas para visitar esta ciudad.  Las habitaciones limpias, modernas y amplias, también tranquilas y con un buen descanso a pesar de donde te encuentras, y el personal amable también.  Bien equipadas con plancha, tabla de planchar, caja fuerte y máquina de cafés en la habitación). También buena climatología propia en tu habitación tanto como para frío como para calor.

En conclusión recomendaríamos alojarte aquí, si tu intención es visitar Nueva York.

title: Hampton Inn Times Square Central
text: For vacationers it’s the perfect location, a block and a half away from Times Square. Check-in and check-our were easy; the room, though not very large, is pretty comfortable. The water pressure in the shower could be a little higher, for a better showering experience. The hotel provides a very good breakfast on a self- service basis (always crowded the breakfast room, which should be a little larger). Water, tea, coffee and a chocolate drink are always available at the reception and at 5 PM they also provide guests with delicious cookies. A gym for workout is located in the basement, next to the laundry. Wi-fi worked well everywhere in the hotel. All in all we had a very nice stay at this hotel.

title: Great stay
text: Check in was quick with friendly and helpful desk clerks. Very convenient to everything we wanted to do around Times Square and beyond. Clean room. Fast elevators. Appreciated the concierge who reserved a shuttle to Newark airport.

title: Great central location near Times Square and multiple theaters
text: I just returned from four nights at this Hampton Inn, and it was a very good experience.  While the traffic could sometimes get a little noisy, the hotel is just far enough away from two major intersections to provide a respite from much of the outside hustle and bustle.  The rooms and bathrooms were very clean and nicely updated, and there were no stains or signs of wear on the furniture and bedding. The employees stood out for their friendliness; every time a member of the maintenance department was on the elevator, they greeted the other passengers, and several times I witnessed the breakfast staff cheerfully helping fulfill an individual request in the midst of very crowded dining room. While I did not use the services of the concierge, it was good to know that this was an option. During my visit it was quite cold outside, but the complimentary coffee/tea/hot water station in the lobby was always amply stocked and free from litter.  These fine points can make all the difference to a busy traveler, and I greatly appreciate how well this hotel treated its guests.

title: Very nice Hampton Inn
text: The hotel is an older building which has been recently modernized and updated very nicely. I was quite happy with the service from the staff, quite happy with the room I was given. The breakfast area was a bit cramped with all the people, but the actual size of the room where breakfast was served was very large. I am sure its normal congestion since Times Square is a popular visit location.

title: Terrific location
text: The hotel was perfectly located in Times Square and we could walk everywhere.  The lobby was spacious and the included breakfast was very good.  A staff member showed us how to get to the 911 Museum on the subway map which as was appreciated.  Each member we had contact with was pleasant & helpful.  The coffee, tea & hot chocolate in the lobby was nice to have available anytime.  Our room was comfortable and quiet except for the ice machine outside our door.  I’d ask for a different room the next time! We’d definitely stay there if we’re in the area again.

title: Rude Staff, includes Manager. The HGI nearby is better.
text: I found staff at this hotel to be short and unprofessional with guests. I over heard a conversation between a guest and the front desk where an employee spoke aggressive. I had a desk agent bite my head off for where I set my phone at the hotel coffee stand one morning. Who really cares where I set my phone down. Upon check out I asked for a balanced receipt. There was a $2.00 difference in the two nights I was there. Every hotel does this for their elite diamond members. The manager was standing right there and took zero interest in helping. His exact reply was "we don't do that". I can see why the staff is the was they are.

title: Great Times Square Hotel
text: Stayed at this hotel when we did a girls’ weekend to see a Broadway show. It has a great location and the staff was awesome. The hotel is very clean and the breakfast was really good. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Reliable
text: Everything is great, but skip the breakfast line. It's manic. Rates can get pretty high, in which case, look elsewhere. Rooms are modern, staff is friendly. This is a high-traffic, center of Times Square, hotel.

title: Lovely hotel
text: 2 nights stay and lovely hotel great location staff friendly and helpful. Lovely touch with tea and coffee available in lobby 24/7. Comfy bed. Only thing I would advise is that the TV is mounted on the wall giving more surface space in the rooms as a bit limited.

title: Zentral am Times Square
text:
Die Lage ist hervorragend, direkt am Times Square und der Subway.
Das Zimmer war groß und sauber. Es ist straßenseitig sehr, sehr laut! Auch die Klimaanlage lärmt mächtig.
Frühstück: na ja. Erstmal muss man sich an Papp- und Plastikgeschirr gewöhnen. Dann sollte man es eher süß mit Backwaren mögen. Aber Tee und Kaffee, Toast, Bagels, Smoothies, Joghurt etc. sind immer verfügbar. Allerdings ist der Frühstücksraum schnell überfüllt.
Das Personal an der Rezeption ist freundlich, aber kurz angebunden.
Fazit: Wem die zentrale Lage zum fairen Preis wichtig ist, der ist gut bedient.

title: TOP prijs/kwaliteit, klassevol en zeer proper hotel op zalige locatie
text: ik was er samen met mijn man en zoon van 14 jaar. hotel heeft een topligging op wandelafstand van alles. kamers waren op en top in orde, altijd lekkere en gratis koffie :) ik kom hier zeker terug. enige minpuntje is de drukke ochtenden aan het ontbijt, net iets te kleine ruimte voor alle gasten, soms is het zoeken naar een tafeltje en het eten met plastiek bestek en bordjes was net iets minder. laat dit je zeker niet tegen houden want het hotel is echt een aanrader. top prijs kwaliteit verhouding.

title: posizione perfetta, camera confortevole, bagno pulito, colazione non all'altezza
text: Hotel in pieno centro e servilissimo dalle metropolitane. Silenzioso. Camere confortevoli (anche se piccole ma siamo a New York), bagno pulito. Prima colazione molto caotica, cibo non all'altezza, sala colazione decisamente sottodimensionata e spesso era impossibile trovare posto per sedersi. Ascensori sottodimensionati: la mattina salire e scendere era decisamente molto difficoltoso)

title: Great midtown option
text: Stayed for five nights in a family room during the October half-term. From check-in onwards staff were consistently excellent, being both polite and helpful. Our room was on the 12th floor and at the front of the building, directly over 41st Street and we had no issues with noise. Even with two double beds the room was a decent enough size for the four of us. The buffet breakfast set us up well each day (my daughter was particularly taken with the waffle station); as we tended to wake up early we missed the busier times, but when the breakfast room did get full staff (Geraldine stood out) were great at helping people find somewhere to sit. Would definitely stay again if in NYC.

title: Great Service, Completely satisfied guest
text:
The staff was great!  A Tremenodous THANK YOU TO Andrea for bringing a refrigerator up for me and reprogramming the TV in my room.  He was very prompt, courteous and professional.  

Also I have to acknowledge Mrs. Dellia, Mr. Emmanjuel for the non stop laughs we shared.

To Olivia, Rachelle. Katherine, both of the Doormen and the rest of the staff members,

title: Great Midtown Value
text: I needed to be near Times Square and chose this hotel for its good rate. Having been in several "surprising" NYC hotels before I was very pleasantly surprised at the opulent lobby and recently renovated rooms - contemporary design, not unlike HOME2, which I really love.  Staff was great as well.

title: Excellent séjour
text:
Nous venons de passer cinq jours dans cet hôtel à deux pas de Times Square. 
La chambre, au 21e étage, était confortable et spacieuse. Une vue exceptionnelle sur Manhattan a apporté un agrément sans pareil à cette chambre.
L’emplacement est idéal pour rayonner plus facilement vers toute la ville.
Les deux seuls bémols viennent de l’attente des ascenseurs et de la trop petite salle du petit-déjeuner, gérable en déjeunant avant 8 heures. Un breakfast bag est également disponible si vous loupez le petit déjeuner. 
Celui-ci est très bien achalandé et il y a de quoi se remplir l’estomac pour partir en vadrouille ensuite.
A noter aussi pour nous est la qualité de l’accueil et de l’écoute. En effet, notre fille venait de se faire une entorse au pied avant le voyage et lui était interdit de poser le pied pendant  10 jours, d’où un séjour qui s’annonçait compliqué... La personne de l’accueil a tout de suite mis à notre disposition pour la durée du séjour et sans supplément une chaise roulante qui nous a permis de visiter NYC. Pour cela, un immense merci et beaucoup de gratitude !

title: Great hotel in the heart of Times Square!
text: My mom, two girls and I stayed here for 4 nights. The buffet breakfast was great and had lots of options. Geraldine, Andre and Benson worked so hard at breakfast and always had smiles on their faces! The room was clean and had plenty of space. The hotel was close to Broadway musicals (Frozen was awesome!), Times Square, and had lots of places to eat close by. Jeremy at the front desk was helpful each night- My mom fell one day and he got her ice for her knee each night. He also had a smile on his face whenever we saw him. This hotel overall had wonderful customer service!

title: Super
text: Hotel vraiment très bien placé, 2 stations à distance très proche, donc idéal car il y a à peu prés toutes les lignes dont on a besoin pour visiter NYC. Le personnel était charmant et à l’écoute. Les chambres sont vraiment correctes surtout pour le temps que l'on y reste dedans. Le petit déjeuner est top car il y a franchement un grand choix, œufs (brouillés, à la coque, omelette), saucisses, bacon, pain, muffins, gaufres, yaourts, fruits et toutes les boissons dont on a besoin pour un petit déjeuner, le seul bémol est la place car l'espace n'est pas très grand donc parfois il faut attendre avant de trouver une place mais cela va vite quand même.

title: Ótimo
text: O hotel é muito bem localizado, estando a meio quarteirão de Port Authority e da estação Times Square do metrô. Os funcionários são muito atenciosos. Fornece café da manhã incluso e academia e tem máquinas de lavar e secar roupa. Fomos muito bem atendidos e pretendemos voltar.

title: Excellent stay - great location
text:
We stayed here with Virgin Holidays for four nights.

We were greeted and booked in without any delay. They did swipe our debit card for a room deposit when checking in. But this was refunded when checking out.

We were given a choice of Rooms and floors. We choose the 19 floor and the room was clean and spacious. Lifts are busy but not an issue. 

The room had Two double beds, tv, towels, and toiletries. Really clean and serviced daily.

Free tea, coffee,  hot chocolate and iced water available in the reception all day and night.

Lovely free cookies from 5pm daily.

Cooked breakfast daily included which is buffet style.

A small shop in hotel reception which has oops forgot products and snacks.

A great hotel in a great location where we got a great night sleep and were always made to feel welcome.

title: Great place
text: This was a great hotel in a super location for seeing shows! Staff was wonderful and the hotel was quiet even on the second floor. This will now be our favorite place to stay with our family. Absolutely great!!!

title: Só peca no café da manhã
text: Tudo muito bom: localização, atendimento, acomodações, limpeza. Só pecam no café da manhã:  é muito diferente do café da manhã do Brasil. O café da manhã americano possui muito açúcar e gordura, poucas frutas, muitos doces. O nosso é bem mais saudável e saboroso. Mas entendo que isto é uma característica da cultura americana.

title: Polite staff and great stay
text:
I rarely write a review of a place, but I was so impressed by the staff here that I have to commend them.  We stayed here last weekend and the entire kitchen staff was nothing but wonderful to our family and went above and beyond every breakfast to check in with us and make sure we had what we needed. 
Lily was also perfect at the front desk and texted us immediately to provide early check in as soon as our room was ready.  Everyone was so helpful and polite and it is refreshing to see this.  It really made our vacation a great experience.
Thank you.

title: Hampton Inn is conveniently located and a good value
text:
Location is a couple blocks from Time Square, the hotel is very clean and neat. I was very pleased with the room size - which for NY was generous. The elevators get busy but it was only a couple minutes wait at the busies times.
Overall I recommend the Hampton Inn very highly.

title: Habitaciones pequeñas pero buena ubicacion
text: Estuvimos 4 noches en NY el hotel esta muy bien ubicado. El personal de lobby nos atendió muy bien. El desayuno gratis es bueno solo que se llena muy rápido el área para comer. Muy bien que en el lobby ponen agua caliente para té y hay café. Habitaciones pequeñas en comparación con el precio que pagas pero pues es NY. Buena vista desde el piso 26. Pudiera decir que el único detalle es que nunca aspiraron la alfombra y no cambiaron los cobertores y el principal lo pequeño de las camas que son matrimoniales. Pero pues en realidad ni estuvimos casi en todo el día puesto que andábamos recorriendo la bella Nueva York! Segura el area alrededor del hotel. Si regresaría a hospedarme.

title: Housekeeping and Engineering Didn't Come Through
text:
This is my go-to hotel in NYC.  It's very central and I have never had an issue until this stay.  The front desk and bell continues to be incredibly helpful, polite and kind.
Upon entering my room, I shut the bathroom door fro the outside and it locked itself.  I tried several methods (again, I was on the outside of the door) to no avail.  I called the front desk three times and it just rang and rang.  I then tried calling the direct number from my cell and after 5 rings someone picked up then immediately hung up on me.  I then used the text service without any response.  I eventually got the front desk and someone arrived rather quickly.
My bigger issue was with housekeeping.  I was only staying for two nights and had my DND sign up and my room was still entered and cleaned.  This might seem petty however in hospitality it is a simple and important rule to not enter and clean when service is not requested.
One of the elevators was down intermittently which again has been an issue all 6 items I've stayed.  
Tips - give yourself extra time to get up or down the elevator and plan to stand or take your breakfast to your room.  

Hopefully these items can be addressed and I can put this one back on my list!

title: Reasonably Priced Accommodations In A Prime Location
text: This Hampton Inn is located on West 41st Street between 7th and 8th Avenues. It is a few blocks from Times Square and in the Theater District. Front desk staff, bellman, concierge and breakfast buffet staff were all very friendly and ready to answer any questions with helpful advice and suggestions. They even secured us excellent car transportation to LaGuardia at a better price than UBER. Rooms are reasonably sized and very clean. Hot breakfast buffet was good and they advised us on best times to eat. 24 hour coffee and hot chocolate in the lobby was nice to have and always better than coffee brewed in the room. Rooms facing the street at lower levels may experience some street noise if you are there when trash is collected. Rooms facing away from the street were quiet, even if near the elevators. Easy connectivity to subway lines and Grand Central Terminal. I would stay here again.

title: Ottimo compromesso
text: Posizione strategica e camere confortevoli (letto top!), buoni i servizi generali e le dotazioni. Nota di merito per la colazione: completa, comincia alle 6 del mattino. Ideale per chi deve fare escursioni (punto di ritrovo della maggior parte delle escursioni a meno di 10’ a piedi), che spesso partono alle 7.

title: NYC First Time
text: Great service and location to transportation - did not like the hectic and dirtiness of the surrounding area - but liked ths location for access to transportation and theatres and food choices. Probably won't stay in the theatre district again, but did like that we got a pretty good deal with airline and hotel package. Breakfast was good but super crowded. There was not enough seating for guests.

title: NYSE company up list stay!
text: Great stay in Time Square NYC. Business trip, this hotel was a great location for all the places I needed to be for business meetings and to see a show, eat nice dinners and enjoy the things NYC has to offer!!!

title: Great location and good hotel
text:
Me and my wife went to Manhattan with another couple and booked this hotel for our first 4 nights. Took care of all booking and comminication with the hotel through the Hilton Honors app and it worked very good from things like late arrival notice and also hotel management asked for feedback on our stay even during our stay.

Rooms were very nice and since we lived on 30th floor it was as quite as it can get in Manhattan. Othee facilities were also good and the service for getting tickets and other valuable things for our stay was great!

The location of the hotel is just brilliant if you want to be in the middle everyrhing, we loved it!

Only thing that we think can be improved would be breakfast. It was rather ok if comparing with also other hotels we have stayed at earlier in NY but they could add somw vegatables and the one time plates, forks and knifes would be great to have real once. Also very busy breakfast restaurant during peak hours.

Overall again a really great stay and very good value for the money paid. We will definatly consider comming back.

title: Massive Thanks
text: Just spent 5 days staying at this hotel and I would like to say a big thank you! All members of staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was excellent, with a variety of food and a different cooked breakfast each morning. Yes! It is busy but be patient and a table will soon become available. Cannot thank the catering staff enough!! Geraldine, Benson, Cienah, Francis, Andre and Nordia went out of their way to help, even when they were obviously rushed off their feet, thank you guys 👍🏻 Finally, Anna the cleaner left our room clean every day, with new linen and towels. Thank you all, I will be back 🙏

title: toplage
text: wir wählten auf unsereren zweiten reise nach new york, hampton inn manhattan, man ist sehr zentral gelegen , zu diversen sehenswürdigkeiten, guten restaurants. die zimmer sind geräumig, und ruhig. dass frühstück, abwechslunsreich und lecker, dass personal freundlich, und hilfsbereit.

title: Comfort hotel
text:
This hotel is in a great location.  We had a warm welcome.  Complimentary cookies and a good selection of hot drinks in reception.  Large room with queen size bed, which was very comfortable, hence we enjoyed good nights sleep!  The room was very very clean and in good condition. The only thing  I would say is there is a lack of hanging space for dresses, so I left used wardrobe for open to hang up my dress.  A hook on the wall would help.  
The reason for not giving 5 stars was because of the use of paper crockery and plastic cutlery, which surprised me. Firstly, everyone is trying to do there bit for the environment, I cannot imagine the amount of waste this is accumulating. 
Secondly, it is not nice eating with plastic cutlery,  sorry Hampton, please look into this.  For the price of your rooms, I would not expect this.  
Otherwise a good, comfortable and conveniently located hotel.

title: Surprise even for a Hampton Inn
text: Our first choice is always Hampton Inn and this one exceeded our expectations.  Great fitness room.  Great location, easy access to attractions and transportation and restaurants.  Friendly staff.  We faced opposite 41st street and it was quiet enough at night.

title: Great location and value
text: Great location in the Theater district.  My first trip to New York and I experienced "sticker shock" when looking at hotel prices so I wanted to stay at a hotel I could trust and Hampton did not disappoint.  Friendly, clean with a great complimentary breakfast buffet and close to everything we wanted to do.  We were pleasantly surprised at how quiet the room was - no street noise or sirens that could be heard.  Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Decent value
text: Hotel offers decent value Decent and a great location.  Staff was polite and efficient.  The hotel has several little personal touches that set it apart from other places in the city.  Make you feel very welcome and valued as a customer.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: I could not have asked for a better location for a hotel in NYC - especially if you want to be right in the heart of the Theatre District. On my way to the city, I received a text from the hotel welcoming me, and that set the tone for my brief stay. The check-in line was short, the room was perfect, the beds comfortable, and the breakfast was incredible. Was it crowded? Sure, but you don't always get a free breakfast in NYC hotels, and this one was superb. If I had any complaint, it was that the elevators were a bit slow, but really, that's not a terrible concern. This is a family-friendly hotel, with wonderful amenities, and I would definitely consider staying here again.

title: Centrale e defilato
text:
Hotel abbastanza nuovo, ubicato sulla 41a incrocio con la 7a. Insomma, a due passi dal centro . Ma anche a due passi dalla 5a e da tutto il resto. 
Quindi posizione perfetta. 
Hall non molto grande , ma con salottini d'attesa e angolo caffè , tè ed acqua . Da segnalare i biscotti caldi che arrivano nel pomeriggio per la merenda. 
Camere grandi ed accoglienti,che a New York non è proprio la regola. Bagno grande e nuovo. 
Colazione , con aria da igloo, ben fornita di tutto: compresa la possibilità di farsi al momento dei waffle come si vuole . 
Unico neo, quando si arriva verso le 8/8.30 , la sala colazioni è piena e bisogna aspettare che si liberi un posto. 
Wi fi incluso , phon presente ed anche tv a schermo piatto. Prese usb sparse per la stanza .
Unico disguido : una sera un ragazzo dello staff ci ha procurato 5 taxi. 
Due sere dopo,ho chiesto altrei 5 taxi, ma,  la ragazza alla reception,  mi ha detto  che l'hotel non chiama i taxi . Arrangiatevi. 
Per il resto tutti gentili. Basta chiedere in reception e ti danno una bottiglietta d'acqua gratuita  quando vuoi. Inoltre , se dovete spedire una cartolina (si, lo so che non si usa più), potete darla in reception e pensano loro alla spedizione .  
Ricordatevi che i francobolli si comprano in farmacia. Si, avete letto bene. 
Consigliato a tutti.

title: Great location
text: Excellent location just off Times Square. Room was small but functional and clean. Good size bathroom. Bed very comfortable. Excellent nights sleep every night. We were on 26th floor so no noise during the night either. Added bonus of breakfast every morning which meant that you could leave the hotel and get on with exploring. Good choice of food and drinks available. Free tea, coffee and water available throughout the day in reception. Would definitely stay here again if we come back to NY.

title: Great location
text:
We stayed here for 8 nights in September 2019.

This is a really good hotel in an excellent location. Both Times Square and the Port Authority Bus Station subway stations are just a few minutes walk away, making it easy to get to the various sights around the city. Despite the hotel being in a very busy area, it was quiet at night. The rooms are fairly small, but we weren’t in the room a great deal so this wasn’t a problem. We had a king bed, which was very comfortable and we slept well.

Breakfast is included in the room rate, and there is a good selection of food available. Although the breakfast area was very busy, we never had to wait more than a minute to find a table. We were well looked after by Geraldine, who came to have a chat with us every morning about our plans for the day, which was a really nice way to start the day.

All the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and we found the hotel to be a perfect base for sightseeing in New York. This would be our first choice hotel if we were in New York again.

title: Hôtel à recommander
text: Idéalement placé (proche métro), établissement propre avec chambres confortables et pas bruyantes. Rapport qualité/prix tout à fait correct. Personnel sympathique. De plus, cet hôtel propose le petit-déjeuner ce qui n'est pas forcément courant dans le secteur.

title: Times Square Central
text: Very clean and welcoming. Great location! Rooms were nice and ok in size. I had never been to NYC so I had only heard of the rooms there being extremely small.  I would definitely stay there again if I’m ever in NYC again.

title: Great location and daily breakfast
text: Great location and daily breakfast.  Walkable to Times Square, theatre district, subway across the street.  Staff was wonderful! Beds super comfy! The only thing missing was a bar during the evening but the Gleaton’s pub is right Nextdoor.

title: Super zentral gelegenes Hotel
text: Gutes Hotel in Manhattan, super zentral gelegen, sauber und freundlich, nur Frühstück ist für deutsche Verhältnisse sehr schlecht, Qualität und Auswahl an Speisen, kostenloser Kaffee und Tee in der Lobby

title: New York New York
text: Cannot understand why anyone would not like this hotel. Great position, just off Times Square. Lovely rooms, quiet and spacious. Great breakfast, lovely staff, would like to Mention Olivia on reception and Geraldine  the breakfast supervisor but they were all brilliant. Couldn’t fault them. I have stayed in many hotels in NY over the years but if I come again this is where I am going to stay. Thank you

title: Wonderful and comfy
text: Nice hotel. Love the security feature in the elevators. Great thought out feature. Room clean and love the thought put into the astethic of the room. So many TV channels first I have ever had that experience. Live layout.

title: Not your normal Hilton-class hotel
text: This hotel is strictly for tourists. Beds were very hard and not comfortable to sleep in. Morning breakfast was average, and was always crowded. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. Location in the middle of times square and surrounded by over-priced restaurants. 31 Floor and about 12 rooms per floor.

title: Fabulous Hotel
text: We have just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at this hotel.i cannot rate it highly enough!! The location is perfect-just off Times Square. Our room was immaculate..we requested a high floor and had lovely views. Breakfast is included for everyone and we all thoroughly enjoyed the selection every morning. We particularly really liked Geraldine the breakfast supervisor,she is such a lovely person and very knowledgeable.she made our breakfast a great experience!!!it was such a great start to every day. Also there are no resort fees. I am hoping to return to this hotel next year.wonderful staff and wonderful memories.

title: Friendly smiles in NYC
text: This is a great convenient location, the rate was very reasonable and included an excellent breakfast.  Nice work out room too.  We were warmly welcomed by Ferrel, and he sent a welcome email before our arrival.  We really enjoyed Geraldine Meehan, and her smiles and eagerness to help at breakfast.  Overall, a great experience and stay!

title: Great location and comfortable stay!
text:
Reception was efficient. 

I liked that the hotel was very close to the subway, and action. The bed was very comfortable, and sound proofing was great, even with the lift outside our door, we hardly heard anything. 

There’s also a laundry room, with efficient dryers that dried all our laundry in one round. 

The breakfast had two hot items, eggs of some type and sausages or bacon. You can also make your own waffles. Otherwise there was juice, milk, cereals, bread, yoghurt and fruit. There’s also Geraldine who was a joy to have around. She makes sure the breakfast area is in tip top condition.

I was a little conscious that we were using a lot of disposable paper plates, cups and plastic utensils. So guests may want to bring their own reusable utensils and crockery.

title: よかったです
text: 大変居心地のよいホテルです。廊下の空調はちょっと暑かったけど、ロビーもアットホームな感じで、朝食もよかった。朝食のサービスのマネージャも大変親切でハッピーな気分にさせてくれました。

title: Perfect location in Times Square
text:
I don't think you can find a better overall hotel in this area!  It is just a block or two off the craziness of Times Square with a subway stop right across the street from the hotel. It's a close walk to the Theaters and many restaurants.  One of the best parts was having a breakfast included before starting our busy day.  Yes the breakfast room does get busy as mentioned but we always found a seat and there is additional seating in the lobby if you make a plate and take it out there.
